description: SAXTONS RIVER, Vt., Oct. 2Williston scored 15 points each in the first and fourth quarters to defeat Vermont Academy, 3012, today in the opener for both teams. Jeff Yelle scored twice for the winners on a pass from Ted Dane and with an intercepted pass.

title: Miss Susan Lins, W. N. Jackson 3d Have Wedding
description: BUCK HILL FALLS, Pa., Oct. 2Miss Susan Kingsbury Lins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John P. Lins of New York and Buck Hill Falls, was married here this afternoon at the home of her parents to William Newton Jackson 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jackson Jr. of Salisbury, Md.

title: Media
description: WASHINGTONThe press is jittery. Its representatives and friends appeared last week before the Senate subcommittee on Constitutional Rights and its highly sympathetic chairman, Sam J. Ervin Jr., to warn in the strongest terms that the First Amendment was in jeopardy.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: DWIGHT F. MORSS
description: NEW VERNON, N.J., Oct. Dwight F. Morss, who retired as an engineer for the long lines division of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company in 1954, died yesterday. He was 81 years old and lived at Glen Alpine Road.

title: Anne Rothman Bride
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y. Oct 2  Miss Anne Carol Rothman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jesse Rothman, was married here today at the home of her parents to Kenneth Alan Hicks, son of the Rev. and Mrs. Robert Hicks of Parkland, Pa., where Mr. Hicks is minister of the Presbyterian Church. State Supreme Court Justice Morris Aarons performed the ceremony. The bride's father is a lawyer.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: DEMOCRATS TO GET COUNTY CHALLENGE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 2Long simmering conflicts within the Democratic party in Westchester County will come into the open Monday night when the Concerned Democrats formally challenge the county leadership position of Max Berking at the biennial party convention.

title: Nebraska Trounces Utah State, 42 to 6, as Tagge Paces Attack
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Oct. 2 (UPI) Jerry Tagge passed for two touchdowns and ran for two more in a 426 victory for the No. 1ranked Nebraska Cornhuskers over Utah State today.

title: Masterson in Tennis Final
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 2Harris Masterson of Harvard defeated Dirk Dugan of Cornell, 63, 36, 119, and Larry Loeb of Penn, 62, 46, 64, today and advanced to tomorrow's final of the Eastern College Athletic Conference's fall tennis tournament. Masterson will oppose John Adams of Penn, who defeated Tom Wright of Penn State, 63, 6.0, and Ken Lindner of Harvard, 64, 75.

title: Sunday Without Tears, shout Pity
description: IN view of all the dreary, mindless and rotten movies that had been opening in New York recently, cornnig upon John Sehlesinger's Sunday Bloody Sunday two weeks ago was as restorative (as fantastic, really) as finding Penelope Gilliatt, who is a real person, in the audience at one of those Bayer Aspirin seminars. You've seen them, I'm sure, on televisionseminars at which The Man from Bayer answers questions about hufferants, asked by actors who are meant to represent people with civilized interests, but whose intense preoccupation with aspirin seems to suggest that they are, in fact, sobersided idiots, traumatized refugees from the America, just outside the door, that's become too much for them.

title: Child to Peter Barths
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Oct. 2A daughter was born here on Sept. 4 to Mr. and Mrs. Peter S. Barth at the Holy Cross Hospital. Mrs. Barth is the former Miss Nancy Boor. Her husband is executive director of the National Commission on State Workmen's Compensation Laws in Washington. The child has been named Linda Miriam.

title: ELSAABEE IS VICTOR IN HARRISON SHOW
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Oct. 2Rita Grenci rode Elsadbee, small Arabian, to the preliminary jumper championship with 16 points today at the Harrison fall horse show.

title: Spain Penalizes Santana
description: MADRID, Oct. 2 (UPI)The Spanish Tennis Federation barred Manuel Santana, the former Wimbledon champion, from competition for one month today, because he bypassed the National championships last month.

title: New Sports Arena
description: Sports fans who have been getting an unaskedfor education in law and finance in recent years are about to get one in politics, thanks to the congressional hearings which began Sept. 12 concerning the proposed merger of the National and American Basketball Associations.

title: Crime Found to Be a Potent Economic Force in BedfordStuyvesant
description: A federally financed study has found that organized crime, through its illegal policy, or numbers, operations, has become a major economic force in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: GOALBY SETS PACE IN GOLF LOOP EVENT
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 2 (Canadian Press)  Bob Goalby took top honors in the proamateur tournament debut of the Professional Golf League today.

title: The World
description: The middleaged guard in the Athens courtroom shook his head ruefully and muttered: But she is a prisoner. This isn't a reception. The object of his irritation was 62yearold Lady Fleming, widow of the discoverer of penicillin, and one of five persons on trial last week for their parts in an unsuccessful plot to help a wouldbe assassin of Greek Premier Papadopoulos escape from prison. As the guard complained, Greekborn Lady Fleming, who holds both Greek and British citizenship, chatted and joked and embraced friends. Sandwiches were passed back and forth over the wooden, railing separating spectators, newsmen and lawyers from the accused.

title: Housing and Unemployment Key Issues in Hempstead
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I.As the election campaign gets under way, housing and unemployment seem to be shaping up as the key issues in races for offices in the Town of Hempstead.

title: $200,000 Explorer Feature of Display At Annapolis Show
description: An array of boats ranging in size from the 75foot ocean racer, Southern Star to the diminutive 6foot Atlantic Pixie Row dinghy, and in price from the $200,000 Alden Boothbay Explorer motorsailer to a $68 pram, will be on display at the United States Sailboat Show at Annapolis, Md.

title: Palace of the Dance Lends Elegance To Peeling Section of Brooklyn
description: What on earth did I first know about Brooklyn? A bridge went there, a tree grew there, Walt Whitman was brought up there. Once in New York on a visit, I tried to get there by subway. I got lost and never arrived.

title: The Nation
description: SAIGONFor President Nguyen Van Thieu, the sole candidate in today's Presidential election, it was a fairly easy campaign. He remained close to the Presidential Palace, made four television speeches and one trip to the countryside, tended to the nation's problems and watched his favorite television programs on the American military network  boxing, wrestling, football and Mission Impossible.

title: The World
description: HONG KONG  October 1, Communist China's National Day, has come and gone, and observances of the occasion in Peking have shed little light on the possible difficulties within the Communist regime about which the world has been speculating for the past two weeks. In fact, the nature of the observances is likely to heighten rather than diminish speculation.

title: Miss Hoopes, A Bank Aide, Becomes Bride
description: GREENVILLE, Del., Oct. 2  The marriage of Miss Elizabeth Coudon Hoopes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Coudon Hoopes, to Robert Bunten Field Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Field of Norwell and Monument Beach, Mass., took place here this afternoon. The Rev. John O'Hear performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church, Christiana Hundred.

title: Shellfish Grounds Opened Off Norwalk and Westport
description: NORWALK, Conn., Oct. 2Major shellfishing grounds off the Norwalk and Westport shoreline have been conditionally reopened to commercial and individual harvesters following a closed period of three months because of pollution.

title: Escaping the inner prison through the solitary labor of writing
description: Condemned to solitude, overwhelmed by a sense of her grotesque ugliness, irremediably guilty from the start by the fact of her illegitimacy, by the fault of her birth and also by her identity as female and inferior, Violette Leduc places herself among the damned and the possessed. She is humiliated by others; she seeks to erase herself, to excuse herself for the sin of claiming attention, while at the same time detesting her solitude, reaching passionately toward otners, especially those she can never really touch. She stifles within her flesh, as Simone de Beauvoir puts it her flesh which is both what she sees as the hideous disproportion of her face and the erotic vitality of her body. Suffocation and eroticism both mark her writing, which is animated by a furious lucidity and a violent lyricism.

title: the traveler's world
description: HAVING investigated last week the complicated mechanism of the air bag that is supposed to protect automobile passengers from crash injuries, let us now look into the arguments for and against compulsory installation of them in all new automobiles to be sold in the United States beginning Aug. 15, 1973.

title: ENEMY STEPS UP SHELLING ATTACKS
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Sunday, Oct. 3 (AP)Enemy forces reportedly doubled their shelling attacks across South Vietnam overnight and fired three rockets into Saigon early today, just a few hours before the polls opened for the presidential election.

title: CARRIER DEPARTS AMID PROTESTERS
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 2  When the aircraft carrier Constellation, which has been the target of antiwar demonstrators for six months, sailed for Vietnam yesterday, the military security was the tightest witnessed around this Navy base since World War II.

title: P.O.W. Arithmetic
description: The campaign to free American P.O.W.'s has been clouded by confusion about their numbers. President Nixon this year spoke of 1,600 Americans in North Vietnam's jails. In fact, it will be a stroke of good fortune if even half the 1,623 Americans listed ty the Defense Department as captured or missing in action prove to be alive.

title: Et Al.
description: From the recent incursions of Soviet ships on American lobster traps to the aggressive presence of the Soviet Navy in the Mediterranean, the evidence accumulates that the U.S.S.R. is a seapower. This has serious implications for the United States, which since World War II has enjoyed unchallenged control of the sea in its military adventures. Mr. Fairhall gives the historical background of the Russian Navy  Russia's geographical obstacles to sea power, its humiliations at the hands of the Japanese, the geopolitical reasons behind its ceaseless search for access to the ocean; then discusses the ships in the, present navy and merchant marine and finally assesses emerging Russian naval policy. He concludes that the Soviet Navy has become an offensive force, capable of worldwide activity.

title: Montclair State Trounces William Patterson, 35 to 6
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Oct. 2Scoring all its points in the first three periods, Montclair State College gained its second success in three starts, defeating, William Patterson College, 356, tonight at Sprague Field before 6,812 fans.

title: U.S. BUSINESS RUNDUP
description: Canada and the United States are one another's best trading partners. Some 25 per cent of United States exports are sold to Canada. The United States, in turn, buys some 70 per cent of Canada's exports.

title: Pop
description: THE MOODY BLUES: Every Good Boy Deserves Favour (Threshold THS 5). If the Moody Blues ever make a perfect album, it may well be a dangerous thing. They have something going that is awfully powerful, and they have probably already changed some lives here or there. They will change more. One of these albums, it may all come together. Artists and prophets have always gotten mixed up with each other, and it is historically fitting that the mixup should now be taking place on the longplaying record album.

title: Fans May See Workouts
description: On the Saturday mornings preceding five games, fans are invited to see the Football Giants practice at Yankee Stadium. The dates are Oct. 16 and 30, Nv. 6 and 27 and Dec. 11. Getty Oil Company, one of the Giants' radio sponsors, will provide souvenir booklets for youngsters attending the 10 A.M. sessions.

title: Normality Is A Square Circle Or a FourSided Triangle
description: AT New York State University's Upstate Medical Center, a mutine diagnostic interview is in progress. The patient, a dowdy woman in her late fifties, had been referred for psychiatric evaluation after complaining persistently of a mysterious pulling in her head. In a flat voice she unfolds a life story so filled with disaster, loss and sudden death that it seems more the stuff of theater than medicine. From time to time, as she answers the questions of the young resident in psychiatry, she cries briefly; and yet for the most part she speaks in a curiously emotionless tone, as though telling someone else's story. The senior psychiatrist on the case, Dr. Thomas Szasz, sits quietly to one side, jotting on a yellow note pad. There are some 12 students in the consultation room, all juniors in the medical school: their expressions range from slight embarrassment to stern scientific interest.

title: Science
description: LONDON  At Brussels, in a conference concluded last weekend, the International Astronautical Congress wrestled with a monumental problem: How to develop, in effect, a kind of distant earlywarning system that would identify disastrous ecological changes before they have passed the point of no return. Included in the potential dangers:

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: U.S. Agency Study Asks Periodic Tests For Private Pilots
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2 (AP) A Transportation Department study recommends periodic proficiency tests for private pilots as one means of improving aviation safety.

title: Landlord in Oregon Sued Over Freeze
description: CORVALLIS, Ore., Oct. 2A row of frame houses on a deadend lane in this quiet college town has become the focal point of a suit attempting to enforce President Nixon's 90day wage and price freeze.

title: Marcia Wagner Is Wed
description: In the chapel of the Brick Presbyterian Church here yesterday afternoon, Miss Marcia Wendy Wager was married to Allen Whelchel Finger by the Rev. Dr. Victor Baer. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hamilton Riggs Wager of New Xork and a aescencant of Col. Robert Treat, colonial Governor of Connecticut and founder of Newark.

title: Miss Walker Plans Bridal
description: SHEFFIELD, Ala., Oct. 2 Mr. and Mrs. Robert A. Walker have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Winifred Ann Walker, to George Henry Weiler 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Weiler Jr. of Ridgewood, N. J. and Orleans, Mass.

title: EssexUnion
description: Westfield, rated one of the two best schoolboy football teams in New Jersey last season, kept its unbeaten streak alive yesterday with a 206 victory at Cranford.

title: STOCK TAX AHEAD OF EXPECTATIONS
description: The city is making far more money from the stock transfer tax than it had projected, Controller Abraham D. Beame said yesterday.

title: Arab Paper Says U.S. Envoy Betrayed Rebels in Libya
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 2 (AP)An Arab publication said today that a group of army officers plotting the overthrow of the Iibyan leader, Col. Muammar elQuaddafi, had been betrayed by United States Ambassador, Joseph Palmer II.

title: Chess
description: IN an age when almost every kind Iof activity is inextricably mingled with politics, it is little wonder that an event of such widespread significance as the 1968 turmoil in Czechoslovakia should cause repercussions in the world of chess. One direct result was, of course, the emigration to the United States of the young Czech grandmaster Lubomir Kavalek, and his subsequent decision to make this country his permanent home. Another, with so far a much less happy ending, are the series of events that have made the life of grandmaster Ludek Pachman a kind of nightmare ever since, details of which have so far reached the West only in fragmented form.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE ECONOMY: The United States offered to remove the 10 per cent import surtax if other countries let their currencies float upward against the dollar and acted to curb exports to the U.S. Treasury Secretary Connally presented the idea to the I.M.F., which earlier had heard Britain and other leading nations call for a less influential role for the dollar in the world monetary system. The Group of 10 agreed to work on currency realignments. The price of gold rose last week and President Nixon received proposals for Phase Two of his economic program.

title: Panamanian Island Tribes Born to the Sea
description: SAN BLAS ISLANDS, PanamaThousands of the Cuna Indian tribe inhabiting the San Blas islands are keeping the boating sceneas well as their style of livingalmost exactly as it was, probably even before Christianity took root in the Time of Darkness.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Reader's Report
description: Cunningly disguised as a novel, The View From Chivo is a freefloating sample of an increasingly rare literary species: humor. It is a skimming of the froth of the richest comic imagination bubbling in West Texas, where H. Allen Smith now lives, as well as Mt. Kisco, where he used to live. (There's nobody funnier in between these two geographic points either, to my knowledge.)

title: Pullman Car Is Home for 3 Soldiers
description: FORT MONMOUTH, N. J., Oct. 2Three soldiers have found a home in a 65ton Pullman railroad car that is parked on an unused siding at the Army electronics command post here.

title: Barbara J. Fuller, Robert Basler Wed
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Oct. 2 In St. John's Episcopal Church here today, Miss Barbara Jean Fuller and Robert Clair Basler, reporters with The Indianapolis News, were married by the Rev. Kenneth L. MacKenzie. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Keith Fuller of Larchmont. Her father is assistant general manager of The Associated Press.

title: James Moody Quartet Concert Marks Return of Jazz to Suffolk
description: PORT JEFFERSON, L. I.After a oneyear hiatus, the jazz concerts presented by the International Art of Jazz that were a regular part of the cultural life of Suffolk County each winter from 1964 until 1970 will be resumed today.

title: CONNECTICUT GROUP BACKS LINDSAY RACE
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 2  A group started a drive here today for 100,000 Connecticut signatures petitioning Mayor Lindsay to seek the Democratic nomination for President.

title: Survey Indicates Increase In Espionage by the Soviet
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 2Soviet espionage appears to be growing around the worldparticularly in the Westwhile Western and Soviet officials negotiate about reducing tensions.

title: Army Vanquishes Missouri, 226, as Fink Passes for 3 Touchdowns in 2d Half
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Oct. 2When everybody calls you King Fink you have to be good, and J. Kingsley Fink, Army's secandstring quarterback was just that yesterday. He went in midway through the second quarter and threw three passes for touchdowns that led Army to 226 victory over Missouri.

title: Dorothy Malone Rewed
description: DALLAS, Oct. 2 (AP)Dorothy Malone, the actress, was married today to Charles Huston Bell of Dallas, executive of a motel chain. Miss Malone is perhaps best known for her appearance in the longrunning television series Peyton Place. She won an Oscar in a supporting role in 1956 in Written on the Wind.

title: Science
description: Back in 1966, an 8yearold North Miami boy carried three of them home in his pocket from a visit to Hawaii. Now there are thousands, perhaps millions of the giant African snails in the Miami area. Some are 8 inches long, and all boast 80,000 teeth and a voracious appetite. They are on the rampage, devouring crops and vegetation at a rate that could result this year in an $11million loss. And their spread is being accelerated by integrated schooling, as the snails are carried from one neighborhood to another in the pockets of children being bused to distant schools. Kids love to play with these snails, said Federal inspector, and they take them to school like a pet frog.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: It may have been slow In coming, but there is a marked improvement in the women's apparel industry, Seventh Avenue workshops are busy, even though the volume of business is not setting new records. But there has been a movement from low volume to high, with manufacturers now experiencing some difficulties in meeting orders.

title: North Carolinian Heads Ports Authority Group
description: PORTLAND, Me., Oct. 2 (AP)James W. Davis, executive director of the North Carolina State Ports Authority, was elected president of the American Association of Port Authorities Thursday at the group's 60th annual convention.

title: Alaska Claims a First
description: ANCHORAGE, Oct 2 (Reuters)With 82 per cent of the graduating high school seniors registered to vote in the next election, Alaska ranks first in the country, by percentage, for eligible young voters, according to Lieut. Gov. H. A. Boucher.

title: Susan Albaugh Wed
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Oct. 2  Miss Susan Emery Albaugh and Henry John Albach 4th were married here this noon in Christ Episcopal Church by the Rev. Richard Andersen. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hamilton Castner Albaugh Jr. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry John Albach 3d of Dallas, where his father is president of the Civil Liberties Union.

title: Mailbox
description: To the Editor:

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Being a Washington watcher is an exciting occupation many people would enjoy if only they knew about it.

title: People's Hall To Stay Open
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I. Town attorneys have discontinued Huntington's action in State Supreme Court against the People's Town Hall, home to several countercultural activities.

title: Briton, Italian Set Marks In World Motorcycle Meet
description: ELVINGTON, England, Oct. 2 (Reuters)Two world records for motorcycles were broken within a halfhour today at the World Speed Records weekend, organized by the Incorporated Sprint Organization.

title: 150Pounders Are Scoreless
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 2The Princeton and Rutgers 150pound football teams played 00 tie today on rainsoaked Sexton Field.

title: Cynthia A. Robertson Becomes Fiancee
description: STAUNTON, Va., Oct. 2Mr. and Mrs. Richard DeForest Robertson of Staunton and New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cynthia Anne Robertson, to Donald O. Cramer Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Cramer of Denver and Georgetown, Colo. A November wedding is planned.

title: Lindsay Announces a System Of Bikeways for Manhattan
description: A system of bikewaysposted street routes for Manhattan bicycle riderswas proclaimed yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: Heavy Rains Hit Virginia, But Storm Loses Strength
description: RICHMOND, Oct. 2 (AP)Hurricane Ginger dumped heavy amounts of rainfall in Virginia today as the storm plodded northward through the state, losing strength along the way.

title: Giants Get Rucker, Receiver, After Waivers by Cowboys
description: DALLAS, Oct. 2 (UPI)The Dallas Cowboys today waived Reggie Rucker, a secondyear wide receiver, who was immediately claimed by the New York Giants. The Cowboys also activated Lance Alworth, wide receiver.

title: Variation on coffee and ...
description: To squeeze out the thumbthick segments of dough, use a pastry bag or a churrera, the traditional utensil, which is sold at Casa Moneo, the import shop, 210 West 14th Street. Tired of coffee and doughnuts? Try the Spanish alternative, chocolate y churros. The chocolate is frothy, creamy and spiced. Churros are doughnuts, but, since you make them at home, they are bound to be better than the storebought kind. Right? Right. Anyway millions of Spanish speakers in Europe and Latin America get their churros hot every day from street vendors. If you don't like circles, other shapes taste the same and are equally authentic.

title: VOLUNTEERS PUT EXFELONS IN JOBS
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 2 Community Aid for Employment, a program staffed largely by volunteers, has found jobs for 40 former convicts in Westchester this year. It is trying to persuade the county's business community to help end what it calls the sentence that lasts beyond punishmentthe inability of offenders to find jobs once they have served their sentences.

title: National Notes
description: Americana

title: Texas vs. Chile
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2This country seems headed down the wrong road in its relations with Chile and other underdeveloped countries.

title: Eleanor L. Culbertson Married To Garett J. Albert, a Lawyer
description: KENT, Conn., Oct. 2The marriage of Miss Eleanor Lanier Culbertson to Garett J. Albert, son of Mr. and Mrs. Don Albert of Union, N.J., took place here at noon today. The Rev. Donald Ketcham, minister of the First Congregational Church here, performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. William Howard Culbertson, parents of the bride. Mr. Culbertson, now retired, was executive vice president and director of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith and board chairman of Merrill Lynch International.

title: Philadelphia Union Elects
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 2 (AP) The Philadelphia transit workers have reelected the man who led them on an 11day strike last April. Domenic DiClerico, president of Local 234 of the Transportation Workers Union, won election yesterday to a third consecutive threeyear term with 2,496 votes out of some 4,500 votes cast.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Soviet Identifies Britons It Says Were Sent to Moscow as Spies
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 2 (AP)The Soviet Union, angered by the order barring 105 alleged Russian spies from England, responded today with an attack in Pravda on British intelligence and named Britons it said had been sent to Moscow as agents.

title: F.B.I. AIDE RESIGNS IN POLICY DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2William C. Sullivan, a key administrative official and veteran of more than 30 years with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, has resigned after having policy differences with the bureau's director, J. Edgar Hoover.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Metroliner to Operate Through to New Haven
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2 (UPI)Amtrak, the national rail passenger corporation, says it will expand high speed Washington  Newark New York Metroliner service through to New Haven in midNovember.

title: Television
description: LONDON.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Preps
description: MARION, Mass., Oct. 2Gary Livesay, a senior quarter. back, scored one touchdown and threw for two more today as he sparked Tabor to a 210 victory over Cushing, Livesay, threw to Larry Joyce for the first score, then ran for one and passed for another secondhalf score.

title: Acts to Avoid Long Battle in Senate On Confirmation
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2Representative Richard H. Poff of Virginia, who had reportedly been President Nixon's first choice to fill the vacant Southern scat on the Supreme Court, abruptly withdrew his name from consideration today as a potential candidate.

title: Judaism as a lifestyle for today
description: A counterculture needs a solid base of countervalues. Finding one in the society one wishes to counter is not easy. Yet Franz Rosenzweig (18861929) saw and resolved this issue. Against secularity, he chose God; against conventional religion, he chose to be a seriously believing Jew. In his struggle for creative alienhood he remains our contemporary, though it has taken 50 years for an English translation of his major work, The Star of Redemptiona book the author began in the trenches of World War I.

title: Luna 19 Enters Moon Orbit; Soft Landing Attempt Likely
description: BOCHUM, West Germany, Oct. 2 (UPI)  The unmanned Soviet spaceship Luna 19 entered moon orbit today, apparently in preparation for a soft landing on the lunar surface, the director of the Bochum Space and Satellite Research Institute said.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Making of a Justice, NixonStyle, a recurring political show on the Washington scene, moved into its fifth act last week.

title: Lafayette Trims Drexel With Big 3d Period, 2113
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 2 (AP) Lafayette College scored two touchdowns in the third quarter and then held off Drexel University to win, 2113, today.

title: Cabbage Crisis: Moscow Struggles With Harvest
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 2  Open trucks heaped with glistening heads of cabbage race along Moscow highways. Newspapers print daily box scores of potato deliveries to each city borough. And farm specialists hold out the hope that some day the consumer will be supplied with fresh vegetables summer and winter.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Chairman Named
description: William Weintraub has been named chairman of 1971 Coney Island campaign of the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies. Mr. Weintraub is financial secretary of the Shorefront Y.M.Y.W.H.A. of BrightonManhattan Beach.

title: The World's Greatest Warehouse Stuffed With Other People's Glories
description: LONDONThe greatest treasure trove in all the world is found in London's Great Russell Street, between Tottenham Court Road and Southhampton Row, directly across the way from the small shop that sells sneezing powder, rubber spiders and marked cards. I refer, of course, to the British Museum, which the English in their homely way call the B.M. Here you may see the Rosetta Stone, the original draft of Magna Carta, the manuscript of Alice's Adventures in Wonderland, the wooden pillow of some Unknown African tribesman and 2,000 watercolors by Turner.

title: Preps
description: ANDOVER, Mass., Oct. 2Andover had a field day at the expense of the Tufts freshman football team today. The home team scored in every period and trounced the visitors, 350.

title: Big Board Feels Pressure on Institutional Membership
description: The pressures are intensifying once again for the New York Stock Exchange to open its membership rolls to mutual funds, pension funds, insurance companies and other financial institutions active in the stock market.

title: Dartmouth Wins at Soccer
description: HANOVER, N. H., Oct. 2Dartmouth scored twice in the first period and defeated Amherst in soccer today, 31.

title: The Reality Behind Words
description: NEW HAVEN  The American poet Chayym Zeldis once told me that the reason he could do without certain things in life was that their names produced unwelcomed responses in him, believing, as I do, that language is indeed the creator of reality when it gives a name to it. But one does not have to be a poet or a novelistor an advertising sloganeerto realize that words, like commanding officers and their men, can massacre innocent bystanders; and that often it is language that evokes in us a passion to embrace or reject others, to love or kill, to be free be confined.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR: The explanation in the letter from J. R. Harris of B.O.A.C. of why airlines peg fares to length of voyage (Travel section, Sept. 12) does not convince me. He said that when a person wants complete flexibility in his return date he chooses to pay for this convenience. Yet, on a circle trip of South America with open tickets, we had 24 flights on 17 airlines without once having to update or postpone a flight. Seats were available for the days we requested them; we knew that if seats were not available we would wait until they were. And I don't think we reduced any airline's profits.

title: Rosenblums Have Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. William F. Rosenblum Jr. at University Hospital on Monday. Mrs. Rosenblum is the former Miss Barbara Newton. Mr. Rosenblum is a lawyer here. The child has been named David Evan.

title: Connecticut
description: Stamford and New Canaan, state championship rivals for the past two years, each chalked up its third straight victory of the season with relative ease yesterday.

title: BUS RULING JARS DETROIT SUBURBS
description: DETROIT, Oct. 2  A Federal judge's ruling that Detroit's schools are segregated has started an uproar in the suburbs.

title: VILLANOVA BEATEN BY DELAWARE, 2315
description: NEWARK Del., Oct. 2 (UPI) Two touchdowns by Gardy Kahoe sparked Delaware to 2315 triumph over Villanova today.

title: Audit Finds State Let 163,000 Drive Illegally in a Year
description: ALBANY, Oct. 2As many as 163,000 motorists may have been driving illegally in New York State during a recent oneyear period, the State Department of Audit and Control reported today.

title: Preps
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Oct. Eric Olsen passed for two touchdowns and Mickey Holmes went 83 yards for a third score as Blair defeated Delbarton, 216, today.

title: GETTYSBURG LOSES TO BUCKNELL, 1413
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Oct. (UPI)Bob Brunnet, a safety, broke up a 2point conversion attempt with less than a minute to play to give Bucknell a 1413 victory over Gettysburg today.

title: NASA CHIEF SEEKS MORE FUNDS IN '73
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 2Dr. James C. Fletcher, the new administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, opened his campaign here this week for a bigger share of next year's Federal budget.

title: Art
description: SOCALLED Soho appears to be making its bid this season. The landmark loft district south of Houston Street, which two years ago had nary a gallery, today boasts about 20, including lavish new branches at 420 West Broadway of the uptown Castelli, Emmerich and Sonnabend. And, judging from the overall quality and panache of recent openings in the area  where, on a Saturday afternoon, the relatively untrafficked, uncommercialized streets and marvelous loftbuilding architecture are all part of the experienceSoho now qualifies as something more than an eccentric epicenter of the traditional Madison Avenue57th Street axis.

title: Home Improvement
description: SINCE the winter months subject gutters to their greatest wear on homes in the northern half of this countrysnow load and ice dams often bend gutters, downspouts and hangers out of alignment, or in extreme cases even break or tear them off completelythe wise homeowner should take time out now to check over his entire roof drainage system.

title: MANHATTANROUTS ARMY HARRIERS
description: Manhattan College, led by its sophomore Irishborn captain, Mike Keogh, showed early season strength yesterday by routing Army, 1550, for the first time in the college's history in the rain at Van Cortlandt Park.

title: U.S. Eases Egypt's Debt
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2The United States and Egypt agreed here today to a sevenyear rescheduling of Egypt's $145million indebtedness to this country.

title: Fiberglass Dominant Material Now for Boat Hulls and Decks
description: Boats built of diverse materials including wood, fiberglass, aluminum and ferrocement will be represented at the Annapolis sailboat show, but in keeping with recent trends most of the boats will have fiberglass hulls and decks, teak or mahogany trim and aluminum masts.

title: Television
description: STARTING tonight it's a whole new season for the Public Broadcasting Service, and the network's second year of operation is trailing glimmerings of a whole new future for New York's Channel 13/WNET.

title: SCHOOLTAX SUIT NAMES THE STATE
description: YORKTOWN HEIGHTS, N.Y. Oct. 2  A taxpayer here is suing the local school board and the State of New York, contending that the local property tax is an unconstitutional means of paying for the costs of education.

title: Job Security Urged for Balking Drivers
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2Representative Robert C. Eckhardt, Democrat of Texas, called today for Federal legislation that would protect the jobs of truck and bus drivers who face company pressure for refusing to drive vehicles they believe to be unsafe.

title: HARVARD RALLIES FOR 177 VICTORY
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. (AP)Richie Gatto sparked scoring drive late in the first half today and then accounted for a clinching touchdown in the closing minutes in leading punchless. Harvard to a 177 football victory over stubborn Northeastern.

title: Oregon State Beats U.C.L.A.
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 2 (UPI) Ray Taroli returned a kickoff 100 yards tonight to highlight a threetouchdown thirdquarter rally that carried Oregon State to a 3417 victory over University of California, Los Angeles, in the opening Pacific8 game for both schools.

title: New York
description: It's a living, said one panhandler. I haven't been hungry since I started.

title: WALL STREET
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission and the New York and American stock exchanges are expected to lower the disciplinary boom this week on a large national brokerage house, charging a raft of improper activities.

title: COLORADO DOWNS KAN. STATE, 3121
description: BOULDER, Colo., Oct. 2 (UPI) Ken Johnson, a sophomore quarterback, threw touchdown passes to Cliff Branch and Wiliel Nichols today and Branch returned a Kansas State punt 59 yards to score as sixthranked Colorado posted a 3121 victory over the upsetminded Wildcats, avenging last year's loss.

title: Johnson Snowmobile Hits. World Record 140 M.P.H.
description: An experimental highspeed snowmobile designed and manufactured by engineers from Johnson Motors, has set a world speed record on the Bonneville Salt. Flats. It was clocked through the timing traps at 140.625 miles an hour. The fastest previous clocking of a snowmobile was a reported 125.9 m.p.h. by a turbinepowered sled earlier this year. The Johnson vehicle, dubbed Pegasus after the winged horse of Greek mythology, is conventionally powered by twocycle internal combustion engines connected to the drive track.

title: 340 Craft to Go on Display at Annapolis
description: The first United States Sailboat Show, held last year at Annapolis, Md., can only he called a happening. Coming on the heels of a recession, challenging the financial fates, breaking the indoor precedent and defying the offseason tradition as well as the weather, America's inaugural outdoor sailboat exhibition brought a fantastic response from the public.

title: Pop
description: Bush Music, Volume One (Milestone MSP 9031). Gary Bartz, the impressive young reedman in Miles Davis's band, has had several excellent solo albums on the Milestone label. But this one opens new avenues of expression and a wider spectrum of possibilities for contemporary Black music. All the tunes have a lyric or recitation that links African musical tradition with the plight of the Black in America. Happily, the concept does not hinder or lessen the musical.

title: Preps
description: SHEFFIELD, Mass., Oct. 2Jack Picard scored twice as Cranwell downed Berkshire, 230, in the season opener for both teams. Picard scored on runs of 25 and 3 yards.

title: Racine, Stendhal and Colette were inspired by the situation
description: On Sept. 4, 1969, a news item appeared in Le Monde (of Paris) which read: Sentenced last July 10 to 12 months in prison and a fine of 500 francs avec sursis [that is, with a deferment of penalty] for the seduction of a minor, Mme. Gabrielle Russier, 32, professor of literature, was found dead Monday evening in her Marseilles apartment: she had killed herself by gaspoisoning. The love affair lived out through several months by the young woman with one of her pupils thus finds a tragic epilogue.

title: Many Aiding Mother Of 3 Stricken Children
description: SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO, Calif., Oct. 2 (AP)  President Nixon, the singer Glen Campbell, welfare mothers and shipping clerks are among more than 1,000 people across the nation who have sent more than $4,000 and letters to a woman whose children suffer from a rare, apparently incurable disease.

title: Miss Winston Wed To Magnus Floren
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Oct. 2 Miss Cecilia A. Winston and B. Magnus Flordn of the Swedish Royal Air Force were married here this afternoon in the Round Hill Community Church by the Rev. Jesse E. Thomas.

title: City Vote Linked to Development Bill
description: The La?? of a proposed amendment to the Stale Constitution permitting the state to lend or give money to private businesses or individuals for community development purposes hangs on whether the state's large cities produce big vote in the offyear elections on Nov. 2.

title: AUSTRALIANS SEEK TO SAVE KANGAROO
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Oct. 2 Australians with a commercial interest in preserving the kangaroo, which is said to be on the way to extinction, have joined forces with conservationists in a campaign against indiscriminate slaughter.

title: Dogs and Cats and Wodehouse
description: Except when I was getting born in Guilford, England, and putting in a certain amount of time in New York, London, Paris, Hollywood and Palm Beach, I have always been a Long Islander. There is something about the place that suits me. When I was married 57 years ago, I lived at Bellport. Then I moved to Great Neck. And now I have been settled for 20 years in that delectable oasis, Remsenburg, six miles from Westhampton Beach lives there all the year round. Winter may send the birds flying south and pile up the snow against the terrace doors, but while not actually shoveling the latter away, I am still there encouraging the shovelers with word and gesture, as firmly rooted to the spot as a limpet on a rock.

title: Protesting Prisoners in Massachusetts Were Attuned to Attica
description: WALPOLE, Mass., Oct. 2Acting at times as a goad and at times as a restraint, the memory of the recent bloody confrontation at Attica prison in New York was an everpresent force during five days of tense protest that swept Massachusetts prisons this week.

title: Entering Ephesus By Daphne Athas. 442 pp. New York: The Viking Press. $7.95.
description: Ephesus is a college town somewhere in the South that becomes the refuge and prison of a family on the skids in the 1940's. Father is a brilliant dilettante and an unsuccessful entrepreneur; mother is a Mayflower blueblood, eccentric but indestructible; daughters three range in age from 10 to 14 and from vapid to very very bright. The maverick family of a past generation is a familiar phenomenon, but Miss Athas renovates it with the freshness of her perspectives. Her rhetoric (sometimes a bit overrich, sometimes keenly poetic) confers on the Bishops a mythical quality, making such universals as love and death seem strangely remote.

title: 3 Airlines Reduce Flights by Transcontinental Planes
description: The American businessman who is used to picking up a telephone and booking passage on a transcontinental jet at just about any hour that he chooses will find air travel somewhat less convenient starting today.

title: To See the World . . .
description: AUNIVERSAL compulsion of man is to surround himself with symbols. Our clothes, our cars, our homes and even our activities are all, to some extent, symbols of what we are in our own eyes, and often what we would like to be to others. For better or for worse, our gardens are highly symbolic and have always been so.

title: Job Outlook Murky
description: The employment outlook do many of the whitecollar professions continues to be bleak, particularly at beginning levels. That's the latest gloomy forecast from personnel agency officials, executive and corporate recruiters and college placement officers.

title: GEORGIA TROUNCES MISS. STATE BY 357
description: ATHENS, Ga., Oct. 2 (UPI) Two Georgia quarterbacks, Andy Johnson and James Ray, ran for two touchdowns apiece today as the Bulldogs trounced Mississippi State, 357, for their fourth victory in as many games.

title: Et Al.
description: Jan Yoors as a boy became entranced with gypsies and their way of life. He was adopted by a tribe and spent much of his adolescence traveling with them. Then World War II and persecution by the Nazis. Yoors and his gypsies joined the underground and comported themselves with bravery and their own peculiar sense of honor. With sympathy Yoors evokes an alien way of life.

title: Stamps
description: THE National Museum of History and Technology at the Smithsonian Institution in Washington now has a post office of its own the one illustrated above. It may seem incongruous that the very modern museum with its distinguished Department of Postal History, should have such an antiquated structure as this but it took Carl Scheele months to find it.

title: Steel Mills Report Gains
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 3A gradual order rise was reported by steel producers last week.

title: Pope Appeals for Aid To Bengali Children
description: ROME, Oct. 3Pope Paul issued an appeal today for aid to the 800,000 exhausted, sick and starving children from East Pakistan who are now living in refugee camps.

title: Two Groups Term State Attica Panels Whitewash Units
description: At separate meetings yesterday, representatives of the New York State Chapter of the Na. tional Association for the Advancement of Colored People and the National Attica Observers' Committee charged that groups appointed by the state to investigate the Attica uprising and its aftermath will be whitewash committees.

title: BABBIDGE TO QUIT
description: Homer D. Babbidge Jr., who was the youngest state university president in the country when he became head of the University of Connecticut lin 1962, has told his trustees he is resigning.

title: The Import SurchargeFashion Industry Takes It in Stride
description: The ID per cent surcharge on imports imposed by president Nixon in August to limit the flow of American dollars abroad is having far less effect on the fashion business than last year's hemline fiasco.

title: Muscle Study Wins $25,000 Prize
description: Dr. Hugh E. Huxley is the recipient of the $25,000 Louisa Gross Horowitz Prize for 1971, Columbia University announced yesterday.

title: Huntington Beats Westbury And Wins Polo Tournament
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., Oct. 3 John Gayer scored six goals and led Huntington to an 84 polo triumph over Westbury today at Bethpage State Park to win the Dover House tournament.

title: Orioles' 4 in 7th Top A's, 53
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 3  Vida Blue wanted to beat these guys [the Orioles] real bad today and for six innings he was achieving his goal. But in the seventh inning Baltimore erupted for four runs, the last two on Paul Blair's two out double, and defeated the Oakland Athletics, 53, in the opener of the American League playoff.

title: Bridge: Off 200 Is an Excellent Score Against Nonvulnerable Game
description: The open pair championship title at the New YorkNew Jersey regionals at Swan Lake, N.Y., was captured Saturday by Tony Dionisi of New York and Harlow Lewis of Philadelphia, one of the country's outstanding partnerships.

title: LABORITE DEFIANT ON MARKET ENTRY
description: BRIGHTON, England, Oct. 3 Roy Jenkins, the deputy leader of the Labor party, defied rising Labor opposition to the Common Market tonight in a fighting speech in favor of British entry.

title: RANGERS, BRUINS PLAYING TONIGHT
description: The Rangers and Boston Bruins, who have been seeing a lot of each other lately, meet tonight at Madison Square Garden in a tuneup for the National Hockey League season.

title: Equity for Federal Employes
description: A quality of nearhysteria seems to have entered the Administration's campaign to win Congressional approval for the unequal sacrifices the White House seeks to inflict on Federal civilian and military employes as part of the national war against inflation. In a weekend statement President Nixon asserted that efforts restore prosperity would be torpedoed if Congress upset his order to defer for six months the 6 per cent pay increases Federal workers are scheduled to get Jan.

title: MORELL PORTRAYS DON CARLO AT MET
description: Title roles in operas are usually choice assignments for singers, but in the case of Verdi's Don Carlo, this is hardly the case. Thus, Barry Morell was not in a particularly enviable position Saturday afternoon when he took over the part of the young prince in the Metropolitan Opera's production.

title: DYNAMITE SCORES IN CUP YACHTING
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Oct. 3Jack Hirsch's Dynamite, a Whitby45 sloop out of Sheldrake Y.C., Mamaroneck, N. Y., won the Denmark Cup today in the sixth annual StamfordDenmark Friendship regatta on Long Island Sound.

title: SEATRAIN LINES, INC., REGISTERS A DEFICIT
description: Continuing losses in the container shipping business of Seatrain Lines, Inc., coupled with a sharp downturn in spot bulk charter rates in the latter half of the fiscal year ended June 30, resulted in a loss of $143,000, the report disclosed yesterday.

title: REAGAN TO WORK FOR NIXON IN '72
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 3Gov. Ronald Reagan made it clear to delegates to the California Republican State Central Committee convention this weekend that the Reagan insurgence was dead and that he would be a Nixon man all the way in 1972.

title: Stylistic LaBelle Lends Solidarity To Fans of Blues
description: Soul music has had a difficult time breaking through to the larger pop audience. Ike and Tina Turner have done well, Otis Redding was on his way at the time of his death, and Marvin Gaye is breaking out with a new recording. But for the most part, the interest that young listeners have in black music has concentrated on old, fairly traditional giants like Howlin Wolf and John Lee Hooker.

title: Adm. R. H. Jackson Dies at 105; Was Commander of Battle Fleet
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 3 (UPI)Richard Harrison Jackson, the oldest flag officer in the Navy, died yesterday at the age of 105. He died of cardiac failure while being treated at the Naval Hospital here for a hip fracture suffered Sept. 24.

title: 137,155 NEW VOTERS REGISTER IN 3 DAYS
description: The Police Department reported yesterday that 137,155 new voters had registered for the November election during the threeda local voterregistration period that ended Saturday night.

title: Elschembroich Tennis Victor
description: MADRID, Oct. 3 (AP)Harald Elschembroich of West Germany won the men's singles international Real Madrid tennis tournament today, defeating Juan Gisbert of Spain, 64, 63, 63.

title: Call 6371212 for Scores
description: The New York Telephone Company again will provide inningbyinning scores of the Major League divisional championship playoffs, as well as the World Series. The number to call is 6371212, which is the company's time bureau. Final scores will be carried for one hour after the games are over. Please do not telephone The Times for scores.

title: Advertising:
description: Three executive vice presidents at Lennen & Newell have been named to a newly formed management committee that will be responsible for the policy and operations of the agency, according to Adolph J. Toigo, the chief executive, who will chair the committee.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Oct. 3Robert Deindorfer, a New York writer, was here with his family last summer in Lower Slaughter, a Cotswold village. His fouryearold son, Scott, became seriously ill and spent three nights in a hospital, having numerous tests and intravenous feeding. Scott was in a private room, and Mr. and Mrs. Deindorfer were given a room near him. The hospital's bill at the end was $7.80for the parents' meals.

title: LOUIS GRAY
description: Louis Gray, an English teacher at Flushing High School from 1922 to 1969, where he had also served as college adviser to the students, died yesterday after surgery in Hillcrest Hospital, Flushing. He was 71 years old and lived at 3930 220th Street, Bayside, Queens.

title: Penn's Adams Wins Singles In E.C.A.C. Tennis Tourney
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Oct. 3John Adams, a Penn senior, defeated Harris Masterson, a Harvard sophomore, 63, 26, 60, today to win the Division. A singles title in the Eastern College Athletic Conference's fall tennis tournament.

title: To Waiting Wives' Of Officers the War Is One More Job
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y. We look at It not as The War but as our husbands' jobright, girls? Mrs. Michael M. Quinlan of Poughkeepsie, whose husband is an Army major in Quangnai, South Vietnam, won quick nods assent from the other officers' wives seated around her.

title: Paul Muni's Widow Dies
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Oct. 3Mrs. Bella Finkel Muni, widow of Paul Muni, the stage and screen actor, died on Friday at her home here. The Munis married in 1921 when he was a rising young member of the Yiddish Art Theater in New York. They had no children. Mr. Muni died in 1967.

title: Poff's Decision May Mean Long Delay in Filling Court
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3The Nixon Administration found itself back at the starting point today in its search for Supreme Court nominees in the wake of Representative Richard H. Poff's abrupt announcement yesterday that he had asked President Nixon not to appoint him.

title: New York Tech Club Wins
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Oct. 3 Bob LeVine scored a touchdown on a 1yard plunge in the final period to give the New York Tech's club football team a 70 victory over Worcester State today. Steve Szewczuk was Tech's leading rusher with 162 yards in 28 carries.

title: Eurobond Market Rallying As Dollar Regains Ground
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 3The Eurobond market has started the fourth quarter with the newissue total for 1971 already equal to that of all of 1970, with the dollar on its way hack as a financing vehicle and with a solid rally gaining ground on the secondary market.

title: SAKS FIFTH AVENUE REALIGNS MANAGERS
description: A reassignment of management personnel for Saks Fifth Avenue was announced over the weekend by Allan R. Johnson, chairman.

title: City Block: 85th St. Residents Are a Mixed Bag of Shoppers
description: Nearly everyone on 85th Street between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue goes shopping, and nearly everyone has something to say about it. It is a nuisance, a challenge, or even a social excursion, and it is also a rite, perhaps the only one on the block, in which nearly everyone takes part.

title: Balloting Choice in Vietnam Was Thieu or Trash Can
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 3  South Vietnam's presidential ref erendurn today was a duty, a chore, or an incomprehensible and perhaps ominous ritual, depending on whom you tallied to in the country's cities, villages and hamlets.

title: Ethel Strainchamps Wrote This
description: The various equalrights movements have succeeded at least in making news writers and editors noticeably selfconscious about the nouns they use to refer to members of any group that might conceivably have a grievance against the Establishment. The lessesteemed ethnic groups have had them walking on eggs for years, and now they are getting anxiety neuroses when they have to choose a generic term to refer to any adult female or any young adult male.

title: State Bank Aide Named
description: William T. Dentzer Jr., the New York State Superintendent of Banks, announced yesterday the appointment of Michael Iovenko as deputy superintendent and general counsel of the Banking Department. Mr. Iovenko succeeds Ivan Serchuck, who will return to the private practice of law as a partner of the firm of Berle & Berle.

title: Jets Beat Dolphins, 1410
description: MIAMI, Oct. 3  With a rare steal by Earlie Thomas of a completed pass and an alert recovery by Paul Crane of a free ball after a punt, the New York Jets turned the two unusual turnovers into two lastquarter touchdowns today for a 1410 victory over the Miami Dolphins.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bonavena Wins From Lewis; Loser Disqualified for Butt
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 3 (UPI) Oscar Bonavena of Argentina won a heavyweight bout from Alvin (Blue) Lewis of Detroit last night when the American boxer was disqualified in the seventh round for butting.

title: Supplementary OverCounter List
description: The following is a supplementary list of overthecounter ?? prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. It consists of securities less widely held or those that, for other reasons, do not appear on the daily OvertheCounter list. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Orioles 75 Favorites
description: STATELINE, Nev., Oct. 3 UPI)  Oddsmakers listed the Baltimore Orioles a 75 favorite over the Oakland Athletics in tomorrow's American League playoff game at Baltimore.

title: Alcindor Injures Eye
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 3 (UPI)Lew Alcindor of the Milwaukee Bucks injured his eye in an exhibition. game in Seattle Friday. He was flown back here for observation at a hospital.

title: Troy Drums Up Midwestern Support for McGovern
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 3The new voice crying in the political wilderness for Senator George McGovern has a workingclass New York accentBay Ridge, Brooklyn, by way of Queens Village. It belongs to Matthew J. Troy Jr., the Queens County leader who will control more votes at the Democratic National Convention next year than a number of Middle Western Governors and enjoys saying just that to prominent fencesitters here and around the country.

title: Criticism of Officiating and Upsets in East Add Spice to College Football
description: Michigan State's Duffy Daugherty wore a woolen sweater while coaching at South Bend, Ind., Saturday despite a temperature in the high 80's. After Notre Dame completed its 142 victory over the Spartans, Daugherty said the only thing that made him warm was the fact that I was hot under the collar cause of the officiating.

title: FINN CUP OPENER GOES TO SPRAGUE
description: TORONTO, Oct. 3 (Canadian Press)Henry Sprague of Newport Beach, Calif., led all the way today to win the first of six races in the Finn Gold Cup world championship sailing on Lake Ontario.

title: JAMES J. DRISCOLL
description: James J. Driscoll, former executive vice president of George W. Luft Company, a cosmetics concern, died yesterday in his home at 17810 Wexford Terrace, Jamaica Estates, Queens. He was 66 years old.

title: Japan Textile Workers Protest Any Accord to Curtail Exports
description: TOKYO, Oct. 3  Japanese textile workers joined management over the weekend to protest against any governmental agreement restricting export of their products to the United States.

title: PRISON RIOT TIED TO STREET GANGS Illinois Warden Says ?? Inmate Factions Fougle
description: PONTIAC. Ill., Oct. 3Officials of the Illinois Department of Corrections began an investigation today to identify the leaders of a riot yesterday at the Pontiac Branch of the Illinois State Penitentiary.

title: State Recovers $1.26Million For Consumers in 6 Months
description: The State Attorney General's office reported yesterday that it had recovered $1,266,000 for consumers in the sixmonth period ending June 30. Of this total, all but $222,693 was for residents of the city.

title: NETS TOP CELTICS AT ISLAND GARDEN
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, N. Y., Oct. 3A 28foot shot by Bill Melchionni with four seconds to go gave the New York Nets of the American Basketball Association a 116115 victory over the Boston Celtics of the National Basketball Association before a crowd of 5,140 at Island Garden tonight. It was the first interleague game for either team.

title: TEACHERS TO SUE FOR FROZEN RAISE
description: The New York State Federation of Teachers intends to challenge President Nixon's wageprice freeze this week by suing the boards of education in 25 cities across the state for $6.2million in pay raises for 20,000 teachers.

title: Chess: Two American Grandmasters Share Laurels at Toronto
description: A field of 248, a record, participated in the Canadian Exhibition Open at Toronto last month. The event, a sixround Swiss system tournament, saw two American grandmasters, Robert Byrne of Ossining, N. Y., and Pal Benko of New York tie for first place at 60.

title: Vermont Concessions Granted
description: WINDSOR, Vt., Oct. 3 (AP)State Prison inmates who have refused to work since last Wednesday to enforce a list of demands won some small concessions over the weekend.

title: City in Colorado Awakens to Scope of Radioactive Waste Problem
description: The Talk of Grand Junction

title: Tobacco Farming Enters Machine Age
description: DORTCHES CROSSROAD, N. C., Oct. 3Automation has come at last to the flatlands of the CarolinaVirginia tobacco belt, the last big stronghold of the small yeoman farm is this country, and it is expected to set off yet another wave of farmtocity and SouthtoNorth migration by blacks.

title: Abolition of Ceylon's Senate
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Oct. 3 (AP)William Gopallawa, the Governor General, today gave royal assent to a bill abolishing the Senate, the nonelective upper house of the legislature.

title: Rebecca Douglass Wed To Andres von Buch
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Oct. 3 Miss Rebecca Lanier Douglass and Andras Maximo von Buch of Buenos Aires were married here today at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Lathrop Douglass. The bridegroom is a son of Baron Maximo von Buch and Baroness Elizabeth von Ruch of Buenos Aires and Florence, Italy.

title: LIFT EXIT BARRIERS, SOVIET IS URGED
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 3Andrei D. Sakharov, the physicist and civilrights advocate, has urged in an open appeal to the Supreme Soviet that all bars on emigration be lifted.

title: BOBBY UNSER SETS 300MILE RECORD
description: TRENTON, N. J., Oct. 3Bobby Unser, the older of the rival driving brothers from Albuquerque, N. M., won the $93,050 Marlboro 300mile national championship race in record time under a yellow flag over the mileandahalf Trenton Speedway course today, but the flag didn't bother him.

title: Agency Warns of Pipeline Peril As Open Areas Turn Suburban
description: At 3:40 P.M. on Sept. 9, 1969, residents of a suburban Houston subdivision called Greenridge North were startled by thunderous noise that sounded like a fleet of jet airplanes. Moments later, many of them were hurled to their floors by a violent shock wave.

title: Proclamation of Bikeways Termed Dangerous Fraud
description: Mayor Lindsay's proclamation of an experimental system of bikeways on Manhattan streets for bicycle riders was criticized as a dangerous fraud yesterday by Harriet Green, founder of Bike For a Better City, a group that has sponsored biketowork rides and urged the creation of lanes exclusively for bike riders.

title: Farmer Is Victor As Leader Quits In Southern 300
description: NASHVILLE, Oct. 3 (AP) Red Farmer won the 13th annual Southern 300 latemodel sportsman national championship race after Darrell Waltrip, who led most of the race, went out with 13 laps remaining.

title: Ford Foundation Names 2 Women
description: The Ford Foundation announced yesterday the appointment of two womenthe first in the foundation's 20year historyto its 16member board of trustees.

title: McCloskey Urges Repeal Of Most Abortion Laws
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (UPI) Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., California Republican who is running for President, called today for the repeal of most abortion laws.

title: Brandt Says He Expects Ratification of 2 Treaties
description: IMMENSTADT, West Germany, Oct. 3 (AP)Chancellor Willy Brandt denied today that he would call new elections if the West German treaties with Poland and the Soviet Union were not ratified by the Bundestag, or parliament.

title: ARMY REVIEWING CASE OF COLONEL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP)  Prodded by Congress, Secretary of the Army Robert F. Froehike is personally reviewing Lieut. Col. Anthony B. Herbert's file to determine whether the officer, who is now facing forced retirement, was unjustly relieved of his command.

title: SENATORS ASK CURB ON U.S. ROLE IN ASIA
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 3 (UPI)  Two Senators announced separate plans today to prevent the United States from getting more deeply involved in Laos and Cambodia

title: Jacqueline F. Gould Wed to C. R. Sallon
description: KYE, N. Y., Oct. 3Miss Jacqueline Frances Gould was married here this afternoon to Christopher Robert Sallon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Sallon of Kingston, England.

title: B.B.C. Complaint Unit Set
description: LONDON, Oct. 3 (AP)The British Broadcasting Corporation announced today the establishment of an independent watchdog commission to rule, on complaints from the public about radio and television broadcasts.

title: FOG STILL HOVERS OVER I.M.F. COURSE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3The smoke has cleared after the annual meeting of the International Monetary Fund and what remains isfog.

title: TALKS DUE TODAY IN DOCKER STRIKE
description: Negotiations are scheduled to resume here today in an effort to end the threedayold strike by the International Longshoremen's Association that has closed most of the ports on the East and Gulf Coasts.

title: Redskins Upset Cowboys And Rams Defeat Bears
description: The Dallas Cowboys have lost only twice in their last 17 National Football League games. But they really make the losses count. Yesterday, the Washington Redskins shocked them in the Cotton Bowl with a 2016 victory that propelled the Skins into first place in the National Conference's Eastern Division, breaking a tie with Dallas.

title: Aitken of Manhasset Bay Wins Baker Memorial Sail
description: SEA CLIFF, L.I., Oct. 3 David Aitken of the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club won two races today and finished second in the other to capture the fourth annual Jeff Baker Memorial Regatta sailed in Ensign Class sloops on Hempstead Harbor.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Israeli Schools and Hospitals Seek Funds in ForeignAid Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 The House has included $10.7million in the foreignaid authorization bill for schools and hospitals in Israel, and the total seems likely to be increased by the Senate.

title: Bankers Regard PrimeRafe Cut As Unlikely Now
description: The widespread expectation in the financial community that interest rates are headed lower, at least in the immediate future, has led to renewed speculation that a reduction in the prime rate may be imminent.

title: LAVER VANQUISHES ROSEWALL IN FINAL
description: ??RKELZY, Calif., Oct. 3 (UPX)Rod Laver of Australia subdued his fellow countryman, Ken Rosewall, in three sets today to win the $50,000 Redwood Bank international tennis tournament and take home the $10,000 first prize.

title: The Theater
description: For many years, while others have been delivering funeral orations over the Yiddish theater, Ben Bonus has been working valiantly, as actor, director and producer, to keep it alive. Now, with a little repertory company, he has revived a formula that should be a joy for those who have even a cursory knowledge of conversational Yiddish and should be very rewarding for anyone interested in seeing good examples of this rich cultural heritage.

title: Our Friends, the Arabs
description: McLEAN, Va.The Arab neighbors of Israel have for some seventeen years been embarked upon an alliance with the Soviet Union. There are lessons to be learned from the experience  lessons of special import to the Arab countries but important also to all free countries.

title: Capital City 500 Postponed
description: RICHMOND, Oct. 3 (AP)The Capital City 500 NASCAR stock car race, drenched by rain, was postponed today until Nov. 14. This was the second washout of the $125,000 event showers having put off the first attempt on Sept. 12.

title: The Peking Puzzle
description: There has been worldwide speculation about the meaning of recent strange developments in Peking, especially the cancellation of last week's traditional formal observances of the anniversary of the founding of the Chinese Peoples Republic.

title: Advertising:
description: Under its new owners, Intellectual Digest has blossomed into a fairly formidable magazine.

title: Film on a Black Panther At the Modern Art Today
description: The Murder of Fred Hampton, a featurelength documentary about the career and slaying of the Black Panther leader in Chicago about 20 months ago will have its first local showings at 3;30 P.M. today and at 5:30 tomorrow at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: SAIGON REPORTS THIEU CAPTURING 90% OF THE VOTES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Oct. 4  President Nguyen Van Thieu won a new fouryear term yesterday in a onecandidate election marked by scattered protests, terrorism, intensified enemy shelling and the largest reported voter turnout in recent Vietnamese history.

title: Roast Beef Dinner Fell 6 Cents in Cost in Month
description: The cost of a Sunday roast beef or chicken dinner for residents of New York City and Northeastern New Jersey was less in August than it was in July, the regional director of the United States Department of Labor's Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: Ulster Aide Killed in Attack On British Troops in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 3 (UPI)A British Army spokesman said that gunmen of the outlawed Irish Republican Army killed a Government official today in an attack on British troops in the Roman Catholic Falls Road area here.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Podgorny Greeted By Hanoi Turnout; Press Hails Soviet
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Oct. 3 (Agence FrancePresse) Nikolai V. Podgorny arrived here today from Rangoon for his official visit. The Soviet President and his eightmember delegation from Moscow were greeted at Hanoi's Gialam Airport by North Vietnamese officials including Le Duan, first secretary of the Communist party. Premier Pham Van Dong and Defense Minister Vo Nguyen Giap.

title: PolishAmericans Celebrate 35th Pulaski Day Here
description: Americans of Polish descent marched, strolled, skipped, cartwheeled, polkaed, cycled and rode up Fifth Avenue yesterday in the city's 35th annual celebration of Pulaski Day.

title: Squires Triumph, 112107, As Erving, Scott Stand Out
description: HAMPTON, Va., Oct. 3 (UPI) Julius Erving, a rookie, scored 30 points tonight as the Virginia Squires of the American Basketball Association beat the Baltimore Bullets of the National Basketball Association, 112107.

title: CHILDREN'S CRIME RISING ACROSS U.S.
description: Crime by children, some of it serious and committed by youngsters not yet in their teens, is arousing growing concern among parents, the police and school authorities across the country.

title: C. FREDERIC JEFFERSON
description: C. Frederic Jefferson, a retired partner of the Rochester law firm of Branch, Jefferson, Friedman, VanVoorhis & Wise, died Saturday in Washington. He was 83 years old and lived in Rochester.

title: Something Has Happened
description: TOURS, France, Oct. 3 (AP) The French Ambassador to Peking, traveling with a Chinese delegation visiting France, said today: Something has happened in China. I cannot tell you anything more.

title: Nancy Malkin Married Here
description: Miss Nancy Ellen Malkin was married here last evening to Dr. Rishon Haim Stember, son of Solomon Charles Stember of Sunnyside Gardens, Queens, and the late Mrs. Stember. Rabbi Arthur David performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Harold Julien Malkin.

title: Schooner Windigo Sinks During Race
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Oct. 3 (AP)  Windigo sank while competing in races here today. Its five crewmen were rescued without injury.

title: Dr. Lester Germer Dies at 74; Research Physicist at Cornell
description: GARDINER, N.Y., Oct. 3 (AP) Dr. Lester H. Germer of Millington, N. J., a physicist at Cornell University, died here today while climbing a cliff in the Shawangunk Mountains. He was 74 years old.

title: City Hall Notes
description: Mayor Lindsay's political aides are becoming increasingly sensitive to persistent questioning about who's running the city as Mr. Lindsay steps up his crosscountry travels to confer with Democratic party leaders in pursuit of his selfdescribed noncandidacy for President.

title: British Aide in Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Oct. 3 (AP)  Lord Carrington, the British Secretary of State for Defense, arrived tonight for a twoday visit to British bases in Cyprus. He will spend the night in Nicosia and make courtesy calls in the morning on the President, Archbishop Malcarios, and the Turkish Cypriot leader and Vice President. Dr. Fazil Kucpuk.

title: Expelled Soviet Aides Leave Britain by Ship
description: LONDON, Oct. 3More than 180 Soviet citizens, many of them diplomats and trade officials expelled on spying charges, left Britain by ship today for Leningrad.

title: TOM GORMAN, 63, STAGE ACTOR, DIES
description: Tom Gorman, who played Stephen Hopkins in the national company of 1776 and Al Smith in Sunrise at Campobello on tour, died Saturday of a pulmonary embolism in Booth Memorial Hospital, Flushing, Queens. He was 63 years old and lived at 149.31 21st Avenue, Whitestone, Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 2  No Title
description: NATICK, Mass., Oct. 3 (AP)  British European Airways has notified members of the family that the passenger list of the airliner that crashed in Belgium included the names of Benjamin Kessell, 45 years old, and his wife, Phyllis, 47, of Natick.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The shriek of an ambulance siren broke the earlySaturday quiet. Then the affluent whine of a silvery jetliner letting down through the smog over Harlem toward a 9 A.M. landing at La Guardia. A Sanitation Department truck lumbered past on schedule, hurling sheets of water against the hubcaps of cars parked at the curb outside the Offtrack Betting Corporation office 215 West 125th Street. Across the street, a man in purple pants halfheartedly mimicked the wiggle of a passing girl, but she paid no attention. On a nearby corner, a group of youngsters in faded green football uniforms dreamed of glory while they waited for their bus.

title: PIANO GRACE SHOWN BY MIRIAM BRICKMAN
description: Composers, particularly in the 19th century, often attempted to translate literature into sound. In her Carnegie Recital Hall concert yesterday afternoon, Miriam Brickman assembled an interesting program of eight such literaryinspired piano works, prefacing each with a reading of the appropriate texts.

title: West in Form as Lakers Overwhelm Houston,12291
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Oct. 3 (AP)  Jerry West's 20 points in the first half led the Los Angeles Lakers to a 12291 National Basketball Association exhibition victory over the Houston Rockets tonight.

title: Theater: Marat/Sade
description: Nothing ventured, nothing gained  but it does seem almost foolhardy for the always developing but always povertystricken CSC Repertory Theater to attempt the Peter Weiss Marat/Sade. New York has already had two Broadway productions of the play  the historic version by Peter Brook for the Royal Shakespeare Company, and another production staged by Donald Driver, which was also extremely successful.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FRENCH JUDGE BARS SNOWTRAGEDY SUIT
description: LYONS, France Oct. 3 (UPI) An examining ??agistrate has thrown out a complaint of criminal negligence lodged by the families of some of the 56 children who were killed in an avalanche that crushed a sanitarium at Plateau d'assy on April 16 last year.

title: Week's Votes in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3Following are the votes of delegations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major roll calls in Congress during the week ended yesterday.

title: A NEW BOOK IS DUE ON JEWS IN SOVIET
description: A new book that deals with the trials of Soviet Jews charged with antiSoviet agitation, entitled Let My People Go, is scheduled for publication Wednesday. It incorporates records that were said to have been kept of closed trials in Leningrad and Riga.

title: Chlorine Blast Kills Boy, 6
description: POMONA, N. Y., Oct. 3 (AP) Michael Defavio, 6 years old, of Pomona, died of injuries yesterday after a bottle of chlorine [Iexploded in his face, the Ramapolice said. They said the youth and an 8yearold neighbor filled a small plastic bottle with water and granular chlorine that had been stored in a garage for a swimming pool. The bottle exploded and the cap hit the Defavio boy in the head. He suffered severe neck laceration from other bottle fragments, the police said.

title: CARDINAL QUESTIONS PUBLIC SCHOOL ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP) United States public schools amount to an establishment of religion in violation of the First Amendment, Patrick Cardinal O'Boyle said today.

title: Brodie Sparks 49ers to a 313 Rout of Eagles
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 3Operating like a surgeon routinely removing an appendix, John Brodie of the San Francisco 49ers cut up the Philadelphia Eagles' shoddy defense today and led his team to an easy 313 victory before a full house of 65,358 in Veterans Stadium.

title: Illinois Prison to Hold Concerts for Inmates
description: JOLIET, Ill., Oct. 3 (AP)The, superintendent of the Joliet branch of the Illinois State Penitentiary announced plans today for a series of concerts designed to try to avoid another prison tragedy like the one at the Attica Correction Facility in New York.

title: MORE AUTOMATION URGED IN MEDICINE
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 3An international panel of doctors said here yesterday that their limited experience had shown that automated procedures in medical practiceto get pertinent facts from patients and to do many laboratory testscould help physicians work more efficiently.

title: Pirates, Orioles Win
description: The Pirates defeated the Giants, 9.4, and tied the National League playoff at one victory each. The Orioles beat the A's, 53, in the first game of the American League playoff. (Details on Page 55.)

title: Books of The Times
description: In Edsel, Karl Shapiro has camouflaged with sex a sermon on poetry, love and integrity. It has taken all his talent as poetturnednovelist to make a funny, touching book out of such unfashionable material.

title: Road to Mideast Peace
description: The tour guide to a Middle East peace settlement which Israeli Foreign Minister Abba Eban mapped out for the United Nations General Assembly last week was an excursion into familiar byways. When stalled peace talks are desperately in need of new directions, Mr. Eben charted five roads to peace. All have been tried before; all have failed so far to bring any measurable progress toward Mideast stability.

title: Cambodian Battle Reported At Hill Overlooking Highway
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 3 (AP)  Cambodian troops driving up Route 6 to relieve beseiged Kompong Thom met heavy enemy resistance today as they tried to dislodge Communistled troops on a hill overlooking the highway, the Cambodian command reported.

title: The Attica Revolt: Hour by Hour
description: The situation at present is rather fluid indeed. All we received were promises of change...

title: Nagle Cards 286 to Win Volvo Open by One Stroke
