description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (Reuters)David C. Melnicoff, first vice president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, has been named deputy executive director of the Federal Reserve Board, the board announced today. The appointment is effective next Tuesday.

title: Detergent Maker Tells of Payments To a Mafia Figure
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5A New Jersey businessman testified today that he paid $2,156.25 a month for eight years to a, Mafia figure who had been hired to promote sales of a detergent.

title: U.S. Hails G.M. Action On Hudson
description: The Federal Government proclaimed success yesterday in its 10month campaign to stop the General Motors Corporation from polluting the Hudson River with industrial waste from its plant in North Tarrytown.

title: KNICKS TURN BACK HAWKS, 112 TO 91
description: The local fans took their first look at this season's Knickerbockers last night at Madison Square Garden and saw the impressive type of talented team basketball the Knicks have shown during the last four years.

title: 1929, a Very Good Year
description: For a nebuchadnezzar, perhaps, but who on earth would pay $6,840 for a mere jeroboam of wine? Well, Paul Manno did, at an auction at Sotheby's in London. He laid out the money for a jeroboam of Chateau Mouton Rothschild 1929 vintage claret, thus setting a world record price for any bottle of wine.

title: Car Crash Kills Bronx Man
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 5 (UPI)A Bronx man was killed and his wife was critically injured today when their automobile ran off the Pennsylvania Turnpike and overturned, throwing both occupants from the vehicle. The dead man was Thomas Fraser, 74 years old, 50 Cambridge Avenue. His wife, Margaret, 67, was taken to St. Francis Hospital in Pittsburgh.

title: Muskie Told He May Face Severe Opposition by Blacks
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) An influential Negro Democrat told Senator Edmund S. Muskie today to remedy the harm he did by ruling out a black running mate or face severe and sustained black opposition to his presidential candidacy.

title: Sports of The Times
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 5He who giveth sometimes also taketh away. Richie Hebner made the exquisite turnaround for the Pittsburgh Pirates on this gorgeous afternoon and the hometown forces are now just one victory removed from winning the National League championship and a place the World Series. In a beautifully played game the Buccaneers muscled past the San Francisco Giants. 21.

title: AGNEW DESCRIBES STRATEGY FOR '72
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 Vice President Agnew declared today that the White House would resume next year its efforts to rid Congress of those he regards as radical liberals.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Marshall Gets Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) Lawyers for Attica prison inmates asked Justice Marshall of the Supreme Court today to halt temporarily the state interrogation of prisoners about last month's rebellion.

title: Ziegfield Club Plans Ball
description: The Ziegfield Club, Inc., the theatrical charity organization that financially assists needy female performers, will hold its 34th annual ball on Nov. 5 at the Pierre Hotel. Paul Gene and his orchestra will supply the music and tickets may be ordered from the club at 55 West 42d Street.

title: 10 Major Mary Pickford Films Being Reissued After 40 Years
description: Ten of the major films of Mary Pickford, the first of the screen's great stars, will be released commercially this month for the first time in 40 years under an agreement reached here by Miss Pickford's representatives and Donald Rugoff, president of Cinema 5.

title: Soviet Dissident's Release Urged
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 5Fortyseven Soviet dissidents, including some of the more prominent ones, protested today against the prolonged detention in a mental hospital of a young intellectual and active dissident, Vladimir K. Bukovsky, and appealed for his release.

title: Baltimore Executioner Spoils A's Gamble in 5th
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 5The Oakland Athletics came to the end of the trail today chiefly because they had gambled and lost on Brooks Robinson, the mildmannered executioner of the Baltimore Orioles.

title: U.S. Rejects Blount Stand
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) The Nixon Administration dissociated itself today from Postmaster General Winton M. Blount's suggestion that Americans boycott French imports because much of the heroin coming to this country originated in France.

title: LebaneseSoviet Relations Strained Over Assertions by Philby on Spying
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 5A strain has developed between Lebanon and the Soviet Union over assertions by H.A.R. (Kim) Philby, who spied in Britain for the Soviet Union and who is now living in Moscow, that a number of Lebanese politicians and journalists were involved in British intelligence activities. The allegations were circulated in Arabic by Tass, the Soviet press agency.

title: RATES DECLINE IN BOND MARKETS
description: Interest rates across a broad spectrum of the credit markets declined yesterday.

title: NEWCAR SALES RISE TO RECORDS
description: DETROIT, Oct. 5Newcar sales shattered records in the final third of September and for the full month with the newmodel introduction, the biggest Fall inventory ever and pricefreeze pressures fueling sales fires.

title: Coast Arraignment Continued
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Oct. 5 (AP)Superior Court Judge E. Warren McGuire today continued until Oct. 15 the arraignment of six San Quentin convicts accused of murder and assault on officers as a result of violence at the prison. He acted after the shackled convicts appeared before him separately and protested they had not been able to get in touch with attorneys.

title: Sanctions for Delays in Trials Expanded Throughout the City
description: A system of sanctions for excessive delays in bringing cases to trial in the Criminal Court is being expanded to all boroughs, Supreme Court Justice David Ross announced yesterday.

title: A GERMAN OIL GROUP SEEKS MIDEAST DEAL
description: BONN, Oct. 5 (Reuters)A West German oil group Deutsche Erdoelversorgungesel sellschaft GmbH (Deminex)is negotiating to purchase a $150million to $200million interest in a Middle East oil concession from the British Petroleum Company, industry sources said today.

title: Nixon in Delaware To Meet Leaders On G.O.P. Dinners
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Oct 5 (AP)President Nixon spent about an hour tonight at a champagne reception with a group of influential Republicans who are planning nationwide Salute to the President fundraising dinners Nov. 9.

title: Wilson Asks Party Unity Against Market
description: BRIGHTON, England, Oct. 5 The proCommon Market wing of the Labor party came under heavy new pressure toclay to conform with the majority position against British membership.

title: Albanian Speech Excerpts
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 5  Following are excerpts from the speech today by the Albanian Foreign Minister, Nesti Nase, as transcribed from the simultaneous translation from the French:

title: BIG BOARD IS SUING BAERWALD & DEBOER
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that its Special Trust Fund was suing Baerwald & DeBoer, a former member firm that toppled into liquidation last year, for the $900,000 that the fund advanced to the firm to aid in the liquidation.

title: Bridge: Defender Misses Opportunity To Let Declarer Make Error
description: A declarer who can explore a variety of chances in a logical sequence is a happy man. But on occasion his plans can be disturbed by a defender who forces him to commit himself in one suit before he has explored another.

title: NICHOL MEMORY, STEVENS AIDE, 79
description: MILLBURN, N. J., Oct. 5Nichol H. Memory, who held many administrative posts at Stevens Institute of Technology in Hoboken, died today in Orange Memorial Hospital, Orange. He was 79 years old and lived at 85 Cedar Street.

title: Seoul Premier Gains In Intraparty Fight, Ousting 2 Key Foes
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. Premier Kim Jong Pil appeared today to have strengthened his position in the governing Democratic Republican party as two of his chief rivals were forced to resign from the party and three others were suspended.

title: Sales Dip by About 1% NineMonth Results Reach New Highs
description: The General Electric Company reported yesterday record thirdquarter earnings, along with new highs in sales and earnings for the first nine months. However, thirdquarter sales fell behind the yearago level.

title: County Legislative Unit Urges Suffolk to Consider OTB Plan
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Oct. 5A proposal to study the feasibility of establishing an offtrack betting system for Suffolk County was issued today by a committee of the county legislature headed by Patrick Adams, Republican of Bay Shore.The proposal called for the appropriation of between $30,000 and $40,000 to establish a committee to decide whether it would be better to tie in with New York City's offtrack computer system than to run an independent operation and to consider the building of a quarterhorse racing facility in the county.

title: FEDERAL PLAN SEEKS TO CURB BAD DRIVERS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) The Federal Government outlined today plans for a major new program in the control of negligent drivers.

title: Nets Gain 10396 Triumph Despite Squires' Late Rally
description: COLOMBIA, S. C., Oct. 5 (AP)The New York Nets survived a late rally by the Virginia Squires and scored a 10386 victory tonight in an American Basketball Association exhibition game at the Carolina Coliseum.

title: School Desegregation Aid Gains; Panel Rejects Nixon Busing Ban
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The House Education and Labor Committee approved today the Nixon Administration's proposal to give Federal financial assistance to communities that are desegregating their schools. The vote was 24 to 3.

title: Leonard Leeming Dies at 69; Pharmaceutical Firm Aide
description: Leonard B. Leeming, a former vice president of the Leeming Pharmaceutical Company, now a division of Pfizer Inc., died Monday in Houston after heart surgery. He was 69 years old and lived at 1112 Park Avenue.

title: FATHER MAXWELL OF BOSTON COLLEGE
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5  A funeral service was held here yesterday for Rev. Joseph R. N. Maxwell, president of Boston College from 1951 to 1958, who died of a heart attack Sept. 19 at Ybbs, Austria. He was 71 years old.

title: The Machismo Factor
description: WASHINGTONOpponents of the war are just beginning to examine the basic wrongheadedness of the foreign policy that led to Indochina. We must recognize the causes of this long and deep misdirection if we are ever to change what the United States has become: the most destructive of the world's great nations.

title: Tribes to Allow Prospecting
description: COULEE DAM, Wash. Oct. 5 (UPI)  An Indian reservation has announced the opening of a million acres of rich mineral land to surface prospecting. The Confederated Tribes of the Colville Reservation said that permits for both airborne and surface exploration would he granted at $100 each. The reservation is known to be rich in gold, silver, copper, lead, zinc and molybdenum.

title: Advertising:
description: Did you know that the average male supermarket shopper is 43.7 years old, makes $11,285 a year and spends $10.46 on each visit. That makes him older and freer with his dough than the average woman shopper.

title: Men With Numbers Over 125 Safe From Draft in 1971
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The Selective Service System announced today that no one with a lottery number above 125 would be drafted this year.

title: Tremors Jolt Central Italy
description: CAMERINO, Italy, Oct. 5 (UPI)  Seven new tremors shook parts of central Italy today, sending thousands of frightened inhabitants fleeing from their homes.

title: PAKISTAN CHARGES INDIA WAGES WAR
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 5Pakistan's chief delegate to the United Nations, Mahmud Ali, said today that India had been carrying on a clandestine war against Pakistan for the past few months, chiefly since violence erupted in East Pakistan in March.

title: Ervin Denounces Nixon Revival of Subversives Board
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. denounced today President Nixon's order reviving the Subversive Activities Control Board, terming it unconstitutional and illegal.

title: Death Row Abolished
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5 (UPI)A Federal magistrate has ruled that convicts in Massachusetts may not be kept on death row for more than 10 days prior to their scheduled execution.

title: Decorating With $500 Instead of $5,000
description: Though the William Norris Hubbards had a combined income of about $26,000, they chose to scavenge for furnishings from East Harlem to Wall Street. What they coudn't find free on the street, they purchased in thrift shops.

title: STOCK PRICES OFF AS DOW SLIPS 452
description: The stock market, a bit unnerved by the erratic action of some leading glamour issues, turned lower yesterday after three gains in a row.

title: Japan Said to Balk At U.S. on Textiles
description: TOKYO, Oct. 5 (UPI)The Kyoto News Agency said today that Japan planned to reopen governmental negotiations with the United States on the textile issue in an attempt to ease the restrictions the United States has proposed as a solution to the dispute.

title: Aussies Win in Rugby Here
description: The Eastern Suburbs Rugby Club of Sydney, Australia, defeated the New York R. C., 226, at Gaelic Park in the Bronx last night. It was the finale of an eightday New York tour by the Australians, who scored 80 points against 9 for various New York clubs in four matches.

title: A Media Center Will Open in Harlem This Month
description: As a first step toward a relevant communityoriented high school, the Committee for a Harlem High School announced yesterday that it planned to open a visual media training center this month.

title: 5WEEK TASK SEEN IN PHONE CATCHUP
description: The state Public Service Commission has estimated that about five weeks' work for the entire regular craft force of the New York Telephone Company would be required to catch up with well over 200,000 orders for telephones piled up during a strike that began July 14.

title: Executive Changes
description: Pan American World Airways, Inc., yesterday named William M. Crilly as senior vice presidentplanning and Charles W. Trippe, who has been vice presidentplanning was named vice presidentcorporate development. Mr. Crilly is a former senior vice presidentplanning for Eastern Airlines. Mr. Trippe in his new position succeeds John W. Gates. Mr. Gates is retiring as an officer of Pan American but is remaining on its board. He continues as chairman of the Economy Hotel, a subsidiary owned jointly by the Pan American and Gulf Oil Corporation.

title: Morris and Baum Plaques Unveiled at State Theater
description: Plaques in memory of Newbold Morris and Morton Baum were unveiled yesterday in the lobby of the New York State Theater at Lincoln Center, for the Performing Arts. The ceremony was attended by the board of directors and members of the artistic constituents of City Center of Music and Drama, Inc.

title: Maybe Hebner Buried The Giants With Homer
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 5Richie Hebner, Pittsburgh's third baseman, spent nine days in a Cincinnati hospital in August with a viral infection in his chest.

title: MISS COLE BOWS AT HARPSICHORD
description: A young woman who has won honors as a violinist and a pianist but makes her official New York recital debut as a harpsichordist must be given a salute for versatility. But Frances Cole, who gave an extraordinarily interesting account of herself on the lastnamed instrument Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, did not settle for such an easy victory.

title: Philadelphia Board Bars Casey Bid on Institutions
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5  The PhiladelphiaBaltimoreWashington Stock Exchange has rejected the request of the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission that it volunitarily stop admitting financial institutions to membership until the end of this year.

title: ACCORD REACHED ON PRISON GUARDS
description: The state agreed last night to establish a maximummaximum security prison, staving off a lockin of inmates at the state's 16 prisons threatened by the guards for tomorrow.

title: Swidler Hints P.S.C . May Allow Half of an Overhead Power Line
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Oct. 5The chairman of the state's Public Service Commission indicated today that the agency might make the first use of its new powers to override local opposition by approving only half of a controversial power line sought by the Consolidated Edison Company.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BELLPORT STRIKE CLOSES 6 SCHOOLS
description: BELLPORT, L. I., Oct. 5Teachers struck the Bellport School District today, canceling classes for 4,200 students in the district's six schools.

title: FB111'S DEPLOYED WITH NUCLEAR ARMS
description: OMAHA, Oct. 5 (Reuters) The FB111 bomber, a descendant of the politically controversial and trouble  plagued TFX, has begun to take over some of the burden of the United States nuclear deterrent force, the Strategic Air Command disclosed today.

title: SAM F. GINGOLD
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 5Sam F. Gingold, founder of the New Haven News Agency, a distributor, died yesterday at St. Raphael's Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 44 North Lake Drive, Hamden.

title: Film Fete: Lives in a Junk Yard in Kurosawa's Dodes'kaden
description: Somewhere in the slums of a great city live a woman and her young idiot son. Every morning the boy prays with his mother and then prepares for his day's work, which is driving an imaginary streetcar from his mother's shack, across acres of piledup trash, to the junkyard shanty town where live most of the characters who populate Akira Kurosawa's Dodes'kaden. The movie played last night in the New York Film Festival at the Vivian Beaumont Theater.

title: Fischer's Winning Streak Ends With Game2 Loss to Petrosian
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 5 (AP) Bobby Fischer of the United States resigned on the 32d move of his second match game with Tigran Petrosian of the Soviet Union today.

title: ALBERT ZUBERIA, 69, URUGUAY'S EXCHIEF
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 5 (UPI)Albert F. Zuberfa, a former Uruguayan chief of state, died yesterday at the age of 69.

title: Players for Ballet Join in a Program Of Chamber Music
description: Usually hidden away in an orchestra pit, ballet and opera musicians undoubtedly long for a little limelight now and then. Not surprisingly, Alexander Horvath, concertmaster of the American Ballet Theater, and Alfred Loeb, its first clarinetist, turned up on the stage of Alice Tulley Hall on Monday night. They were joined by Mitchell Andrews, pianist, and Israel. Chorberg, violinist, who also perform for the dance company on occasion.

title: Music: Masselos's Ives
description: William Masselos devoted the last half of his Town Hall concert, on Monday evening, to the Concord Sonata by Charles Ives. Any time this work is played constitutes news. The battle for Ives has been won this decade, but very few pianists are willing to learn this great clumped mass of notes. It takes a heroic intellectual and technical effort to master the work, and most pianists would rather stop a wild buffalo with their bare hands.

title: Process Shot, $5.20, Takes Sprint Easily at Belmont
description: The old bay mare may not be what she used to be, but Process Shot was good enough to win the feature at Belmont Park yesterday with plenty to spare.

title: Ella Howard Gjeruldsen, 63, Larchmont Insurance Aide
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Oct. 5 Mrs. Ella Howard Gjeruldsen, an insurance broker here and former advertising executive in New York, died yesterday in United Hospital, Port Chester. She was 63 years old and lived at 1299 Palmer Avenue.

title: Nixon Presses Bid to End Mine and Dock Walkouts;
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The Nixon Administration pressed its effort today to end major strikes by soft coal miners and longshoremen.

title: Disturbance in Pennsylvania
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Oct. 5 (UPI)A brief disturbance by about a dozen inmates at the Lehigh County Prison was quickly broken up today and three inmates described as troublemakers by Warden Larry Nero were transferred to two other institutions. Mr. Nero said numerous pieces of furniture in the mess hall were damaged in the melee, which occurred after a grievance meeting with the warden last night.

title: German Calls for End to Surtax;
description: One of Europe's most influential bankers called on the United States yesterday to take the lead in eliminating its 10 per cent surcharge on imports as the first step in resolving the present world financial crisis.

title: Bruder Takes Third Race Of Finn Class Title Sail
description: TORONTO, Oct. 5 (Canadian Press)Jorge Bruder of Brazil, the defending champion, won the third race today in the Finn Class Gold Cup world championship being sailed on Lake Ontario.

title: Study Finds College Is Means to More Satisfying Life
description: College attendance causes many measurable differences in a person's life style in addition to the widely recognized increase in lifetime earnings, according to a new report sponsored by the Carnegie Commission on Higher Education.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: The unpredictability of Ivy League football was apparent after last weekend's results were posted.

title: NATO Meeting on Proposals For EastWest Troop Reduction
David Vend rovsky Dead at 94; Leading Soviet Yiddish Writer
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 5  David Vendrovsky, a Yiddish writer who was a contemporary of Shnlem Aleichem, has died at ate age of 94.

title: Energetic Faust at Met
description: Since the Metropolitan Opera's Faust production is so deficient in style, French or otherwise, the very Italianate approach taken by the three new faces in Monday night's performance was welcome, if for no other reason than the consistency of its energy. In fact, when Renata Scotto, Placido Domingo and Ruggero Raimondi dashed to the footlights and bawled out the final trio, the effect was even exhilarating.

title: Cost Put at $1.7Billion
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 5 (AP)The longest dock strike in Pacific Coast history has cost California, Washington, Oregon and Hawaii at least $1.7billion, and possibly much more, in lost wages and sales, officials in the four states estimated today.

title: HEATH AND FAULKNER TO TALK TOMORROW
description: BELFAST. Northern Ireland, Oct. 5Prime Minister Brian Faulkner will meet with Prime Minister Edward Heath in London on Thursday, it was announced today.

title: Youth Indicted in Bombing
description: A New York County grand jury yesterday handed up a ninecount indictment against a 19yearold high school student charged with exploding a pipe bomb outside the offices of the Democratic Republic of the Congo's mission to the United Nations two weeks ago. Named in the indictment was Larry Pearson of 225 West 129th Street, a student at Louis Brandeis High School. The police apprehended him near the mission at 402 East 51st Street minutes after the explosion on Sept. 20. A child was hurt by broken glass in the explosion.

title: N.A.B. FAVORS ADS ON CHILDREN'S TV
description: The National Association of Broadcasters has warned that the elimination of advertising would sound the death knell for quality children's program fare.

title: 2 SCHOOL BOARDS TO REDUCE STAFFS
description: Officials of Community School Districts 3 and 6 in Manhattan have assured School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner that they will keep within their budget allocations, a Board of Education spokesman said yesterday.

title: Caller Asks $4Million For Vermeer's Return
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 5A man who said he had stolen a Vermeer masterpiece has demanded a $1million donation to East Pakistan relief for its safe return.

title: Article on Abortion Barred
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Oct. 5Lester Hale, vice president of the University of Florida, last night blocked publication of abor tion information in the student newspaper, the Florida Alligator. He cited a 103yearold state statute that provides up to a $1,000 fine and a year in prison for anyone who gives out abortion information. The barred article was to have contained a list of abortion referral services.

title: Dolphins Outslip Jets On Artificial Grass
description: MIAMI, Oct. 5 (AP)The New York Jets beat Miami, 1410, in last Sunday's game, but the Dolphins outslipped Weeb Ewbank's surerfooted heroes, 3326, on the artificial Orange Bowl turf.

title: Fanny May Accepts Bids
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) The Federal National Mortgage Association today accepted $194 8million of the $365.6million in bids it received for threemonth mortgage commitments.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: TOKYO, Oct. 5 (AP)President Nikolai V. Podgorny of the Soviet Union completed two days of talks in Hanoi today, the North Vietnamese press agency reported.

title: Equal Rights for Women
description: There is a widespread demand from women in business and the professions for a constitutional amendment which would write into the nation's fundamental law a guarantee of their full equality. The House of Representatives is about to consider such an amendment. The justice of women's claim to equality is indisputable. No rationally defensible ground exists for discrimination against a woman on account of her sex.

title: Attica Prisoners Opposing A Double Role in Inquiry
description: NUFFALO, Oct. 5A lawyer for inmates at the Attica Correctional Facility asked today for a Federal order barring the state's Deputy Attorney General, Robert E. Fischer, from directing simultaneously the investigation of both inmates and state troopers in connection with the uprising at the prison last month.

title: Births
description: HELMERJohn and Margaret (Santi) announce the birth of a son, Jason Daniel, in Cambridge, Mass. October 5, 1971.

title: Double Talk on Federal Pay
description: Unless the Senate introduces some element of sanity today into the Government's approach to wage policy for Federal civilian and military employes, Congress and the Administration will be partners in leading the national fight against inflation into a dangerous culdesac.

title: Cemetery Workers Obtain Agreement In California Strike
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 5 (UPI)An agreement was announced early today in the fourmonthold strike by cemetery workers that has left more than 1,800 bodies unburied.

title: BRIBERY OF POLICE WIDESPREAD HERE, U.S. AIDE CHARGES
description: A strike force against organized crime has obtained evidence that teams of New York policemen have received bribes up to $25,000 to let individual narcotics dealers avoid arrest, according to the head of the Federal unit.

title: Big Board Antitrust Suit Is Filed by Missouri Firm
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 5 (AP)A Clayton, Mo., brokerage firm that sold its New York Stock Exchange seat in February filed suit yesterday in Federal District Court seeking $20million in damages from the exchange for alleged violation of the Sherman and Clayton Antitrust Acts.

title: Haile Selassie of Ethiopia Arrives in China for Visit
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 6Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia arrived in China yesterday on a visit of more than ordinary significance.

title: Lions' Press Box Closed to Karras, Sports Columnist
description: DETROIT. Oct. 5 (UPI)Alex Karras, a former Detroit Lions' star, may be violating terms of his contract with the club because of his outside writing activities, a Lion spokesman said today.

title: U.S. Denies It Weighs Any Plan For Military Action With Israel
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The State Department denied today that the United States was considering or discussing with Israel any joint military action as an assurance against potential violations of an interim Middle Eastern peace agreement.

title: U.S. Fights Dismissal of Guilty Verdict
description: The Government acted yesterday to compel a Federal judge to reinstate an indict ment he had dismissed after sentencing a man convicted of smuggling Swiss watch movements.

title: East Pakistani Frogmen Damage Ship
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Oct. 5Diplomatic sources reported today that guerrilla divers damaged a Greek tanker with explosives in the East Pakistani port of Chittagong Friday night in a continuing campaign to hamper shipping.

title: Argentina Enters Currency Trading To Support Peso
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 5Argentina's central bank reportedly dumped enough United States dollars onto the money market here today to prevent the peso from sinking to a new low. The dollar bill had risen 10 points yesterday to 7.4 pesos on the parallel or black market.

title: Reverse Priorities on Taxes
description: The tax bill the House of Representatives will vote on today is an improvement on the legislation originally sought by President Nixon, but it remains a bill that has its priorities all wrong.

title: U.S. Raid Nets 36 Illegal Aliens In TreasurerDesignate's Plant
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 5 Agents of the Federal Immigration and Naturalization Service raided today a factory owned by President Nixon's nominee for Treasurer of the United States, Mrs. Romana A. Banuclos, and arrested 36 illegal immigrants.

title: Salomon Urges Freely Negotiated Rates
description: William R. Salomon, managing partner of Salomon Brothers, called yesterday for the free negotiation of sales commissions on more stock transactions and said financial institutions should be allowed to join the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Habib Sworn In as Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) Ambassador Philip Charles Habib, a diplomat with long experience in Asia's divided countries of Korea and Vietnam, was sworn in today as the new United States Ambassador to South Korea.

title: Prisoner Files Freeze Suit
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 5 (UPI)An inmate at Stateville Prison filed a $250,000 damage suit today charging corrections officials with raising prices in the prison commissary in violation of President Nixon's wageprice freeze. The complaint was filed by mail in Federal District Court by Robert Demary, who said his civil rights were violated because citizens outside the prison are not forced to pay higher prices for items included in the President's freeze.

title: Forewarning on Dollar
description: Economic Analysis

title: Torme Shows Versatility
description: Mel Torm has developed so many different facets of his musical talents during the last 30 years (although he is now only 46 years old) that he is always faced with the problem of which one to put in the forefront.

title: Bethea Finishes Rowe in 9th; Finnegan Halts Rouse in 4th
description: LONDON, Oct. 5 (Reuters)Tom Bethea, 160 pounds, of New York, who last year stopped a former world middleweight champion, Nino Benvenull, scored an impressive victory tonight over Britain's Mark Rowe, 159.

title: Peking Announces Trip
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 5The Chinese press agency, Hsinhua, announced Mr. Kissinger's coming visit today in a dispatch from Peking.

title: CITY PLEDGE ENDS TENANTS' PROTEST
description: By jamming traffic on a busy southbound Manhattan thoroughfare for two hours yesterday, tenants of a firedamaged West Side apartment house won promises from the city for immediate rehabilitation of the building and relocation benefits for some of the tenants.

title: It Shakes Japanese Concerns
description: Yoshizane Iwasa, the chairman of the Fuji Bank, said here yesterday that Japan's small and mediumsized companies had been severely shaken by the imposition of the Unted States import surcharge and the subsequent floating of the yen.

title: 5 Seek to Succeed Thant in Most Impossible Job
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 5Five willing diplomats are competing to succeed U Thant in what the late Trygve Lie, the first Secretary General, called the most impossible job on earth.

title: Blast Reported in Soviet
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Oct. 5 (Reuters)  The Seismological Institute today recorded powerful seismological signals from an area west of the Urals in the Soviet Union. The institute said the signals probably stemmed from an underground explosion,

title: The American Sense of Guilt
description: It is difficult for a foreigner to talk to an American these days on any of the main political issues without detecting a somewhat hidden sense of guilt.

title: Administration Is Scored on Lag in Birth Curb Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Senator Alan Cranston accused the Nixon Administration today of disobeying the law by failing to submit to Congress its fiveyear program for birth control that was due more than three months ago.

title: 2 Dead and 32 Hurt as Gunmen Attack Philippine Protesters
description: MANILA, Oct. 5Some 800 youths, denied a permit to demonstrate in Caloocan, a suburb of Manila, marched at 5 o'clock this afternoon and were met by homemade bombs and by gunfire from masked men in civilian clothing. Two youths were killed and 32 were injured and taken to hospitals.

title: Democrats' National Treasurer May Oppose Tower for Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Robert R. Strauss, treasurer of the Democratic National Committee, is seriously considering running for the Senate seat occupied by John G. Tower of Texas, a twoterm Republican.

title: JUSTICE AIDE CITES PLAN TO BANH AND GUN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UN) A Justice Department official told Congress today that the Administration hoped to propose legislation soon that would outlaw the sale of Saturday night special handguns, but that it was troubled by the technical problem of classifying such weapons.

title: F.P.C. Says It Has Power To Allocate Interstate Gas
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (Reuters)The Federal Power Commission ruled today that it had authority to allocate natural gas supplies of interstate pipelines to all customers.

title: Giants Waive Longo, Defensive Back
description: Telling Tom Longo he was no longer a New York Giant was the hardest task Coach Alex Webster had yesterday. A series of circumstances stemming from the acquisition of Reggie Rucker bumped Longo off the taxi squad, where he had been since he injured an ankle in the second exhibition game almost two months ago.

title: 150 in Paris Assail U.S.
description: PARIS, Oct. 5  About 150 youths demonstrated in front of the United States Consulate tonight against United States policy in Vietnam.

title: KISSINGERTO VISIT CHINA TO PREPARE FOR NIXON'S TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The White House announced today that Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security affairs, would leave for China later this month to make concrete arrangements for the President's visit to Peking.

title: Norton Simon Expects an Advance of 15% in Its Net Income
description: Earnings of Norton Simon, Inc., for the first fiscal quarter ended Sept. 30 will approximate $11.2million, or from 82 to 84 cents a share, according to the 15 per cent increase projected yesterday by David J. Mahoney, chairman and president of the big, consumerproducts company.

title: RICHARD G. NEVILLE
description: MILLBROOK, N. Y., Oct. 4Richard G. Neville, a computer programing manager at the International Business Machines Corporation in Poughkeepsie, died today of cancer at his home here. He was 39 years old.

title: Cambodians Said to Fall Back
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 5 (Reuters)A Cambodian task force that cut through an enemy ring around the provincial capital of Kompong Thom has reportedly fallen back after making brief contacts with troops inside the beleaguered city.

title: Nurse Is Raped and Doctor Is Robbed in Queens Office
description: A 28yearold nurse in the office of a Queens podiatrist was raped twice and her employer was robbed of $500 in cash and $1,700 in jewelry by two knifewielding men shortly before 8 o'clock last night in Queens Village, the police reported.

title: RUSSIAN, CALLED SPY, WILL REMAIN AT U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 5 (Reuters)Moscow gave its formal assent today to a United Nations proposal to extend for two years the contract of a Soviet national named in a report in The New York Times as a veteran officer of the Soviet secret police.

title: Senate Rejects Buckley Move to Add Funds to Improve Missiles
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Senator James L. Buckley, joined by a small group of conservatives, was defeated today in an attempt to add $42million to the defense budget for development of improved, highaccuracy strategic missiles.

title: DUAL RATE URGED TO SPUR HOUSING
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 5 (UPI) Oakley Hunter. president of the Federal National Mortgage Association, today proposed a dual interest rate for F.H.A.insured and V.A.guaranteed housing that he said would attract more money to finance Governmentsupported housing in states, such as California, where costs are higher.

title: Bucher of Pueblo to Join Mine Flotilla 1 in Pacific
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 5 (AP)The Pentagon confirmed that Comdr. Lloyd M. Bucher, former skipper of the captured intelligence ship Pueblo, had been assignd to the Wet Pacific at his request and will take over as chief staff officer for Mine Flotilla 1 in December. The flotilla's home port is on Guam.

title: ExState Attorney General Tells Why He Denied Sharing in Fees Paid to Alioto
description: VANCOUVER, Wash., Oct. 5 John J. O'Connell told a Superior Court jury here today why he twice denied that he had shared in the fees paid to Joseph L. Alioto from utilities antitrust litigation in the state of Washington.

title: 4 MEN INDICTED IN STOCK THEFT
description: Four men were indicted yesterday in connection with the theft of $839,000 in securities from a Wall Street brokerage firm in the fall of 1970.

title: Prison Inmates in Massachusetts Locked Up After Work Stoppage
description: WALPOLE, Mass., Oct. 5 (AP)  Officials at Walpole State Prison agreed to a request by the prison's employes union today and locked up all inmates after a work stoppage.

title: MELVILLE NAUHEIM, ARCHITECT, WAS 81
description: Melville Nauheim, who designed art galleries, private residences and other buildings in the metropolitan area until his retirement several years ago, died yesterday at his home. He was 81 years old and lived at 60 East 96th Street.

title: A. M. C. in Bus Deal
description: DETROIT, Oct. 5 (Reuters)The American Motors Corporation said today it has reached agreement with Flyer Industries, Ltd., of Winnipeg, Manitoba, to produce the Flyer diesel and electric city transit buses and dieselpowered intercity buses.

title: RIPON SOCIETY GIVES 100% TO M'CLOSKEY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) Representative Paul N. McCloskey of California, the only declared challenger to President Nixons' renomination, compiled a perfect voting record last year on issues central to the traditions of the Republican party, according to the Ripon Society.

title: McGovern Plans to Enter Primary in Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5 (AP)Senator George McGovern said today he had made a definite and final decision to enter the Massachusetts Presidential primary next April.

title: LAND MINE KILLS A SOUTH AFRICAN
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Oct. 5Prime Minister John Vorster announced tonight that a South African officer had been killed and four policemen injured in landmine explosions just south of the border of Zambia yesterday and today.

title: An Art Opener: Painter's Light
description: When you can go to your own storerooms and pull out a few paintings by Rembrandt, Corot, Vermeer, Lorrain, Monet, Seurat, Tintoretto, Degas and names like that, and can borrow a few more, including a Georges de la Tour, and when in addition you have the savvy to combine them with paintings by such comparatively obscure names as Emanuel de Witte, Franois Marius Granet and Mattia Pretinot to mention Edward Hopper, the solitary giantyou can put together a pretty good show on just about any subject you choose. In the pilot exhibition for a continuing project, the Metropolitan Museum's department of European paintings and its department of public education have tackled an encyclopedic theme, The Painter's Light, and have done an excellent job considering the exhibition's thumbnail size and shoestring budget.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bengali Refugees Stirring Strife in India
description: CALCUTTA, India, Oct. 4With a reported 30,000 East Pakistani refugees crossing into India daily to join the millions already here, tensions are building in the overcrowded refugee camps and between the refugees and local people.

title: SAIGON'S FORCES SAID TO ROUT FOE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Oct. 6 (AP)A South Vietnamese general said yesterday that a badly battered North Vietnamese force was in retreat after 10 days of fighting along the Cambodian border northwest of here.

title: Brooke Recommends Jurist
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., Oct. 5 (AP)  Senator Edward W. Brooke, Republican of Massachusetts, has recommended Masschusetts Supreme Court Justice Francis J. Quirico for one of two vacancies on the United States Supreme Court. Sector Brooke said yestersday that he had made the recommendation in a letter to President Nixon. Senator Brooke called Justice Quirico, a Democrat, a brilliant and dedicated jurist.

title: Lindsay Names Four to New Environment Board
description: Nominees for four public positions on the newly created Environmental Control Board were, submitted yesterday by Mayor Lindsay to the City Council for its approval.

title: Queen and Quiet Crowds Greet Hirohito in London
description: LONDON, Oct. 5Emperor Hirohito of Japan was greeted by the largest crowds of his European goodwill tour today when he arrived in Britain for a threeday state visit.

title: Rep. Jonas to Retire
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C. Oct. 5 (AP)  Representative Charles R. Jonas, Republican of North Carolina, says he will not seek elections next year to an 11th term. I've been considering getting out of public life for years, the 66yearold Jonas yesterday. The end of 20 years seems to be a good time to go.

title: Guns Barred in Wilmington, N.C., After Sniping and Racial Unrest
description: WILMINGTON, N. C., Oct. 5 (UPI)  Public possession of firearms was barred today in this port city, which has been beset by sniper fire against the police in black neighborhoods and rallies by armed whites.

title: FORD SUIT URGED ON AIR POLLUTION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The Environment Protection Agency has asked the Justice Department to sue the Ford Motor Company for alleged violation of the Clean Air Act.

title: Just Who's Loony Now?
description: SPETSAT, GreeceThe embourgeoisement of a society is regarded by many contemporary political observers as a precondition for that society's liberation. This view is often adduced with respect to the Soviet Union and, more recently, China.

title: Walkout Closes Race Track
description: PAWTUCKET, R.I., Oct. 5 (UPI)A walkout by members of Local 281 of the Laborers Union at Narragansett race track forced cancellation of tonight's ninerace program.

title: PRESIDENT SEES AIDES ON PHASE 2
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5President Nixon met with his top economic advisers today to comment on their recommendations for the second phase of his economic stabilization plan.

title: Market Place: Mini Computer: Some Concern
description: Daniel Alroy, Philips, Appel & Walden's hightechnology consultant, is deeply concerned about the future of the minicomputer companies.

title: Albania Says Peking Bars Any 2China Plan at U. N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 5The Foreign Minister of Albania, Nesti Nase, told the General Assembly today that Peking remained unalterably opposed to any arrange ment that would provide for the seating of two Chinese regimes in the United Nations. Mr. Nase read into the record a statement made Aug. 20 by the Chinese Communist Government that it would have absolutely nothing to do with the United Nations if a twoChina or a ChinaandTaiwan situation were created.

title: Track Chiefs Assail OTB
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Oct. 5 (UPI)The Council of New York State Harness Tracks charged today that declines in attendance and handle at the state's tracks had been caused by of ftrack betting and called for a legislative audit of OTB.

title: SID WOLF
description: Sid Wolf, an executive of Cisco, Inc., a men's wear manufacturer at 16 East 34th Street, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived at 201 West 77th Street.

title: Debate on Tax Bill Is Short in House; Vote Set for Today
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5The House of Representatives began and finished debate on the tax bill today and headed toward a lopsided formal vote of approval tomorrow.

title: MOSCOW AND BONN AGREE ON AN AIR LINK
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 5The Soviet Union and West Germany today reported agreement on establishment of a direct air link between the two countries, to be served by the Soviet Government airline Aeroflot and by Lufthansa, the West German carrier.

title: COURT BACKS PLEA ON NUCLEAR BLAST
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals ordered a lower court today to reconsider its dismissal of a suit seeking to halt the big underground nuclear explosion planned for Alaska's Amchitka Island this month.

title: JETS ARE FINALLY IN HOME QUARTERS
description: The New York Jets finally came home yesterday. They worked out for the first time at Shea Stadium after having had to spend the first three weeks of the season practicing on Rikers Island.

title: Books of The Times
description: CRUISING SPEED. By William F. Buckley Jr. 257 pages. G. P. Putnam's Sons. $6.95.

title: Nathan Hack Is Dead at 87; Devised Ripple Sole Shoe
description: SOUTHFIELD, Mich., Oct. 51 (AP)Nathan Hack, the shoe manufacturer credited with creating the Ripple Sole shoe, died yesterday at his home in Santa Monica, Calif. He was 87 years old.

title: Hospital Ombudswoman Knows 2 Sides of Charts
description: Alone in her Bronx walkup apartment, 74yearold Mrs. K was on the verge of hysteria as she reached for the telephone to call New York HospitalCornell Medical Center.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Louisiana Vote to Be Held
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) Supreme Court Justice Potter Stewart declined today to postpone elections to the Louisiana Legislature under a chatlenged reapportionment plan.

title: 7 Dutch Paintings Stolen
description: DORDRECHT, the Netherlands, Oct, 5 (AP)Seven paintings, worth about $90,000 were stolen during the niglfrom the Dordrecht Museum. The works, by Dutch masters, included two by Albert Cuyp, who was born in Dordrecht in 1620. It was the second art theft reported in this country this week.

title: Proposed State Relief Projects in 3 Areas Scored
description: The state's proposed welfare demonstration projects in West Harlem and in Rockland and Franklin Counties have come under fire as violating constitutional guarantees for equal treatment. This is among the issues raised in a critique being distributed by the National Assembly for Social Policy and Development, a social planning group.

title: Big Board Honoring Member, 85
description: The New York Stock Exchange will honor one of its senior members today when Jacob Bleibtreu, an 85yearold limited partner of Abraham & Co., marks his 50th anniversary as a member of the exchange.

title: DEMOCRATS SHIFT JERSEY CITY STAND
description: JERSEY CITY, Oct. 5The oldline Democratic organization reversed itself here today and endorsed Morris T. Longo, the city's Public Works Director, as its candidate in the special mayoral election on Nov. 2.

title: DR. HARRY R. LEHMAN
description: Dr. Harry R. Lehman, a Brooklyn physician, died Monday in Jewish Hospital after suffering injuries last Friday in a fall in his office at 631 Eastern Parkway. He was 62 years old and lived at 37 West 12th Street in Manhattan.

title: Kosygin, in Algeria, Opens Talks With Boumediene
description: ALGIERS, Oct. 5 (AP) Premier Alexei N. Kosygin and President Houari Boumediene opened political discussions today, the second day of the Soviet Premier's visit to Algeria.

title: From Street Theater, an Everyman
description: I am almost at a loss for words. On Monday night at the meeting house of the Ethical Culture Society on West 64th Street, something described as an epic rock opera opened. Called Everyman and roach, this has been written by Geraldine Fitzgerald and Brother Jonathan, O.S.F., with music by John Orlando. It was full of good intentions, but its achievements seemed to be more in the realm of sociology than art.

title: Alex Johnson Traded To Indians by Angels
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Oct. 5 (AP)The California Angels traded their problem player, Alex Johnson, to the Cleveland Indians today.

title: Militant Students in Saigon Vow to Pursue Struggle
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 5The militant students here, bitter opponents of President Nguyen Van Thieu and of the Americans, who support him, say they will continue their campaign against the President and his allies.

title: Distant Galaxy Photographed by Radio Waves
description: LEYDEN, The Netherlands After years of invention, experiment and improvisation radio astronomers have been able to produce a photograph of a distant galaxy, as observed in radio waves, almost as detailed as those taken through the most powerful optical telescopes.

title: Itemized Budget For State Urged By C. O. P. Panel
description: ALBANY, Oct. 5  The Assembly Ways and Means Committee recommended today a reform of the state budgetwriting process that would include executive submission to the Legislature of detailed spending bills rather than requests for lumpsum appropriations

title: Film Festival Contractsand Thrives
description: The Ninth New York Film Festival, says Richard Roud, is a belttightening festival, a year of consolidation.

title: Israel Withholds Response
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 5The Israeli Government withheld reaction today to Secretary of State William P. Rogers's remarks on an interim agreement in the Middle Eastern dispute made yesterday in the United Nations General Assembly. But newspapers expressed anger.

title: Joyce Kilmer Would Have Loved Her
description: Miss Laura King, who lives in Ocean Grove, N.J., came to New York last week. It was her first visit in several years, and she was brimming over with delight at the beautiful, kind, lovely and courteous citizens she had encountered. Not at all what she had been led to expect, she said.There are, however, thousands of unofficial participants, from young children to senior citizens.

title: Prices on Amex Slip as Volume Eases
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange moved in a narrow range yesterday and finished lower in slower trading.

title: Redemptions Exceeded By SavingsBond Sales
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI)SavingsBond sales in September exceeded redemptions for the 12th consecutive month, the Treasury Department said yesterday.

title: Goldman, Sachs Unit Starts To Sell Eurodollar Paper
description: LONDON, Oct. 5 (Reuters)The Goldman Sachs International Corporation announced today that it had begun marceting Eurodollar commercial paper.

title: Court Orders Reinstatement Of President of College Here
description: Dr. Theodore Powell, who was dismissed as president of Kingsborough Community College July 15, was ordered reinstated yesterday by the State Supreme Court.

title: Excerpts From News Parley
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Following are excerpts from the transcript of a White House news conference con ducted by Henry A. Kissinger, the President's adviser, on his forthcoming trip to Peking:

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Planetarium Plans Opening Of New Theater Tomorrow
description: The American MuseunrlHayden Planetarium announced yesterday that its $150,000 space theater would open at 1:50 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Smuggling of Criminals Into U.S. Cited
description: More than 1,000 Italian workers and criminals have been illegally smuggled into the United States through Canadian Mafia connections in the last two years, the director of a Federal anticrime task force said last night.

title: 4 Students Arrested in Newark School Disorder
description: NEWARK, Oct. 5 (AP)Four students were arrested and several persons, including a patrolman, were injured outside Barringer High School today in the second straight day of racial conflict at the school.

title: Judge in Roy Cohn Case Rejects Prosecution Bid for a Mistrial
description: The prosecution in the Federal court trial of Roy M. Cohn requested a mistrial yesterday after the defense told the jury that Mr. Cohn had been acquitted in a previous trial.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mosbacher Wins 3 Races To Take Challenge Sailing
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I., Oct. 5Bob Mosbacher's Adelez won three races today to take the Seawanhaka International Challenge Cup competition as the sixrace event ended on Long Island Sound.

title: Alfred T. Harris Is Dead at 61; A Senior Editor at Bond Buyer
description: SMITHTOWN, L.I., Oct. 5Alfred T. Harris, senior associate editor of The Bond Buyer, a newspaper concerned with municipal finance, died today at St. John's Hospital, after having been in failing health for the last year. He was 61 years old and lived at 69 Brooksite Drive.

title: Advertising:
description: Most everyone I talk to, writes a reader, says if there is one thing they will not buy it is Sharmin [he meant Charmin] tissues because of what most people think is a nauseous commercial on TV (Don't squeeze the Sharmin [he still means Charmin] etc.). I'd be interested in knowing what response there has been to this ad  whether S[C]harmin sales have actually increased (or declined) and to what extent.

title: Hebner's Homer in 8th Downs Marichal
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 5Twelve minutes before the third game of the National League playoff was scheduled to start today, Danny Murtaugh the Pittsburgh manager, learned that his starter, Nelson Briles, wouldn't be able to pitch. Briles had aggravated a thigh injury while warming up.

title: Revisit to Peking
description: So there is somebody in charge in Peking, after all. And whoever he is, he reacted very quickly to the message Secretary of State Rogers meant to convey when he wondered out loud in public last Saturday about the possibilityas contrasted with the earlier certainty of a visit by President Nixon to Peking. Less than 72 hours after Mr. Rogers spoke, the United States and Chinese Governments announced simultaneously yesterday that Henry Kissinger and a sizable party of other American officials will soon be visiting Peking to prepare for the Nixon trip. The party line now is that there was never any uncertainty.

title: Senate Unit Votes Proposal To Suspend Aid to Pakistan
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (Reu. ters)The Senate Foreign Relations Committee voted a proposal today to suspend economic and military aid to Pakistan, according to committee members.

title: Cairo Is Chosen Capital Of New Arab Federation
description: CAIRO, Oct. 5Cairo was chosen today to be the capital of the new Federation of Arab Republics, which was endorsed Sept. 1 by the voters of Egypt, Syria and Libya.

title: About Pro Football
description: It is not what George Allen, the coach, did to the Washington Redskins, pro football's only unbeaten team, by means of his famous 19 trades. It is what he did to transform the players he inherited. Washington's upset triumph over Dallas could be credited to its offensive line, which beat the Cowboys to the punch on Sunday and let Larry Brown and Charlie Harraway run for 192 yards. Walter Rock and Jim Snowden are the tackles; Ray Schoenke and John Wilbur the guards, Len Hauss the center. Allen brought in Wilbur from Los Angeles. The others were Redskin fixtures even when Vince Lombardi arrived there in 1969.

title: P.B.S. Cancels Segment on the F.B.I. for Tonight's Great American Dream Machine
description: The Public Broadcasting Service, responsible for national distribution of public television programs, has ordered t ehdeletion of a segment labeled Special Report from The Great American Dream Machine, to be shown tonight at 9 o'clock on National Education Television.

title: Miss Coca to Do Under Sycamore Tree
description: Imogene Coca has agreed to appear in the Broadway revival of Under the Sycamore Tree, the Sam Spewack comedy that takes a look at human civilization through the eyes of a colony of ants who find it wanting.

title: CONSERVATIONISTS SEEK INDUSTRY AID
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Oct. 2 The North Jersey Conservation Foundation, an environmental group concerned with land use and conservation education, has appealed to more than 20 major pharmaceutical, chemical and business concerns in the area for substantial financial support.

title: AUTOMATION WINS HUNTER LAURELS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 5The first Philadelphia Horse Showwith hopes of becoming a fullfledged member of the prestigious fall circuitopened at The Spectrum today.

title: L.I. GROWTH HELD SLOWEST IN AREA
description: UPTON, L. I., Oct. 5For the first time in more than a century, Long Island is growing at a slower rate than the rest of the metropolitan area, according to the vice president of the New York Regional Plan Association.

title: Senator Warned Poff of a Floor Battle
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5A few hours before Representative Richard H. Poff decided last Friday to decline an almost certain Presidential nomination to the United States Supreme Court, he was given a friendly warning by the Senate Democratic whip, Robert C. Byrd of West Virginia.

title: Borek Leads Area Golf With 67
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Oct. 5A little course knowledge is useful in golf, said Gene Borek after he shot a 67 today to lead the first round of the Metropolitan Professional Golfers Association championship at the Sunningdale Country Club. Borek, wha was an assistant for nine years at Sunningdale, scored a fourunderpar round as he tied the course record he set in 1963.

title: SILVER FUTURES DECLINE TO LOWS
description: Prices of silver futures dropped to new lifeofcontract lows yesterday, with liquidation and margin selling again weakening prices on the Commodity Exchange here.

title: Brush Fire Rages on Coast
description: FILLMORE, Calif., Oct. 5 (UPI)A fire believed to have been started by an arsonist flamed through more than 2,000 acres of Ventura County brush land today, driven by gusty winds to within 50 feet of outlying homes in this city of 6,000.

title: The Pentagon Cries Wolf
description: The Pentagon's credibility gap is showing again. Defense officials put heavy pressure on members of the Senate last month to obtain quick passage of the new Selective Service Act, arguing that unless the draft were speedily reinstated the nation faced a serious military manpower crisis. What crisis?

title: Colonel's Defense Seeks to Tell Jury of Lie Tests
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Oct. 5Defense attorneys for Col. Oran K. Henderson argued today that his courtmartial jury should be permitted to learn that the defendant voluntarily took a lie detector test at the request of the Government.

title: Orioles Win, 53, and Capture Pennant; Pirates Beat Giants, 21, to Go One Up
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 5The Baltimore Orioles won their third straight American League pennant today when they defeated the Oakland Athletics, 53, for a threegame sweep of the EastWest playoff.

title: Orioles Win Pennant
description: The Orioles won the American League pennant yesterday by beating the Athletics, 53, for the third straight time in the playoff. The Pirates defeated the Giants, 2.1, and led the National playoff by two games to one. (Details on Page 57.)

title: Furniture Maker and Bank Agree to Reduce Dividends
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) A Virginia furniture manufacturer and a Pennsylvania bank have agreed to cut fourthquarter dividend payments to compensate for increases made during the wageprice freeze, the Cost of Living Council said today.

title: In the Mideast: The Soviet Must Get Out
description: WASHINGTONIt is my belief that our policies today are inadequate to meet our responsibilities in the Middle East. The consequences of that inadequacy are to our danger.

title: Hotel Denied Fee Rise
description: DETROIT, Oct. 5 (UPI)The Sheraton  Cadillac Hotel's attempt to raise the price of pay toilets in the men's room to 25 cents from 10 cents has failed. Patrick Birmingham, general manager of the hotel, said yesterday wage  price freeze enforcers at the Internal! Revenue Service had told him the increase would be illegal.

title: A 3Year Extension Of Sugar Quota Act Sent to President
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) Congress has sent President Nixon a threeyear extension of the law apportioning United States sugar market shares among Americans and friendly foreigners.

title: Dallas to Use Force
description: DALLAS, Oct. 5 (UPI) Sheriff Clarence Jones said today that his jail would scrap its liberal policies toward prisoners and install a policy of force in answer to a riot that occurred on the top two floors last night.

title: Call 6371212 for Scores
description: The New York Telephone Company again will provide inning  by  inning scores of the Major League divisional championship playoffs, as well as the World Series. The number to call is 6371212, which is the company's time bureau. Final scores will be carried for one hour after the games are over. Please do not telephone The Times for scores.

title: Panel Democrats Fail to Cut Campaign Fund Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Democrats on the House Commerce Committee failed today to overturn a Republican amendment designed to double the amount of money that political candidates can spend on radio and television campaigning.

title: Housing Is Started To Serve Red Hook And Force None Out
description: A $2million housing project designed to show how we can redevelop an area without forcing people out of the community was officially begun yesterday in the Red Hook section of Brooklyn.

title: LONG ISLAND WINNER IN TRIANGULAR GOLF
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Oct. 5  A powerful finish by the teams of Mrs. Raymond FrisbyMrs. Charles Cullen and Mrs. Vincent de Paul LarkinMrs. Sanford Goldzier, who grossed 11 points, enabled Long Island to retain its triangular Scotch play championship toddy with 22 points against New Jersey 2 and Westchester's 18 in the 11th competition at the Old Westbury Golf and Country Club.

title: JOHN E. COOK
description: HAVERSTRAW, N. Y., Oct. 5 John E. Cook, a Rockland county Democratic leader, who had served as Mayor of Haverstraw, the first Rockland County probation officer, Rockland County Sheriff and County Welfare Commissioner, died today in Good Samaritan Hospital, Suffern. He was 79 years old and lived at 24 Westside.

title: US, RENT FREEZE ASKED BY TENANTS
description: The freezing of rents across the nation until next May and the formation of a national organization of tenants were called for yesterday by New York and New Jersey tenant leaders and a regional officer of the United Automobile Workers.

title: 10 Nigerian Workers Killed
description: IBADAN, Nigeria, Oct. 6 (Reuters)  A fivestory apartment house under construction on the outskirts of Ibadan collapsed today, killing at least 10 workers and trapping up to 50.

title: MRS. THOMAS B. PECK
description: BETHESDA, Md., Oct. 6Mrs. Agnetta Floris Peck, widow of Thomas B. Peck, an insurance executive of New York and Syosett, L.I., died here today at the age of 90.

title: Barzel vs. Brandt
description: Rainer Barzel won his campaign for the chairmanship of West Germany's biggest party in the cut and thrust of parliamentary debate. As floor leader of the Christian Democratic Union in the Bundestag, he built a reputation as skillful tactician, articulate partisan and formidable opponent. He now must build a comparable reputation outside Bonn if he is to lead his party back to power and become Chancellor in the 1972 elections.

title: HENDERSON GAINS A POINT AT TRIAL
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Oct. 6 The military judge in the trial of Col. Oran K. Henderson ruled today that a key prosecution witness would not be permitted to make a courtroom identification of the defendant.

title: Vietnamese Food Far From the Front LinesNorth Carolina
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N. C.Payday comes to Fort Bragg twice a month. Thirtynine thousand military personnel desert their 150,000acre base and head, by car, bus and thumb, along the plastic wasteland of Bragg Boulevard looking for fun.

title: Chairman of C.A.B. Outlines Proposals To Cut Pan Am Loss
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6The chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, expressing concern about the mounting losses at Pan American World Airways, has outlined to the White House a number of drastic remedies, including subsidy, Governmentguaranteed loans, domestic route authority for the international carrier and curtailment of its competition abroad.

title: CITY TO SPEED PAY FOR CONTRACTORS
description: The Lindsay administration sought to reassure contractors yesterday that it had taken steps to correct two lungstanding complaints  delayed city payments and vandalism  to attract more bidders for city jobs.

title: Bridge: Michael and Gail Moss Win Title Each in Same Tourney
description: For a husband and wife to win a major bridge title is not uncommon, but for them to win separate titles simultaneously is something of a rarity.

title: Pope Says That Synod Will Not Alter Doctrine
description: ROME, Oct. 6Pope Paul VI told his regular weekly general audience in St. Peter's Basilica today that it should not expect any changes in fundamental matters of faith to emerge from the deliberations of the current Synod of Bishops.

title: Club in Scarsdale Donates Its Tiger To New Texas Zoo
description: SCARSDALE, Oct. 6Tuffy, the 3yearold Siberian tiger who had spent the last year in a glass cage at the Spa Health Club here, departed this morning for the Gladys Porter Zoo in Brownsville, Texas.

title: Protest by Chaplains
description: ALBANY, Oct. 6 (AP)Protestant champlains at the state's correctional institutions objected today to the plan to set up of a separate facility for militant prisoners.

title: Reversal of Kenny Organization's Mayoral Strategy Beclouds the Race in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Oct. 6The tomb holding the body of Frank Hague, the political boss who once ruled Hudson County and Jersey City with an iron hand, is in Holy Name Cemetery on the city's West Side, far from City Hall and the political turmoil being generated by the mayoral election campaign that has just begun.

title: Tuesday Night Fights
description: London  Tom Bethea, 161 pounds, knocked out Mark Rowe, 159, Britain, 9 rounds, Chris Finnegan, 169, Britain, knocked out Roger Pouse, 174 Missoula, Mont., 4.

title: Grass Harp Opens Michigan Arts Center
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Oct. 6 The University of Michigan opened its $3.5million Power Center for the Performing Arts here last night with the premiere of a musical version of Truman Capote's The Grass Harp and the awarding of honorary degrees to six prominent figures in the arts.

title: School Board Backs Down And Accepts Busing Plan
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Oct. 6 (AP) Members of the Orange. County School Board, who vowed in August to face jail rather than allow busing, accepted today a school desegregation plan that calls for the busing of 900 students.

title: GERMAN DISCUSSIONS AT INTENSIVE PHASE
description: BERLIN, Oct. 6East and West Germany have reached an intensive phase in their negotiations on regulating civilian access to West Berlin, Egon Bahr, the West German State Secretary, said today on his return from a sevenhour session in East Berlin. But he added that there were still key points to be clarified.

title: 3 Slain After Robbing Bar
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 6 (UPI) Three gunmen who robbed Alex's Tavern on the North Side last night were killed in a shootout with policemen following a highspeed auto chase. Killed were Eric Bynum: his brother, Dennis, and James Lenon Jr.

title: Williams, Out as Coach, Assails Owner
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 6 (UPI) Jerry Williams, dismissed today as coach of the Philadelphia Eagles, charged that owner Leonard Tose was a man without courage and character who offered him a sizable sum of money to resign.

title: Grand Jury Recommends Removal of a Yonkers City Councilman
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 6A special Westchester County grand jury has recommended to Governor Rockefeller that Frank A. Adamo, a Yonkers City Councilman, be removed from office for displaying an unconscionable disregard of his obligations to the electorate and for conduct unbecoming a person in a position of public trust.

title: Books of The Times
description: ELEANORAND FRANKLIN. The Story of Their Relationship. Based on Eleanor Roosevelt's Private Papers. By Joseph P. Lash. Foreword by Arthur M. Schlesinger Jr. Introduction by Franklin D. Roosevelt Jr. 765 pages. Illustrated. Norton. $12.50 until Dec. 31; $15 thereafter.

title: SOVIET EASES CURB ON GEORGIAN JEWS
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 6  Jews in the Georgian Republic are reliably reported to have won concessions from Soviet authorities permitting an increase in emigration to Israel.

title: Remodeling Announced
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 6 (UPI) A $40million remodeling program to improve working conditions at 800 of the largest Postal Service offices was announced today by Postmaster General Winton M. Blount. The program will take two to three years and concentrate on improving lighting, heating, airconditioning, toilet and eating facilities.

title: Merrill Anderson Is Dead at 74; Bank Ad Expert Set Up Agency
description: Merrill Anderson, founder of the Merrill Anderson Company, an advertising agency specializing in banks, died yesterday at New York Hospital after a short illness. He was 74 years old and lived at 142 East 39th Street and in Sherman, Conn.

title: Arlington Restores Lassie
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 6 (UPI)Arlington Park announced today it would restore the $100,000 Arlington  Washington Lassie Stakes for 2yearold fillies to its schedule in 1972.

title: TV Review
description: As Washington's Public Broadcasting Service and New York's National Educational Television square off over the content of The Great American Dream Machine, public television's premiere week continues. And some of the results are quite impressive.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ALGIERS, Oct. 6 (AP)Premier Kosygin today accused the imperialists and their network of agents in Israel of setting Arab nations against each other by infecting them with hatred of Communism. He spoke at a banquet given by Algeria's President, Houari Boumediene.

title: Double Show Salutes Picasso at 90
description: Pablo Picasso  without doubt, the most famous artist who ever lived, and very likely the richestis about to celebrate his 90th birthday. (he was born on Oct. 25, 1881.) Naturally, a great many tributes are being organized throughout the world. New York weighed in this week with a large, double show billed as Homage to Picasso. It opened Tuesday evening at the Saidenberg and Marlborough galleries as a benefit for the American Cancer Society.

title: Mrs. Toni Strauss Wed to F. A. Shore
description: The marriage of Mrs. Toni Strauss to Freeman A. Shore, a partner of David J. Greene & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange, took place here last evening. Rabbi Jerome K. Davidson performed the private ceremony at the House of Living Judaism.

title: EGYPTIAN INSISTS SUEZ PACT INCLUDE A PULLOUT PLEDGE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 6Foreign Minister Mahmoud Riad of Egypt declared today that his Government would reject any interim agreement on reopening the Suez Canal that would lead to continued occupation of Egyptian territory by Israeli forces.

title: MONETARY INTENT OF U.S. EXPLAINED
description: PARIS, Oct. 6The chairman of the organization where much of the technical work is being done to try to resolve the monetary crisis, believes there is a tendency to exaggerate the effects of the adjustment sought by the United States on other countries' production, employment and foreign trade.

title: Emphasis Is on the Voice In Philadelphia's Concert
description: The emphasis was on the voice in Philharmonic Hall on Tuesday night. Eugene Ormandy brought the Philadelphia Orchestra there for the first of its New York concerts this season. He had two soloists and a choir, and the evening was one of absorbing music, well sung.

title: Scots Want Oil Royalties
description: EDINBURGH. Scotland, Oct. 6 (Reuters)Scottish Nationalists are planning to demand that all royalties from oil found under the sea off the Scottish coast be kept in Scotland.

title: Federal Regulation Urged For Offshore Oil Industry
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (AP)  The National Transportation Safety Board today recommended Federal safety regulation of the offshore oildrilling industry.

title: We Will All Become Prisoners
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif.On Aug. 21, six men died in an escape attempt at California's San Quentin Prison. The echo of gunfire had scarcely faded from the scene of the tragedy before the revolutionary propagandists were on the job, attempting to create new folk heroes.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: U. S. Media/International, the first of the independent media buying services, is folding. This was confirmed yesterday by Hope Martinez, its former president, who said she turned in her resignation Tuesday.

title: Governor Asks U.S. Study Of Attica Inmates' Charges
description: Governor Rockefeller has formally requested Attorney General John N. Mitchell to have the civil rights division of the Justice Department investigate charges by inmates of the Attica Correctional Facility that their rights have been violated.

title: U.S. Increases Pupil Lunch Aid But Tightens Rule on Eligibility
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 Yielding to Congressional pressure, the Department of Agriculture today liberalized Federal payments to states under the school lunch program.

title: Giant Stores Lines Up Loan
description: The Giant Stores Corporation said yesterday it had received an $8million longLerm loan commitment from the Prudential Insurance Company of America to he used for expansion and working capital.

title: Data on Tax Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6 (AP)The following tables, based on the tax bill passed by the House today, show estimated reduced taxes for the next three years against the present tax levels, and show how people at or near the poverty level of income would be exempted from income taxes. In the first table, figures for incomes of $5,000 and $/0,000 assume standard 10 per cent deduction and figures for incomes of $15,000 and $20,000 assume 18 per cent deduction.

title: Without a Sommelier, Rookie Gets Beer
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 6  If Bruce Kison had been as successful against the Giants today as he was in finding a bottle of champagne after his brilliant relief pitching, the Pirates wouldn't be the National League champions.

title: Pirates Capture Pennant
description: The Pirates beat the San Francisco Giants, 95, at Pittsburgh yesterday to win the National League playoff, 3 games to 1, and qualify for the World Series against Baltimore starting Saturday. (Details on Page 63.)

title: Narragansett Dark Again
description: PAWTUCKET, R. L., (AP)Narragansett Park canceled its racing program for the second night in a row today because the track was being picketed in a labor dispute.

title: LOEW'SFRANKLIN TIE IS EYED BY RESERVE
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York said yesterday that it was investigating the tie between the Loew's Corporation and the Franklin New York Corporation, parent company of the $3billion Franklin National Bank.

title: Rangers' Dupont, Stewart Sent to Providence Team
description: The Rangers assigned a rookie defenseman, Andre Dupont, and their seasoned right wing, Ron Stewart, on loan to the Providence Reds of the American Hockey League yesterday.

title: John Ford:Bogdanovich Measures Director's Achievement
description: In any reasonable list of the world's greatest filmmakers, John Ford will place in the top dozen. Among Americans, he belongs with Griffith and Hawks. Some attempt to measure Ford's achievement has now been made in "Directed by John Ford," a movie by Peter Bogdanovich, which played last night in the New York Film Festival at the Vivian Beaumont Theater.Bogdanovich has also done a very useful interview book on Ford  along with books on Fritz Lang and Allan Dwan: and many magazine articles; and a couple of feature films, including "The Last Picture Show," and several superb retrospective programs on American directors, which he began at such an early age that one assumes he transferred directly from kindergarten to the Museum of Modern Art. He is especially qualified to handle Ford on film, and in certain respects he has succeeded very well."Directed by John Ford" begins with a film quotation, one of the loveliest moments in "The Searchers" (1956), and then goes on to an initial segment of interviewswith James Stewart, John Wayne, Henry Fonda and a marvelously uncooperative John Ford himself.There are illustrative passages out of Ford movies from "Straight Shooting" (1917) to "The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance" (1962), along with a modest and genuinely intelligent narration read by Orson Welles. Through all this, the film is workmanlike, amusing, instructive and put together with the kind of tact and freedom that illustrates the value of having a real movie-maker make the movie.But then the film proceeds to tie Ford's work to the chronicle of this country, so much of which it does indeed record, and "Directed by John Ford" begins to take on a certain piety and to lose a bit of its purpose. I can understand the temptation to read Ford's history in terms of American history, but I think it is a temptation worth resisting. Ford's development cuts across American history at several angles and over several decades, and if he is often able to use that history as dramatic material, he is also often able not to.Its almost exclusive concern with one aspect of Ford's themes may be the reason that the film ignores some of Ford's most recent and most beautiful work, such as "Donovan's Reef" (1963) and "7 Women" (1966), and ignores the significant fact that with such films this major living American director has lately been pretty much relegated to neighborhood theater openings, to obscure double bills and to the kind of critical indifference that the intellectual media commonly reserve for our greatest movie artists at their greatest.It is a point worth considering, and I wish it had been considered somehow, just as I wish that less of Ford's epic sweep and more of his intimate grace had been included in the film clips. But I cannot quibble too much with any selection from this director.
