description: The National Basketball Association begins its second 25 years of operation Tuesday night with three new names  the Houston Rockets, the Golden State Warriors and Kareem Abdul Jabbar.

title: Hawks Beat Blues, 42
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 9 (UPI)Bobby Hull and Danny O'Shea scored two goals each tonight to give the Chicago Black Hawks a 42 victory over the St. Louis Blues.

title: The Pews of Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Pews of Philadelphia, one of the nation's richest and most publicityshy families, with a fortune of nearly $1billion, are in a state of transition.

title: Mary Catherine Collins Is Bride Of John Emanuel in St. Patrick's
description: Miss Mary Catherine Collins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William T. Collins 2d of New Rochelle, N. Y., was married hare yesterday to John Edward Emanuel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Victor J. Emanuel of Rye, N. Y.

title: Yale Professorship Filled
description: Alvin B. Kernan has been appointed the Karl Young Professor of English at Yale University, a new professorship named in memory of a Yale teacher. Professor Kernan is an authority on the English drama of the 16th and 17th centuries. He is also director of the division of the humanities in Yale's Faculty of Arts and Science.

title: Donald W. Kaitz Will Mary Miss Ellen Schwartzstein
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Oct. 9Mr. and Mrs. Fred Schwartzstein have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ellen M. Schwartzstein, to Donald W. Kaitz, son of Commissioner Joseph Kaitz, the New York State member of the Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor, and Mrs. Kaitz of Cedarhurst, L. I. A January wedding is planned.

title: Manhattan Harriers Win
description: Tony Colon, a 19yearold freshman, set a meet record yesterday and helped Manhattan College sweep Iona, 1550, in crosscountry. It was the Jaspers' 18th straight dual meet victory over a threeyear period and their second consecutive shutout.

title: Arpino's Confetti, Danced by Joffrey, Warmly Received
description: Gerald Arpino's Confetti, which is a straightforward, frisky and unpretentious little romp, tossed audiences into unexplained convulsions of laughter during the company's London season. It is a plotless work for three couples, who happily bound around to Rossini's overture to Semiramide. Friday evening the City Center Joffrey Ballet offered the work for the first time during the current season to a warmly appreciative audience.

title: Suffolk
description: Frank Urso scored two touchdowns yesterday, running his season's total to eight in three games, as Brentwood defeated North Babylon, 386. The triumph was the third straight for the Indians and ran their twoseason streak to 11.

title: U.S. Urged To Assess L.I. Needs In Power
description: UPTON,L.I., The New  England River Basins Commission, already embarking On a comprehensive, threeyear study of the Long Island Sound region, has proposed a new twoyear examination of the future energy needs of The area and the methods of meet ing them.

title: Reader's Report
description: Remember Pearl Harbor? No? Well this novel by James Bassett (Capt. USN, Ret.) can fill you in on the Pacific calm that preceded it and the holocaust that followed. The author, now associate editor of The Los Angeles Times and an alumnus of Admiral Halsey's staff, recalls a day when America was not yet a bully but a severely outclassed military power. Most of the action takes place aboard the Henry P. Davidson, one of those obsolescent, fourstacked destroyers that Roosevelt lendleased to Britain. The ship's infirmities are complemented by the flaws in her skipper.

title: PENN STATE ROUTS ARMY
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Oct. 9Penn State gradually wore down an obstinate Army defense, then cracked it with four quick touchdowns in the third period to roll up a 420 victory today.

title: A.D.A. SEEKS CURB ON FAVORITE SONS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9A campaign to eliminate the use of favorite son candidates in the 1972 Democratic Presidential primaries was started today by the convention task force of Americans for Democratic Action.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Peddie Edges Mercersberg
description: HIGHTSTOWN, N. J., Oct. 9 A pass from Pete McWilliams to Rex Kapro for a 2point conversion today enabled Peddie to beat Mercersberg, 1412. The conversion followed Kapro's 5yard touchdown run. It was the second victory in three games for Peddle and the first loss in three games for Mercersburg.

title: In Brooklyn Night Court, Put Him In! Rings Out
description: Put him in! The suspect, having been arraigned, is taken from the old Brooklyn courtroom to a detention cell. Then two minutes later, after some mumbled jargon, shuffling of papers and feet, another case is disposed of and the bridgemanthe clerk in charge of proceedingscalls out again:

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Ballots and Dollars
description: The campaign finance reforms approved by the Senate in August were so reasonable and so acceptable to both parties that the measure was passed by a vote of 88 to 2. In a couple of weeks of bickering, the House has managed to reduce the whole great effort to a parliamentary snarl in which bipartisanship has vanished and two committees, after battling for jurisdiction, have produced opposing bills.

title: Tel Aviv U. Group Elects
description: The election of Victor M. Carter, a Los Angeles philanthropist and businessman, as president of the American Friends of the Tel Aviv University in Israel was announced last night. The group, with headquarters in this city, supports the Tel Aviv institution, which has a student body of 14,000, including more than 1,200 Americans.

title: NIXON PREPARES CONTROLS ORDER ON SECOND PHASE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 President Nixon worked at his Camp David retreat today drafting the Executive order implementing the second phase of his economic program. But the vital cooperation of organized labor with the postfreeze program of controls remained very much in doubt.

title: Indians Launch Rocket
description: MADRAS, India, Oct. 9 (Reuters)India successfully launched a shortrange rocket today for the first time from its new launching facility at Sriharikota Island, about 30 miles north of this city in southern India. Officials said the launching of the Indianmade Rohini rocket  was designed mainly to test the launching complex at Sriharikota, from where an Indian satellite is expected to he put into orbit in the next three or four years.

title: Nixon Orders That More Latins Be Hired for HighLevel Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 President Nixon has issued a new order to aides and Cabinet members to step up recruitment of LatinAmericans for highlevel jobs after his first order, issued in 1969, produced insignificant results.

title: Tittle Rates Post's Wichard Top Quarter back
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I.Gary Wichard of C. W. Post College will never make an allAmerica Team, but according to Y. A. Tittle he is the finest quarterback in the nation.

title: Corona Release Barred
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., Oct. 9 (UPI)A Sutter County judge has rejected moves to release Juan Corona on bail and change the location of his trial on charges of murdering 25 itinerant farm workers. Mr. Corona has been imprisoned since May 26; when he was arrested after the first nine bodies were uncovered in orchard graves along the banks of the Feather River north of Yuba City.

title: Flatlands Industrial Park Gets Ninth Large Concern
description: Forward Industries, Inc., which manufactures vinyl gift items, has agreed to move into Flatlands Industrial Park in Brooklyn under the city's industrial  development program, it was announced yesterday.

title: BenGurion No Less Controversial at 85
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 9The old man with the wispy white hair seemed unshaken by it all, by the friends who praised him or the enemies who stuck by their old criticisms of him.

title: Airlines Drop TwoDrink Limit On All U.S. Domestic Flights
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9The twodrink limit on domestic airline flights has been abandoned.

title: The jazz Doctors' Prescribe Music As Best Therapy
description: Almost every Monday evening at 9:30, Dr. James Goldrich, a short, balding, 41yearold obstetrician, leaves his office in Rego Park cartying his little black bag.

title: Study Due Of Catholic Schools in Brooklyn
description: A special 28member commission began an urgent investigation of the Brooklyn diocese's Roman Catholic high schools last week to assess the institutions financial plight and explore new and better methods of paying for them.

title: F.B.I. Is Said to Have Cut Direct Liaison With C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9The Federal Bureau of Investigation broke off direct liaison with the Central Intelligence Agency a year and a half ago because the C.I.A. would not tell J. Edgar Hoover who had leaked information from his organization, according to authoritative sources.

title: Economy
description: The President put a set of rubber teeth into the jawbone and now the question is whether his Phase Two program to save the dollar will have any bite at all.

title: Telephone Co, to Give Scores During Series
description: New York's baseball fans may get the latest World Series scores by dialing 6371212, the telephone company's time bureau.

title: Glassboro St. Tops Adelphi
description: GLASSBORO, N. J., Oct. 9 (AP)Two firsthalf touchdown passes from Bill Hyatt to Bert Cornish carried Glassboro State to a 2112 victory over Adelphi today.

title: HE GOT PITCHES UP, UP AND AWAY
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 9Dock Ellis, a bottle of beer in his left hand and a towel draped around his otherwise bare shoulders, sat on a table in front of a tiny television monitor in the Pittsburgh clubhouse.

title: Williston Edges Hotchkiss
description: EASTHAMPTON, Mass., Oct. 9Williston defeated Hotchkiss in a wild game, 2927, today. Gil Timm, the Williston quarterback, completed 11 passes for 250 yards and three touchdowns and ran for another.

title: Grain Workers Return
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 9 (UPI)Members of Grain Workers Local 418 returned to their jobs today in delayed compliance with a fourdayold Federal court writ that ordered them to end their strike immediately.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Student Is Fianc Of Victoria Rogers
description: RYE, N. Y., Oct. 9Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Van Dusen Rogers have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Victoria Rogers, to Earl Edward McEvoy. Mr. McEvoy, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Earl Edward McEvoy of Pasadena, Calif., is the ward and nephew of Mr. and Mrs. Ward Rafferty of Rye.

title: Art
description: IT has taken the Asia Society five years to get the loans for Ancient Indonesian Art, an exhibition that opened Thursday, from their home museums in Djakarta, Djokjakarta, and Solo to its quarters at 112 East 64th Street, where you may see them until Nov. 28. At an early stage of confused negotiations (confused being a redundant adjective in context) the Djakarta press broke the story that a band of Americans had appeared in town bearing a list of the finest works of art owned by the government of Indonesia, with God knows what skullduggery in mind.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: NORTH STARS WIN FROM WINGS, 4 TO 2
description: DETROIT, Oct. 9 (UPI)The Detroit Red Wings, starting the season without Gordie Howe for the first time in 25 years dropped a 42 verdict tonight to the Minnesota North Stars in the National Hockey League.

title: J. PAUL WALKER
description: LINDEN, N. J., Oct. 9  J. Paul Walker of 229 Palisade Road, a retired science teacher and director of visual education in the Linden schools, died yesterday in Rahway Memorial Hospital. His age was 68.

title: Jets Favored by 7 Points Over Patriots at Foxboro Today
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Oct. 9With two young quarterbacks, Al Woodall and Jim Plunkett, enduring different growing pains, the New York Jets will oppose the New England Patriots here tomorrow. The Jets are a 7point betting favorite in the game that will be seen on Channel 2 in the New York area at 1 P.M.

title: Preps
description: WILLIAMSTON, Mass., Oct. 9Scott Gillogly, the quarterback, paced Andover to its second straight victory over a college freshman team as Andover downed the Williams freshmen, 2812. Gillogly ran for two touchdowns and his passes set up another score.

title: IOWA LOSES, 28 TO 3, TO NORTHWESTERN
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa, Oct. 9 (UPI)Quarterback Maurie Diagneau ran for one touchdown and passed for another today as Northwestern trimmed Iowa, 28.3.

title: Miss Wilhelmina M. Martin, Debutante of 1964, Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Murray W. Martin of New York and Meridian, Miss., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Wilhelmina Murray Martin, to Bruce Webb Eaken Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Eaken of Pepper Pike, Ohio.

title: WASH. STATE BOWS TO U.C.L.A. BY 3421
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Oct. 9 (UPI)The University of California, Los Angeles capitalized on four of eight Washington State turnovers to win, 3421, today, ending the worst Bruin losing streak since 1943 at four games.

title: Hill Circus Triumphs In Ascot Filly Stakes
description: ASCOT, England, Oct. 9 (Reuters)Hill Circus, owned by an American, George A. Pope Jr., scored her third victory in a fortnight today in the Princess Royal Stakes for threeyearold fillies.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: PRESIDENT NIXON said in Phase Two of his economic package the Government would carefully supervise pay, prices and rents, but would not directly restrain profits. He named Arthur M. Burns, head of the Federal Reserve, a committee to seek ways to stabilize interest and dividends.

title: Harvard Tops Columbia, 2119;
description: CAMBRIDGE, Oct. 9Harvard stopped a late Columbia bid in the fourth quarter today and won its opening Ivy League test, 2119.

title: The World
description: TOKYOOne day not long ago, an American who had been in Japan before got a laugh from a Japanese customs inspector when he returned to this country. As the visitor piled his luggage onto the inspection rack, he was asked: Have you anything to declare? Anticipating the litany of questions all incoming foreigners are asked, the American replied: No, and I don't have any guns, swords, knives, watches, gold jewelry, drugs, or alcohol. The customs officer chuckled, Ah, you know Japan very well, and waved the visitor on through without opening the bags.

title: Turmoil Indicated in Palestinian Guerrilla Movement
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 9 There have been Increasing indications in the last few days of turmoil in the ranks of the Palestinian guerrilla movement.

title: RED DEFECTOR SAYS U.N. AIDE WAS A SPY
description: Petr S. Deryabin, a former Soviet secret police officer who defected to the West in 1954, charged yesterday that a Soviet member of the United Nations staff served with him as an espionage agent in Moscow in the nineteenfifties.

title: NEPENTHE VICTOR IN OVERNIGHT SAIL
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Oct. 9 T. Vincent Learson's 50foot sloop, Nepenthe, out of American Yacht Club, Rye, N.Y., captured the Windward Cup today in the Indian Harbor Yacht Club's 16th annual Stratford Shoal overnight race which closed the distanceracing season on Long Island Sound.

title: Television
description: IN what may be the ultimate in masturbatory experiences this season, the critics who write about television have been appearing on television to discuss television with television interviewers. A new trend? The possibilities are stupefying.

title: A Greater Share of Military's Cargo Sought by Financially Ailing Airlines
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9The financially troubled airlines are seeking a larger slice of the United States military's international air cargo.

title: Ohio State Halts Illinois, 2410, For 2d Victory in Row in Big Ten
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Oct. 9 (UPI)Randy Keith scored two quick touchdowns in the first period and Ohio State added 10 points in the second half to record a 2410 victory over Illinois today.

title: ABRAHAM CHAICE
description: NEWARK, Oct. 9  Abraham Chaice, a New York lawyer for more than 50 years, died at his home here, yesterday. His age was 83.

title: W. VIRGINIA WINS IN 4TH QUARTER
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Oct. 9 (UPI)Bernie Galiffa came off the bench today to quarterback West Virginia to a 21point fourth quarter and a 2823 victory over William and Mary.

title: Medicine
description: During the last 10 years, many an East Coast couple plagued by sexual problems such as impotence or frigidity has journeyed to St. Louis for two weeks of therapy with Dr. William H. Masters and Mrs. Virginia E. Johnson, coauthors of Human Sexual Response and Human Sexual Inadequacy.

title: For Young Readers
description: William Mayne's prose style has a club foot. For the first few pages of this novel, the phraseology seems awkward, illassorted and confusing: Donald resisted slightly, and Nessing let him walk straight ahead, and Donald let him lead now. And then very subtly Mayne's unique rhythms begin to assert themselves. The reader finds he has fallen into step with them and is no longer parsing sentences to get at their meaning. The gracelessness has become a kind of power instead, a power well suited to such a strange tale as this.

title: Westchester
description: Sleepy Hollow and White Plains each won their third football games of the season yesterday, but Eastchester and Rye, both with two victories, battled to a 1414 tie.

title: The World
description: In the next twelvemonth of twilight war in Indochina, the United States will have to make hard decisions about some of the; engines of destruction being plapeti, in the hands of South Vietnatn's military regime. Each new troop withdrawal will be announced with the usual fanfare, but nothing is likely to be said about the madeinAmerica equipment that deals out horror to the people and the land.

title: John Keats, Franz Schubert, Goya and Goethe had it
description: When a man is confronted by something he abhors, fears, and doesn't understand, he may do one of four things: push it under the rug (or his head in the sand); call it punishment for mortal sin; blame it on others; or, far more rarely, try to find out what it is and why.

title: SUPPORT OF G.O.P. FOUND DECLINING
description: Republican party allegiance among people of voting age is at its lowest level since 1964, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: Shape and 8 ExGovernors Call for End of Executions
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 (AP)The Supreme Court has been urged by Gov. Milton J. Shapp of Pennsylvania and eight former Governors to abolish the death penalty on the ground that it does not deter murder.

title: Colorado Triumphs, 2414
description: AMES, Iowa, Oct. 9 (UPI)Seventhranked Colorado broke loose with a field goal and a touchdown in a twominute span of the fourth quarter today to pull away for a 2414 triumph over its Big Eight rival, Iowa State.

title: NAVY'S HARRIERS TAKE MEET HERE
description: Navy's crosscountry team, led by its twin brothers, Jim and Jeff Kramer, who tied for first place, overpowered New York University and St. John's yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: An Enquiry Into the Present State
description: I STARTED getting the old Princeton football spirit while we were still on the New Jersey Turnpike. Maybe it was driving past those dreary oil refineries or whatever they are near Secaucus that made me want to think about something else. But it was there all right. With a picnic hamper and bottle of wine in the back of the station wagon there is an air of anticipation about going to an oldfashioned college football game that hangs on even when you've been married to your date for 11 years. As a veteran of these events I have found that one of the best parts of going to a local college game  there are more than a dozen colleges playing something clearly recognizable as football within an hour and a half's drive of New York City  is that you don't have to be an old grad to enjoy one. I have never spent a minute inside a Princeton classroom, nor many more in my own college for that matter, yet I feel I have been to more games and logged more twostep time at Nassau parties than F. Scott Fitzgerald. In fact, there are definite benefits in not being a graduate. You have all the enjoyment of a pleasant fall afternoon in the outdoors watching that old school try without getting those letters from the alumni office trying to knock you over for a donation for the new gymnasium.

title: Missed Block Costs Bronco His Job
description: About Pro Football

title: Podgorny Back in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 9 (UPI)President Podgorny returned today from his visit to Hanoi, during which he pledged continuing Soviet support for North Vietnam. He visited India and Burma en route to Hanoi.

title: Garden and Home
description: EVERY conscientious automobile owner knows that there are certain things he should do at this time of year to get his car ready for the coming winter months  but the homeowner sometimes forgets that there are also a number of important steps that should be taken to get his house ready at the same time. A few weekends spent in inspecting critical areas and making needed repairs now can go a long way toward making the house more comfortable during the cold weather that lies ahead, and toward lowering future operating and maintenance costs.

title: WAGNER OUTSCORES MORAVIAN, 20 TO 14
description: The Wagner College Sea Hawks downed Moravian College, 2014, yesterday before a Parents' Day crowd of 4,700 at Wagner's Fisher Field on Staten Island.

title: Friar Who Gave Life at Auschwitz to Be Beatified
description: WARSAW, Oct. 9Officials at Auschwitz dedicated a modest plaque this week to the Rev. Maximilian Kolbe, one of the four million wartime victims of the former Nazi concentration camp in southern Poland.

title: Nassau South
description: It was Mother's Day for the moms of Oceanside High football players yesterday, but visiting Berner did not Join in the tribute. Berner battered Oceanside, 347, to raise its South Shore Division I wonlost record to 30.

title: A.B.C. ISN'T SIMPLE AS A.B.C. IN KOREA
description: YOJU, South Korea, Oct. 9South Korea celebrated the 525th birthday of the national alphabet as an official holiday today while continuing to argue over how to use it.

title: ExMinister Pursues Criticism of Sato
description: UTSUNOMIYA, Japan, Oct. 4 Former Foreign Minister Takeo Miki came to this city about 60 miles north of Tokyo today to tell 700 provincial party workers why JapaneseAmerican relations have deteriorated. He got only polite and perfunctory applause.

title: Fern R. Katz Is Betrothed to Teacher
description: ROSLYN HEIGHTS, L. I., Oct. 9  Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Herman Katz of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Fern Rhona Katz, to Harvey Allen Medwin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Medwin of Lynbrook. Miss Katz was graduated this year from the University of Miami. Her fianc, an alumnus of the University of Kansas, teaches at the Nassau Center for Emotionally Disturbed Mildren in Woodbury.

title: L.I. Officials Provide Advice to Consumers
description: MINEOLA, L I.  Long Island's consumer affairs agencies are experiencing a stepup in activities as more and more Nassau and Suffolk County residents are finding powerful allies just a phone call away.

title: Purdue Beats Minnesota
description: LAFAYETTE Ind., Oct. 9 (UPI)  Gary Danielson threw two long touchdown passes and scored a third himself today to pace Purdue to a 2713 Big Ten triumph over Minnesota.

title: U.S. Demands Pfizer Clean WasteNot Dump It at Sea
description: Federal pollution control officials, admittedly with little legal force to back them up, are trying to stop a major chemical company, from avoiding the cleanup of its industrial waste by merely dumping it at sea.

title: Barbara Hedges Wed
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., Oct. 9Miss Barbara Ann Hedges, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. H. Charles Hedges, was married here this afternoon to James Scott Jarvis, son of Mr. and Mrs. James E. Jarvis. The Rev. William S. Spilman performed the ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church. The bride studied fashion merchandising at Syracuse University. Her father is with the Grumman Aerospace Corporation as project vehicle production engineer on the Lunar Module. Mr. Jarvis was graduated this year from Allegheny College, His father is in advertising with The Daily News in New York.

title: Three to Be Honored By Harness Drivers
description: The National Association of Harness Drivers has announced that Frank Ervin, Harry Pownall and Wayne (Curly) Smart will receive 1971 Golden Award trophies at its third annual ball in the Plaza Hotel on Sunday.

title: Miss Rosemary Ridder Plans Marriage to John Bohannon 3d
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., Oct. 9Mr. and Mrs. Victor L. Ridder have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Rosemary Ridder, to John Neil Bohannon 3d. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Bohannon Jr. of West Hartford, Conn. A wedding is planned for next July.

title: Manhattan Bows to Marist For 2d Club Football Loss
description: The Manhattan College football club suffered its second defeat yesterday, losing, 238, to the Vikings of Marist College.

title: TWIN TIME WINS MILE AT LAUREL
description: LAUREL, Md., Oct. 9Twin Time, a 3yearold from Gene Mori's East Acres, recorded his second stakes victory within eight days today when he held off lightly regarded Lizard Point in the stretch and won the $22,325 Walter Haight Handicap at Laurel Race Course.

title: Preps
description: HICKSVILLE, L. T., Oct. 9Kevin Plunkett led Fordham Prep to its third straight victory, 288, over Long Island Lutheran today in a Metropolitan High School League game.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 10There had been scattered reports, largely ignored or disbelieved, of sudden displacements for several months before the thing became a national embarrassment. A welder in Cos Cob, Conn., told the press that while watching a football game on his set one July afternoon he saw a hockey player suddenly skate onto the gridiron, intercept a pass and slam the ball into the net for a touchdown.

title: Photography
description: THE Photo Media exhibit at the Museum of Contemporary Crafts, 29 West 53d Street, indicates that although the lid has been off the Pandora's box of mixed media photographic work for several years now, the morals of the medium (and those of its more insistently virginal practitioners) have not yet been seriously impaired. It also suggests, by its very presence as well as its format, that the need for periodic eyepopping photographic expositions is not felt exclusively by the hobbyist faction of the medium's audience.

title: TOLEDO WINS, 247, LIFTS STREAK TO 28
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ohio, Oct 9 (AP)Toledo capitalized on Bowling Green mistakes as the Rockets extended their winning streak to 28 gameslongest in the nationwith a 247 MidAmerican Conference victory today.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Tax packages, some embodying proposed reforms and most calling for either increases in existing rates or new taxes, are still pending in several state legislatures. Some are tied up in political divisions between the two branches of the legislature. Others are bogged down in splits between legislative leaders and governors.

title: Northport School Damaged by Fire in Fight to Get Insurance
description: NORTHPORT, L.I.  More than seven months after a fire damaged a wing of the Ocean Avenue Elementary School, the uncertainty remains over whether the structure was covered by insurance.

title: Miss Schmidt Plans Nuptials
description: Miss Agatha Grace Schmidt's engagement to John Thomas Dowd has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Godfrey P. Schmidt of New York. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Archie J. Dowd of Livingston, N. J.

title: Planning Board Is Vexed by Poor Transit
description: For the last several months; Community Planning Board 11 in Brooklyn has been grappling with a series of problems related to public transportation and recreation, and board members arc becoming increasingly concerned that there might not be viable solutions to them.

title: Miss Martha A. Huff Is Affanced
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y Oct. 9Mr. and Mrs. James B. Huff have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Martha Aisle Huff, to John Thornton Farris Jr., son of Mrs. Farris of Larchmont and Fort Lauderdale, Fla., and the late Mr. Farris. The wedding is planned for Nov. 6.

title: Royals Top Cavaliers
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 9 (AP)Last minute baskets by Norm Van Lier and Torn Van Arsdale gave the Cincinnatti Royals a 107104 victory today over the Cleveland Cavaliers in a preseason National Basketball Association game.

title: Foreign Notes
description: Spy Mania

title: HOLY CROSS TOPS COLGATE BY 2814
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Oct. 9 (UPI)  Mickey Connolly, a sophomore quarterback, threw three touchdown passes today and confused the defense with his razzledazzle style to spearhead Holy Cross to a 2814 upset over Colgate.

title: PassaicHudson
description: Ever since 1948, Kearny has been trying to beat Montclair without success.

title: BLAST IN BAR KILLS WOMAN IN BELFAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 9 (Reuters)A bomb demolished a bar in the Roman Catholic Lower Falls Road area tonight, killing and injuring 11 persons.

title: VILLANOVA BOWS TO BOSTON COLLEGE
description: NEWTON, Mass., Oct. 9 (AP) Tom Bougus ran for 215 yards and one touchdown today as Boston's College's unheralded defense subdued VIIIanova, 237, for the Eagles' fourth straight victory.

title: Individual and Team Projects To Continue Under Ford Grants
description: The dramatic increase in the Ford Foundations' support for minority opportunities in higher education will have a varying effect on colleges and universities outside the program and on the thousands of individual scholars, technical advisers and research teams that seek aid for higher education from the world's wealthiest foundation.

title: Notre Dame Downs Miami, 170; Defense, Led by Patulski, Stars
description: MIAMI, Oct. 9 (AP)Notre Dame's defensive unit manhandled Miami's offense tonight as the undefeated Irish blanked the Hurricanes, 170, before 64,357 in the Orange Bowl.

title: SHOW TITLE WON BY TWELFTH NIGHT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 9Adele B. Nichols' Twelfth Night won the regular working hunter championship at the Philadelphia horse show today and his victory did not cause a raised eyebrow among his rivals in the Spectrum.

title: Connecticut Registration Of 1821's Only 28,029
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 9Less than 20 per cent of the estimated total of 153,000 people in Connecticut between 18 and 21 years old have registered to vote, it was announced today.

title: Postmasters Group Elects
description: PORTLAND. Ore., Oct. 9 (AP)Eugene B. Dalton of Baldwin, Ga., was elected president of the national league of Postmasters at its 68th annual convention Thursday.

title: Bridge
description: A CHANGE in angle can make A great difference at the bridge table. The possibilities of a suit combination undergo a significant metamorphosis after a 90degree turn, giving the suit to the defenders. Consider this familiar situation:

title: New York
description: Did Sherlock Holmes have a college degree? Did Javert? Where did Maigret and Poiret matriculate?

title: More Than Chrome at Stake
description: Only President Nixon can now pull Congress back from an action that would damage the United Nations, tarnish the credibility of United States policy in Africa, jeopardize delicate negotiations between. Britain and Rhodesia, and offend liberal opinion everywhere.

title: Alan Alda Joins Box Step
description: Alan Alda has been signed to star in The Box Stop, a new comedy by Murray Schisgal, opening on Broadway Feb. 17. Martin Fried will direct. Richard Seader and Allan Jack Lewis are producers of the comedy, described as a satiric portrait of the modern urban man trying to get somewhere.

title: Johnson Still a Man of Contrasts
description: JOHNSON CITY, Tex.The morning light is peeping over the oak and juniper hills across the Pedernales River when the motor of the big, open Lincoln convertible comes alive. The headlights switch on and the car moves away from the big white ranchhouse, down a gravel drive into a pasture road. A ponderous dewlapped bull turns to look and to be looked over in turn by the driver.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: ALCOHOL FIGHTER HONORED IN MAINE
description: PORTLAND, Me., Oct. 9Alfred Davey looked over at the portrait of Gen. Neal Dow and said, I know about liquor. I've seen liquor at its worst. My life was spent in trying to reclaim the wrecks of alcohol.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONThe difficulty of trying to negotiate peace in the Middle East was never more apparent than last week.

title: AMHERST WINS, 3921; 3 SCORES FOR BLOOD
description: AMHURST, Mass., Oct. 9 In an interceptionriddled football game, Amhurst defeated Bowdoin College, 3921 today at Pratt Field.

title: Nuclear Sub Christened
description: GROTON, Conn., Oct. 9 (AP) The nuclear submarine Batfish was christened at the Electric Boat shipyard here today.

title: Preps
description: CHESHIRE, Conn. Oct. 9Ed Kuchar put on an offensive show to lead Choate to a 390 rout of Cheshire today. Kuchar had four touchdowns, kicked 3 extra points and totaled 203yards rushing.

title: Article 16  No Title
description: MILTON, Mass., Oct. 9Milton won its second straight game today when it defeated St. Paul, 2812.

title: Pace Opens Fund Drive; Seeks University Status
description: Pace College in lower Manhattan, founded 65 years ago by two brothers from Ohio, has recently opened a $53million fundraising campaign that is intended to enable it to develop Into a university.

title: Sandy Reject Triumphs
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Oct. 91 (AP)Sandy Reject got out in front early and led all the way today in winning the $2,1001 feature at Finger Lakes. It was the fourth victory in five starts for the 3yearold colt.

title: MICHIGAN DOWNS MICH. STATE, 2413
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Oct. 9 (AP)Secondranked Michigan took advantage of two firedup Michigan State team and scored a pair of late touchdowns to down the Spartans, 2413, today.

title: Ronald Ulrich Weds Miss Christie Pilcher
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Oct. 9Miss Christie Cutting Pilcher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Barron Pilcher, and Ronald John Ulrich, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Ulrich of Binghamton, N. Y., were married this afternoon in St. Mark's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Grant E. Morrill.

title: The Missing Majority
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9In a period of political upheaval such as this country Is now experiencing, both parties strive to put together a new majority coalition. This effort shapes the choice of candidates, programs and campaign strategies.

title: AIR FORCE VICTOR AS HAYNIE EXCELS
description: AIR FORCE ACADEMY, Colo., Oct. 9 (AP)  Rick Haynie, Air Force's sophomore quarterback, directed a versatile attack and the Falcon defense stymied Southern Methodist repeatedly today for a 30.0 victory before 45,000 fans at Falcon Stadium.

title: Cornell Turns Back Princeton
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Oct. 9Cornell, utilizing the slashing running of Ed Marinaro and alert defensive play by its entire unit, scored a decisive 198 victory over Princeton today on the PolyTurf of Schoellkopf Field before 22,500 fans.

title: Hidden Valley of The Smokies
description: Each autumn weekend U.S. 441, which runs through the Great Smoky Mountains from Cherokee in North Carolina to Gatlinburg in Tennessee, is jammed with the cars and campers of tourists who have come to see the annual color showthe extraordinary display of foliage that erupts each autumn in the mountain forests. If, this fall, they bring along Ross Hutchins's Hidden Valley of the Smokies as a guide, their pleasure in this natural spectacular will be all the greater.

title: 1,500 Negroes Gain Scholarship Finals
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Oct. 9Edward C. Smith, president of the National Merit Scholarship Corporation, has announced that 1,500 black students have qualified as semifinalists in the eighth annual National Achievement Scholarship Program for outstanding Negro Students.

title: GREEKS PROTEST A SCHOOL CLOSING
description: ATHENS, Oct. 9.The Greek Government has made strong protests to Turkey in the closing of the Orthodox Theological School on Heybeli, an island near Istanbul, where hundreds of Orthodox churchmen have been trained in the last 127 years.

title: Mary Elizabeth Dougherty Wed To Edmond Raker at Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 9 Miss Mary Elizabeth Dougherty and Edmond J. Raker were married here this afternoon in Memorial Church in the Harvard Yard. The Rev. Clinton R. Jones, canon of Christ Church Cathedral (Episcopal) in Hartford, performed the ceremony.

title: STANFORD DOWNS WASHINGTON, 176
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 9 (AP) Stanford rode a series of Washington mistakes to a 176 PacificEight Conference victory over the previously unbeaten Huskies today.

title: Preps
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 9Hopkins Grammar scored all its points in the second period and defeated Canterbury, 248, today. Dave Sears, the Hopkins quarterback, threw for one touchdown, three 2point conversions, and totaled 217 yards rushing and passing.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Something was wrong with the way Lowell Lake was sitting
description: I hate it when you sit in a chair like that, Lowell Lake's wife said to him shortly after they were married.

title: Penn's Early Goals Beat Dartmouth in Soccer, 31
description: HANOVER, N.H., Oct. 9Pennsylvania scored two goals in the first half today and defeated Dartmouth, 31, in Ivy League soccer.

title: Marcia Snell Plans Bridal
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Oct. 9Miss Marcia Ruth Snell, candidate for a master's degree in social work at the University of North Carolina, and Dr. Robert Howard Pantell, a senior resident in pediatrics at the University of North Carolina Memorial Hospital, plan to be married here on Oct. 30.

title: 20 Persons Are Honored By the Carnegie Hero Fund
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 9 (UPI}The Carnegie Hero Fund Commission has honored 20 persons in 11 states and one Canadian province for acts of heroism. Two silver medals, 18 bronze medals and $11,500 in cash went to the winners.

title: Article 15  No Title
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., Oct. 9 Steve Arnold's 25yard field goal in the fourth period today rallied Woodberry Forest to a 97 verdict over The Hill.

title: HARLAN B. MILLER, INSURANCE AIDE
description: SOUTH NORWALK, Conn., Oct. 9Dr. Harlan B. Miller, educational director of the Institute of Life Insurance and a former member of the faculty of the University of Denver, died today at Stamford Hospital. Death was ascribed to heart failure. He was 54 years old and lived at 19 Pheasant Lane.

title: Books:
description: Centuries ago man had to be a predatory hunter to survive and since hunting alone had dangerous drawbacks, early man grouped himself with others in tribes.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThe present crisis of the dollar has a symbolic significance transcending its purely financial aspects, for the dollar has come to be accepted as the quintessential token of United States power.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Stamps
description: PABLO PICASSO in 1938 painted a pastel portrait of his daughter Maia, then about six years old. The portrait will he used as the design for three United Nations stamps due Nov. 19 to commemorate the U. N. International School here.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Jeans and knitted shirts are the standard garb for little boys, but they do get dressed up on occasion. When they need tailored clothes, such as suits and separates, Imp Originals, Inc. is one of a few garment companies that fill the demand for quality merchandise.

title: Ellen J. Philips Planning Bridal In Ohio Dec. 29
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Oct. 9Miss Ellen Jane Philips, course assistant at the Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration, and Stephen Allen Schwarzman, candidate there for a master's degree, plan to be married here Dec. 29.

title: ORT, Begun In Brooklyn, To Mark 45 Years in U.S.
description: It was on Columbus Day, 1926, and the five women who gathered in a private home in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn had no idea that they were the pioneers of a movement that by today would lay claim to the energies of 100,000 American Jewish women.

title: RANGERS TIE, 44, IN SEASON OPENER
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 9The Rangers, who had lost their opening National Hockey League game the last three years, broke that tradition tonight and were grateful to gain a 44 tie with the Montreal Canadiens at the Forum after losing an early 31 lead.

title: Reader's Report
description: Mr. Nash's second novel (his first was Poor Teddy Black) is a slight but artfully composed fugue on the theme of ingratitude. Julius Ellman is a retired postman, a widower, an Automat habitu and a hoarder of dashed hopes. His biggest sense of loss is for the teaching career he missed out on. To this end, be has spent his spare time in selfimprovement, via such literature as The Ten Keys to Magic Memory and Ten Ways to Analyze Your Mind.

title: Marxist Chile After One Year
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  A ranking economic official in President Salvador Allende Gossens's Government recently took part in a seminar for lawyers discussing the technical ways and means of expropriation in Chile.

title: Luxurious Caribbean Yacht Club Will Fly 2 Flags
description: One of the Caribbean's most luxurious and unusual yacht clubs will open next Friday when Oyster Pond Yacht Club of St. Maarten is formally dedicated. Situated in the Netherlands Antilles, the resort island is one of the few establishments to claim dual nationality, Dutch and French.

title: Soviet Debates University Tests Found to Bar Top Scholars
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 9The intensely competitive university entrance examinations in the Soviet Union, long the subject of parental complaint and teenage frustration, came under fire this week from a Soviet, educator who proposed doing away with them entirely.

title: So Now I'm Back, and Black . . . . . . And Available
description: I WONDER what happened to . . .? Usually an unenlightened question. Some retire. Some grow weary of the constant battle and switch to related fieldsor, unrelated fields. But expand the question: I wonder what happened to that Black Actor . . .? Change the word Black to suit your upbringing, you know: Negro, Colored, Nigra, Nigger, etc., et al, and then you, by definition, impart a totally different solution.

title: OTTO SCHNIEBS, 78, A SKI INSTRUCTOR
description: SARANAC LAKE, N. Y., Oct. 9 (AP)Otto Schniebs, a pioneer skiing instructor, died of bone cancer last evening. He was 78 years old, and had been a resident of Lake Placid for nearly 34 years.

title: Fur of the year
description: The fur to own this year is an updated version of the nineteenforties favoritethe chubby. If you have the nerve, it may be one of those enormous bulky affairs that are strictly for fun (although warm as only longhaired furs can be). If your taste is more conservative, you can still get in on the act with a scaleddown version such as a raccoon or fox jacket that's both fashionable and practical. Great with pants or knickers for a sporty look, it would be equally smashing over a slinky black dress in the evening.

title: Probably the best book ever done on the workings of a great department of American Government
description: When clear evidence of F.B.I. bugging emerged from a Las Vegas gambling case back in 1963, Attorney General Robert Kennedy moved to stop what he thought was all the bugging. He told Deputy Attorney General Nicholas Katzenbach to make sure they're not doing any more of that. Katzenbach asked Courtney Evans, the F.B.I. liaison man, Am I absolutely assured that this is stopped? Evans replied Yes, it's been stopped. But neither Kennedy nor Katzenbach ever specified precisely that the casebugging order applied everywhere. Years later Katzenbach found out, as he told Victor Navasky, that the F.B.I. did stop it but only in Las Vegas.

title: Canada to Help Ethnic Groups Other Than French and English
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 9  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau Is preparing a program to help Canadians who are of neither British nor French background to preserve and develop their cultures.

title: PAKISTAN LIFTS BAN ON POLITICAL ACTION
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Oct. 10 The military Government of President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan lifted its ban on political activity today in preparation for byelections in East Pakistan.

title: Ewen C. Anderson Dead; A Retired RCA Executive
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Oct. 10 Ewen C. Anderson, a former executive vice president of the Radio Corporation of America, died yesterday at the home of a son, Robert B. Anderson, 65 Durham Road. He was 71 years old and had lived in Naples, Fla., since his retirement in 1965.

title: A Larger Role for 3 Persian Gulf Rulers
description: ABU DHABI  Three rulers of the states at the southern end of the Persian Gulf are playing key roles in an area of growing economic and strategic importance.

title: Gardner's Common Cause Widens Impact
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 6  The white, smooth faces that filled the ballroom of the Olympic Hotel registered a kind of pleased surprise as John W. Gardner denounced in ringing tones the blatant, shameless, pervasive corruption that he said infests American government to the top.

title: New Head of lona College Will Continue His Teaching
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Oct. 10Dr. John G. Driscoll, a member of the faculty since 1965 and assistant to the president, Joseph G. McKenna, who resigned because of ill health, was installed today as the sixth president of Iona College.

title: Jersey Election Is Strictly Local
description: TRENTON, Oct. 10Running for the State Legislature in New Jersey in 1971 means taking a stand on the location of a dirty bookstore in Willingboro or on plans for a sewage treatment plant in Linden.

title: Brooklyn Homeowner Slays Burglary Suspect in Home
description: A Brooklyn homeowner fatally shot a burglary suspect yesterday after wresting a .22caliber revolver from the intruder's woman companion, the police reported.

title: China to Lend Ethiopia $84Million for Farming
description: PEKING, Oct. 10 (Reuters)  China will lend Ethiopia $84 million for agricultural development under an agreement signed last night in Peking.

title: Telephone Co. to Give Scores During Series
description: New York's baseball fans may get the latest World Series scores by dialing 6371212, the telephone company's time bureau.

title: ORIOLES, PIRATES STOPPED BY RAIN; 2D CONTEST TODAY
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 10The second game of the World Series was rained out today and was rescheduled for 1 o'clock tomorrow afternoon, with Jim Palmer pitching for the Baltimore Orioles against Bob Johnson of the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: FIGHTING REPORTED HEAVY IN CAMBODIA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 10 (AP)Heavy fighting broke out today near the PnompenhtoSaigon highway in eastern Cambodia, the South Vietnamese command reported. South Vietnamese forces said that 46 North Vietnamese soldiers had been killed. Seven South Vietnamese soldiers were reported killed and 15 were wounded.

title: Pellolio of Italy Takes Paris Motor Boat Race
description: PARIS, Oct. 10American drivers lost their winning ways today in the Six Hours of Paris outboard marathon on the Seine. Govanni Pellolio of Italy took the unlimited class, the first nonAmerican to win the event in the last three years.

title: State Agencies Will Move To Trade Center in 1972
description: The state agencies that have leased two million square feet of office space in the South Tower of the World Trade Center will begin to move in around Feb. 1, a spokesman for the Port of New York Authority disclosed yesterday.

title: On Strike Against Stability?
description: Senate Majority Leader Mansfield has given the balky leaders of organized labor good advice in urging that they forget politics and join with all other Americans in trying to make Phase Two of President Nixon's antiinflation program work. Even with maximum cooperation from all elements in the economy, it will be hard enough for that program to succeed.

title: Dog Succeeds His Father
description: MERIDEN, Conn. (UPI) Meriden's only police dog, Barron II, died of blood cancer. His son, King, was named to take his place.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cesar Saerchinger, a Pioneer In Transatlantic Radio, Dies
description: Csar Saerchinger, a pioneer in transatlantic radio broadcasting who was also a musicologist, died yesterday In Washington. His age was 86.

title: Patriots' Passes Rout Jets, 200;
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Oct. 10As if being upset today by the New England Patriots, 200, wasn't enough to doom their slim chance to win the Eastern Division title in the American conference, the New York Jets also lost their two best passrushers, John Elliott and Gerry Philbin, with severe, knee injuries.

title: RAIN WASHES OUT COLUMBUS MARCH
description: A steady daylong rains shagged down autumn leaves, left pedestrians puddlehopping, flooded lowlying streets across the metropolitan area and washed out the annual Columbus Day parade here yesterday for the first time in its 27year history.

title: Min Dies After Pickup
description: A 30yearold Manhattan resident was found mortally wounded at about 5:30 A.M. yesterday alongside Ditmars Boulevard near 27th Street in the Astoria section of Queens. The victim was identified by the police as Timothy Coby of 211 East 5th Street. Before he died, from five bullet wounds, the victim said he had been shot by two women he had picked up earlier in midtown and driven to Queens, the police reported.

title: Chinese Here Celebrate Nationalist Revolution
description: ChineseAmericans of the metropolitan area yesterday marked the beginning of a threeday celebration of the 60th anniversary of the Nationalist Chinese revolution with speeches, a reception and a raindelayed parade through the streets of Chinatown.

title: Shadow Over the Subcontinent
description: Sharp verbal clashes between India and Pakistan in the United Nations General Assembly strongly reinforce Secretary General Thant's recent warning that the situation in East Pakistan endangers international peace.

title: Soviet Writer Fights Odessa Librarian's Conviction
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 10A noted writer has accused an Odessa court of using the writings of Anna Akhmatova and Osip Mandelstam, two of the most famous Russian poets of the 20th century, to convict a 35yearold Odessa librarian on charges of having distributed antiSoviet literature.

title: Personal Finance: Finding a Coop Loan
description: Quite a few eyes must have blinked at the advertisement which read: Find a dream coop and we'll help you buy it.

title: A Day Off In Geneva
description: GENEVA, Oct. 10Emperor Hirohito took a day off today from his visits to European capitals and spent the afternoon seeing the sights of Lake Geneva.

title: MAGAZINE LINKS TIP TO BANUELOS RAID
description: The raid last Tuesday by Federal immigration agents on a Los Angeles food packaging plant owned by President Nixon's nominee for Treasurer of the United States was the result of a tip from a union official passed on by a Los Angeles Times newsman, according to Time magazine.

title: Amex Adopts Program Aimed At Fuller Trading Automation
description: A major new program aimed at fuller automation of stockmarket trading was announced over the weekend by the American Stock Exchange.

title: City Hall Notes
description: Mayor Lindsay will drop the other shoe and become declared Presidential candidate, or publicly and irrevocably withdraw from the campaign, sometime between the first week of December and the first week of January, according to his closest aides.

title: JAVITS BIDS LABOR JOIN WAGE BOARD
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10Jacob K. Javits of New York, a leading Republican spokesman for labor in the Senate, urged organized labor today to cooperate actively in the President's postfreeze economic program by serving on the proposed tripartite Pay Board.

title: Massachusetts Diver Dies
description: ROCKPORT, Mass,, Oct. 10 (UPI)A skindiver who ran out of air died last night lodged in rocks in 50 feet of water in Folly Cove. Officials said that Walter H. Humphrey, 37 years old, of Reading, died while his brother, James, of Los Angeles, tried to save him. Mr. Humphrey's wife and two children were on the shore when he drowned.

title: Negro Higher Education: Between 2 Worlds
description: The announcement Saturday of a $100million Ford Foundation grant for minority op portunities in higher education has refocused attention on the institutions that were founded for blacks when they were virtually barred from white colleges and universities.

title: J. David Stern, Publisher, Dies Signed First Pact With Guild
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Oct. 10J. David Stern, former publisher of The Philadelphia Record and The New York Post, died today of a heart ailment at Good Samaritan Hospital. He was 85 years old and had homes hero and at 944 Fifth Avenue in New York.

title: ANTIZIONIST SEEKS, TO SEE SOVIET JEWS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10A militant antiZionist is testing the Soviet Union's insistence that Russian Jews are free to establish contacts with foreign organizations.

title: TV Review
description: The Public Broadcasting Service's now Mondaynight Special of the Week is getting off to one of the more impressive starts of the television season. The series bed gin last week in the New York area on Channel 13 with Frederick Wisetnan's National Education Television documentary Basic Training. It continues tonight at 8 o'clock with a, twohour N.E.T. Playhouse production of William Alfred's Hogan's Goat, the play that won prizes for Off Broadway's American Place Theater in 1965.

title: What Makes a Star? Consider Case Of Cliff Gorman, the Star of Lenny
description: Are stars born, or are stars made? Is stardom some ultimate theatrical accolade won by hard work, talent and perseverance, or is it some lightning bolt of destiny, some almost capricious conjugation of circumstances, some divine chance?

title: FIVE MEN ACCUSED OF BRIBERY ATTEMPT
description: Three men were arrested as they were trying to rob a post office in the Inwood section of Manhattan early yesterday, and two others were held after they allegedly attempted to purchase their friends' freedom for $4,000 at the 34th Precinct station house, the police reported, All five were charged with bribery.

title: Theologians Find That Hope Survives
description: Mankind's future is far from hopeless, despite the purveyors of pessimism who find frustration, deceit and distrust rampant in modern society, dozen hope theologians concluded yesterday at the end of a threeday conference on Morningside Heights.

title: 2 Charged in Snake Torture
description: VERNAL, Utah, Oct. 10 (UPI) The Humane Society has filed charges of torturing a rattlesnake against two men. The society director, Thomas A. Little, said the suspectsGary Serrano and Dallas Rowley, both 26 years oldhad stitched tight the mouths of two rattiers with what appeared to be fishing line.

title: Rogers Expresses Optimism By TERENCE SMITH
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10Sec. retary of State William P. Rogers said today that he was cautiously optimistic about the chances of achieving an interim peace agreement in the Middle East given the goodwill and good intentions of Israel and Egypt.

title: London Bridge Falls Up, and Arizona Hopes for Profits
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Oct. 10In an extravagant splash of ancient pageantry and modern pressagentry, the London Bridge was opened today here in the middle of the Arizona desert.

title: CAUTIOUS COURSE LIKELY FOR BONDS
description: The credit markets responded to the NixonConnally Phase Two talks late last week in a guarded way, and many bond dealers and investment bankers think bonds are headed for an interval of relatively small price movements.

title: Fukuda Sees Statesmen Along Hirohito's Route
description: THE HAGUE, Oct. 10While Emperor Hirohito has been visiting the zoos and museums of western Europe, the Japanese Foreign Minister, Takeo Fukuda, who is accompanying him, has been slipping away for quiet diplomacy.

title: ERBERTO LANDI, 63, RADIOTV PRODUCER
description: Erberto Landi, producer, publicist and advertising executive, who promoted Italian entertainment and television programs, died yeiterday in St. Clare's Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 853 Seventh Avenue.

title: Sadat Leaves for Moscow
description: CAIRO, Oct. 10  President Sadat left for Moscow by plane via Kuwait and Iran for three days of talks with Soviet leaders on issues of war or peace between the Arabs and Israel.

title: GAINS IN TECHNOLOGY NOTED BY F.A.A. CHIEF
description: POINT CLEAR, Ala., Oct. 10 John H. Shaffer, head of the Federal Aviation Administration, said today that the agency had made significant technological gains that could save taxpayers billions of dollars in the next 10 to 15 years.

title: A Men's Boutique, but the Women Will Love
description: It's not unisex, but that won't stop women from picking up shirts, sweaters and even blazers for themselves at Yves Saint Laurent's new Rive Gauche pour klomme.

title: Chess:
description: The third game of the Bobby FischerTigran Petrosian qualifying match was a French Defensean opening that derives its name from the LondonParis correspondence match of 1834, when it was adopted by the French players it was also mentioned by Lucena in 1497 and at, one time was called the King Pawn One opening.

title: How Congressmen From Area Voted During Week
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10Following are the votes of delegations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended yesterday.

title: Cuts in U.S. Sea Power Worry Admirals
description: The admirals commanding the United States Navy and the professional officers, petty officers and senior enlisted men manning its ships are disturbed and anxious over the decline of American sea power.

title: CITY UNIT FIGHTS CUTS IN WELFARE
description: A committee of the city's policymaking Council Against Poverty has voted to use every means within our power to stop two proposed state welfare demonstration projects, the council chairman, David J. Billings 3d, said yesterday.

title: CANADA MAY CURB INFLOW OF FUNDS
description: TORONTO, Oct. 10The Canadian Government is examining ways to curtail imports of longterm capital funds. The objective would be to bring down the external value of the floating Canadian dollar and thereby strengthen exports, especially to the United States.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 10 (UPI)Firstperiod goals by Gerry Meehan and Rod Zaine and steady goaltending by Roger Crozier gave the Buffalo Sabres a 21 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight in the season opener for both clubs.

title: Socialists Narrowly Gain Majority in Austria Vote
description: VIENNA, Oct. 10The Austrian Socialist party under Chancellor Bruno Kreisky narrowly attained its goal of a majority of the votes in general elections today.

title: Scientific Research Conference Supports a Worldwide System for the Storage and Exchange of Data
description: PARIS, Oct. 9A conference of some 83 nations and 40 international organizations concerned with scientific research has supported the creation of a worldwide system of scientific data storage and exchange.

title: Still the RahRah, but Some Aren't Cheering
description: For years, the road to success in many high schools was for a girl to get herself elected cheerleader. Or become a highstrutting majorette. Both positions were automatic guarantees of popularity, the tickets to fame, influence, boyfriends, even beauty queen titles.

title: Squires Wins 6Mile Run
description: Pete Squires of the New York Athletic Club won the sixmile crosscountry run, conducted by the Road Runners Club of New York, yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park.

title: Offer to End Subway Strike Rejected by Unions in Paris
description: PARIS, Oct. 10 (AP) The Paris subway strike heads into its seventh day tomorrow following rejections by three unions of management's latest offer.

title: Advertising:
description: Just as Dan Seymour did last month, Sol Golden, chairman of the Brand Names Foundation, Friday called for a massive educational advertising campaign in behalf of advertising. As he pointed out, the ememy is at the gates.

title: Difficulties Dim Taipei Anniversary
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Oct. 10With fireworks, dragondancing teams, seas of flags and banners and parades with raucous marching bands, Nationalist China today observed its national day, Double Tenthe 10th day of the 10th month.

title: Sports of The Times
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 10When Bowie Kuhn, a black umbrella held over his head by Pat Santarone, the chief of the Baltimore ground crew, sloshed through Memorial Stadium's painted outfield shortly after noon today, he primarily was deciding the fate of the National Broadcasting Company's Nielsen ratings for this important Sunday afternoon. But the commissioner of baseball also was about to determine Pat Dobson's pitching status for this World Series.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bound Brook Still Mopping Up the Flood
description: BOUND BROOK, N. J., Oct. 10The sky was a dappled gray, and it hadn't stopped raining since before dawn. Sparse midmorning traffic crept quietly by Walter Levin's jewelry store at 401 East Main Street.

title: NEGRO WINS AWARD FOR COUNTRY MUSIC
description: NASHVILLE, Oct. 10 (UPI)Charlie Pride, a Negro singer, won tonight country music's greatest honorentertainer of the year.

title: Buckley Endorses Bond Issue, Splitting With Conservatives
description: Senator James L. Buckley said yesterday that he would vote for the controversial $2.5billion state transportation bond issue next month.

title: Colombian Leader Tells Nation To Unite in Fight on Subversion
description: BOGOTA, Columbia, Oct. 10After a week of disorder, President Misael Pastrana Borrero has appeared on television to tell his fellow Colombians that the struggle against violence is a responsibility of the whole society.

title: Rosewall Conquers Okker In $50,000 Tennis Final
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Oct. 10 (Reuters)Ken Rosewall scored a onesided victory over Tom Okker of the Netherlands, 62, 62, 64, in the final of a $50,000 international tennis tournament today.

title: Oak Ridge Uranium Shipped
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn., Oct. 10 (AP)About 167,000 pounds of enriched uranium for reactor fuel was shipped from the Oak Ridge gaseous diffusion plant during September, the Atomic Energy Commission says.

title: Jakobson: Great in Any Language
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Today is Prof. Roman Jakobson's 75th birthday, and those who would honor him may have a hard time finding him.

title: NETS, BEHIND BARRY, TOP BULLETS, 121107
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Oct. 10The New York Nets, delayed 24 hours in keeping their interleague date with the Baltimore Bullets because of a wet court, swamped the National Basketball Association club, 121107, tonight at Island Garden.

title: Books of The Times
description: OH, COD! By Avery Corman. 190 pages. Simon & Schuster. $5.95].

title: Joanne Kate Beskind Is Bride Of William Rivkin, Architect
description: The marriage of Miss Joanne Kate Beskind to William Geoffrey Rivkin took place at noon yesterday at the St. RegisSheraton, with Rabbi Alex Schindler, executive vice president of the Union of Hebrew Congregations, performing the ceremony.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 10 (UPI)Chico Maid beat the Detroit Red Wings' gonlie, Joe Daley, twice on breakaways tonight to give the Chicago Black Hawks a 21 victory, their second straight without a loss.

title: Dr. Allan Ball, 99, Taught Classical Languages Here
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Oct. 10 Dr. Allan P. Ball, professor emeritus of classical languages at what is now the City University of New York, died last night in a nursing home here. He was 99 years old and had lived in Lakeville, Conn.

title: U.S. SEEKING MONEY FOR U.N. DRUG EFFORT
description: GENEVA, Oct. 10The United States served notice over the weekend that it will continue its fight for a new $95million United Nations antinarcotics program despite the refusal of Britain and the Soviet Union to donate any of the money.

title: Israel Holds 47 in Blast
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 10 (AP)Fortyseven persons, all of them Arabs, have been arrested following a grenade blast yesterday in Jerusalem, the police reported today. Tight security was maintained around the scene of the explosion. Thirteen Jews, three of them Americans, and three Arabs were injured when the grenade exploded near the Wailing Wall.

title: Priests in Puerto Rico, Defying Bishop, Plan Commune
description: COMERIO, P.R., Oct. 10 Four priests of the Dutch Dominican order are planning to establish a commune to engage largely in secular work in this central mountain town, in defiance of the local Bishop.

title: Steel Men Expect Phase 2 to Quicken Business Activity
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 10Steel producers expected a mixed market reaction to the President's Phase Two program of wage and price regulation.

title: Browns' Late Scoring Drive Clinches 27 Victory Over Steelers
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 10 An 85yard touchdown drive that consumed almost eight minutes of the fourth quarter assured the Cleveland Browns today of a victory, by 2717, over the Pittsburgh Steelers before 83,391. The outcome not only smoothed Coach Nick Skorich's furrowed brow but gave the home team a small cushion in its division race.

title: ORCHESTRA OPENS 7TH SEASON HERE
description: The Symphony of the New World, the rectally integrated orchestra that began its seventh season yesterday afternoon in Philharmonic Hall, seems to get blacker and better each year. In past seasons, about onethird of the members were black; on this occasion, the proportion appeared to have risen considerably, to about half. In spite of a few instrumental flaws, notably in the woodwinds, the level of performance stayed quite high.

title: Bridge:
description: A declarer who can afford to draw trumps and has no urgent need to do anything else should normally do so as quickly as possible. On the diagrammed deal from the Mixed Pairs in the recent Regional Championships at Swan Lake, N. Y., the declarer thought he could afford to wait, but the opponents showed him that he was mistaken.

title: RDA. Proposes New Rules on Diagnostic XRays in Effort to Reduce Radiation Exposure
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The Food and Drug Administration has proposed new performance standards for diagnostic Xray machines in an effort to reduce Americans' radiation exposure.

title: South Moluccan Exiles Pursue 21Year Lobbying Effort at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 10The United Nations has always been a magnet for antigovernment groups and political exiles. Most come and go. Currently, the largest is the 19member group from East Pakistan, which opposes President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan and has pledged loyalty to the independent state of Bangle Desh proclaimed by rebels in the cast.

title: 25% of Shareholders Are Owners of Funds
description: The Investment Company Institute reported over the weekend that 8.45 million Americans, or one of every four shareholders in the country, owned mutual funds in 1970.

title: Lanusse Emerges Victor In Latest Argentine Crisis
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 10 Lieut. Gen Alejandro A. Lanusse danced last night at the wedding reception of his daughter, Estella Maria, which was good indication that he had come out a winner in Argentina's latest military crisis.

title: CAPITAL EXPORTS OF U.S. DISPUTED
description: PARIS, Oct. 10The extent which the United States will export longterm private capital is becoming one of the more contentious issues in the debate over the dollar crisis.

title: Alioto Testimony Delayed
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 10 (UPI) Mayor Joseph L. Alioto of San Francisco will not be required to testify until after Election Day in a $2.3million civil suit brought against him in a feesplitting case, Judge Donald L. Gaines, who is presiding over the trial in Superior Court, Vancouver, said today. Mr. Alloto is campaigning for a second term as Mayor. The election is scheduled for Nov. 2.

title: Herbert Rumsey Simonds, Made Birth Curb Devices
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Oct. 10Herbert Rumsey Simonds, founder of the HollandRanta Company of New York, died here Friday of a stroke. He was 85 years old.

title: Paging Mr. Mitchell
description: Governor Rockefeller has added to the confusion of the already tangled post mortems of the Attica tragedy by asking Attorney General Mitchell to investigate charges that the rights of inmates have been violated. The request, Mr. Rockefeller said, had been made to assure public confidence in the objectivity and fairness of the entire Attica investigation.

title: Broad Rollback of Prices In Phase 2 Seems Unlikely
description: The Nixon Administration's plan to prevent business from reaping windfall profits seems unlikely to result in any broadscale rolling back of prices, a number of economic and security analysts suggested in interviews over the weekend.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
GUARDSUNION HEAD ASSAILS AIDE PLAN
description: Leo Zeferetti, president of the Correction Officers Benevolent Association, said yesterday that his organization would ask the State Supreme Court this week to order the city to halt its new program of hiring slum youths as prison aides.

title: Passionately Moderate
description: Not many words with the power to shock are left in the American vocabulary, moderate being about the dirtiest. Only seven years ago Barry Goldwater was humbled in the dust for extolling extremism and downgrading moderation. Now Senator Muskie of Maine, his eye on the White House, finds himself urged to dilute his reputation as a temperate politician, as a man who comes only cautiously to great decisions and is addicted to learning all he can about an issue before trumpeting his views on it. In large and influential segments of the electorate, some youthful and some merely in pursuit of youthful approval, such attributes are the hallmark no longer of the philosopherstatesman but of the. Establishment mediocrity.

title: Bolshoi Stirring Vienna With 3 Russian Operas
description: VIENNA, Oct. 10 The present visit of the Bolshoi Theater Ensemble is the outstanding cultural event here. Those lucky enough to get opera ticketsa small fraction of those who want to get inare inebriating in the melodious splendor of Russian music, rare treats in these parts.

title: Ms. Abzug Finding Mr.'s Rule House
description: WASHINGTON  Bella S. Abzug, who won election on the theme that this woman's place is in the House, has found that the House is not a home yet.

title: Advertising:
description: The failure of the U. S. Media/International buying service is having its repercussions in the broadcast field. Some broadcasters, or at least their advertising representatives, already stinging from the late payment problem, are calling for new systems of payment.

title: Mrs. Millicent Hancock Is Rewed
description: Mrs. Millicent Marie Zelenka Hancock and Martin Thomas Carey were married here yesterday afternoon at. St. Ignatius Loyola Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. William M. Dilgen, cousin of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Nix Guides Bears to Victory
description: Shaky in his first starting assignment in three years, Kent Nix threw four straight incompletions yesterday, but then went on to prove he could start as well as relieve as the Bears trounced the New Orleans Saints, 3514, at Chicago.

title: Soviet Blast Recordea
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Oct. 10 (Reuters)  The Seismological Institute in Uppsala announced today that it had recorded an underground nuclear explosion in the Semipalatinsk area of Siberiai yesterday. It registered 5.7 on the openended Richter scale, the institute said.

title: Art by Yoko Ono Shown At Museum in Syracuse
description: SYRACUSE, Oct. 10  Is Syracuse ready for Yoko Ono and John Lennon? That was the question here yesterday as the Everson Museum, which sees itself as a bastion of the avantgarde set down in a cultural wasteland, opened the world's first museum show of Miss Ono's conceptual pieces, with her husband, the former Beetle, and others, as guest artists.

title: A RALLY TO EVICT NIXON SET OCT. 26
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The Mayday, Tribe will return to the nation's capital Oct. 25, with plans to surround and close the White House during a rally the next day.

title: Egypt to Improve Airports
description: CAIRO, Oct. 10 (Agence FrancePresse)  Egypt will spend about $120million in the next 10 years to refurbish and enlarge airports, the daily Al Ahrarn said today. Airports at Alexandria and Luxor will be enlarged and opened to international traffic within a year.

title: RED SOX, BREWERS IN 10PLAYER DEAL
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 10 (UPI) The Boston Red Sox traded six players, including George Scott, the, first baseman; Billy Conigliaro, the outfielder, and Jim Lonborg, the pitcher, to the Milwaukee Brewers tonight for four players. It was the first big trade of the offseason.

title: Fragile Outpost
description: So much of the wild and the beautiful, the serene and sheltered Atlantic Coast Ms already gone down the drain a polluted drain at thatthat it has become of overriding importance for the health and enjoyment of future generations to preserve what is left of it unspoiled from the depredations of the past and the present.

title: Miss Leslie Ruth Zirinsky a Bride
description: KING GEORGE, Va., Oct. 10Miss Leslie Ruth Zirinsky was married here this afternoon to Dr. Ronald L. Melnick. Rabbi Isadore Franzblau performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Nahman Zirinsky, parents of the bride.

title: Versatility Shown By Billy Vanaver At Folk Concert
description: Ethnic musicians and folk singers usually limit themselves to a specific area of music. But Billy Vanaver seems to know no bounds.

title: Woman Is Injured in Belfast In New Wave of Bombings
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 10 (AP)Three bombs exploded in Belfast today while troops hunted terrorists who blew up a tavern last night in the predominantly Roman Catholic Lower Falls area, killing a woman and wounding 17 other persons.

title: Five Die in Ohio In Boiler Explosion At Church School
description: MARIETTA, Ohio, Oct. 10 (UPI)  Four teenagers and their teacher were killed and 14 persons injured today when a boiler in the annex of the First Baptist Church exploded, causing concrete, steel and scalding water to collapse on a Sunday school class.

title: Moscow's Caged Millions
description: Two eminent voices have been raised recently in Moscow to remind the Soviet Government that a nation whose citizens cannot go abroad when they wish is essentially a prison.

title: Kraber Performs Virtuoso Program In Recital for Flute
description: Karl Kraber, a flute player known here as a member of the Dorian Woodwind Quinitet, made a strong bid for major attention as a solo virtuoso in the recital he gave at Tully Hall on Saturday night.

title: Art: Eskimo Collection
description: The exhibition of contemporary Eskimo art at the Museum of Natural History is another instance of the modern enthusiasm for the art of primitive cultures. It is a showcase for the collection of Dr. Herbert Schwarz, who, while serving in recent years as a physician in the Canadian Arctic, assembled a mixture of sculptures, relief carvings and prints done by artists living in the area.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Redcoats Are BackTheir Kin Visit the Mohawk
description: JOHNSTOWN, N. Y., Oct. 10  Seventyfive Canadians whose ancestors fought on the losing side in the American Revolution made a homecoming pilgrimage to the Mohawk Valley this weekend.

title: DOLE ASSERTS G.O.P. WINS ETHNIC GROUPS
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 10 (UPI)Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas, the Republican National Chairman, said today that radical liberals, labor bosses and irresponsible politicians control the Democratic party and have driven out the ethnic group that used to be part of their political strength.

title: Lost Medici Portrait Authenticated as a 1518 Raphael
description: A portrait bought here three years ago by a New York art dealer has been authenticated as a work painted by Raphael in 1518.

title: NEW SITES SURVEYED FOR NUCLEAR POWER
description: The New York State Atomic and Space Development Authority announced that detailed environmental suitability studies were proceeding in the towns of Sterling in Cayuga County, Yates in Orleans County and Wilson in Niagara County. All three sites are on the shore of Lake Ontario.

title: Shop Talk
description: Thirty print designs, made on ancient wood blocks from the library of the Dalai Lama of Tibet, will be on exhibition and sale at Macy's be. ginning today. The wood blocks from 100 to 800 years old, are said to have originated in Eastern Tibet and were smuggled over the Hi malaya Mountains in 1950 when the Dalai Lama fled into exile in Dharmsala, India, Each design is printed only once every 60 years. The prints to be sold here, depicting the Wheel of Life and other religious symbols and figures, are an additional quantity made this spring during the annual printing for the temples. They were brought back by a team of young filmmakers who had been working in India. One of the team had been sent to see the Dalai Lama, arrived in the midst of the printing, and persuaded the lamas engaged in the work to make an extra quantity.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SEYMOUR LUSTMAN MOURNED AT YALE
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 10A memorial service in honor of Dr. Seymour Lustman, a Yale child psychiatrist, was attended here today by hundreds of friends, colleagues and students.

title: They're Not Political Prisoners
description: I have been watching our hagiographers at work on George Jackson, and he's finely tuned to their purposeyoung, articulate, black and, now, a putative martyr. But I wonder if we can any longer afford our myths, our Lives of Saints or our horror stories, and if it's not imperative that we begin to tell each other the plain truth.

title: Menuhin Reports Soviet Music Acquires a New Sophistication
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 10  Yehudi Menuhin, the American violinist, says that he had found Soviet music evolving toward a certain measure of sophistication absent during his last visit nine years ago.

title: Crash Kills 6
