description: It's a case of mutual blackmail.

title: INQUIRY IS REPORTED TO INVOLVE JUDGES
description: The State Joint Legislative Committee on Crime is reported to be investigating the conduct of several state judges named on tapes turned over to the committee by the Knapp Commission.

title: AIMS ARE SEIZED AT AN IRISH PORT
description: DUBLIN, Oct 19Six large suitcases of arms and ammunition, including automatic rifles and hand grenades, were seized by customs officials today at the Irish port of Cobh, where they were unloaded from the Queen Elizabeth 2 on the liner's arrival from New York.

title: Gimbel and Yunich Predict Revival of Growth for City
description: Two prominent New York merchants predicted a revival of economic and residential growth in New York City after receiving awards last night by the Avenue of Americas Associations.

title: E.F.T.A. and GATT React
description: GENEVA, Oct. 19Both the ninenation European Free Trade Association and the 79nation General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade will be considering the 10 per cent surcharge on imports that the new Danish Government included today in its austerity program despite its international commitments.

title: Cyanamid in Decline
description: The American Cyanamid Company reported yesterday that earnings during the third quarter and first nine months declined from yearearlier levels.

title: Senate Votes to Make Amending Of Constitution More Difficult
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Senate approved unanimously today a new set of ground rules for amending the Constitution through calling a national convention, an action never yet taken in the 184year history of the document.

title: JAPANESE TO SEEK CLOSER CHINA TIES
description: TOKYO, Oct. 19Premier Eisaku Sato of Japan said in a major address today that he would undertake an urgent new effort to open up Government and commercial contacts with the Chinese Government in Peking.

title: Peace Garden Funds Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP) The Senate Interior Committee approved today a bill to authorize an additional appropriation of $1,054,000 for completion of the International Peace Garden in North Dakota and Manitoba on the United StatesCanada border.

title: Celtics Set Back Bullets
description: BOSTON, Oct. 19 (AP)Jo Jo White scored 26 points tonight as the Boston Celtics defeated the Baltimore Bullets, 134.114, in a National Basketball Association contest.

title: GULFSTREAM SUIT PLANNED TO STOP OTB ACTION THERE
description: Gulfstream Park will sue the Offtrack Betting Corporation if OTB takes action on races there this winter, the Florida track's president warned here yester

title: HIGH COURT GETS SUIT ON BASEBALL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19A1most a halfcentury after Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes declared for a unanimous Supreme Court that professional baseball was exempt from Federal antitrust laws, the Supreme Court agreed today to review that decision in a suit brought by Curt Flood, the former St. Louis Cardinal outfielder.

title: Art and Music Mark Student Protest
description: Hundreds of students fron the Fiorello H. La Guardia High School of Music and the Arts, demonstrating their tal ents as well as their concerns staged an unusual protest out side Board of Education headquarters in Brooklyn yesterday.

title: Denmark Plans Surcharge As Protectionist Measure
description: PARIS, Oct. 19Two signs of what has been feared most in the world monetary crisis spreading protectionism  appeared in Europe today. They were:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I write as the newly elected chairman of the Japan Democratic Socialist party.

title: Successful Retirement Linked To Meditation and Celebration
description: Presidents and board chairmen of about 60 American corporations, plus some university presidents and others, met here yesterday to contemplate one of the most agonizing events in the life of any, career personretirement.

title: Nuclear BuildUp in Soviet Worrying U.S. Strategists
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19A number of officials charged with responsibility for national security are increasingly sounding the alarmprivately more than publiclyover the Soviet buildup of strategic nuclear weapons. They are doing so despite President Nixon's public insistence that he is encouraged by progress toward achieving at least a limited halt in the arms race.

title: SAMUEL KRAMER, LAWYER, 80, DIES
description: Samuel Kramer, an international lawyer who was a principal architect of the legislation that set up the West German Government after World War II, died apparently of a heart attack at his home on Monday. He was 80 years old and lived at 310 East 44th Street.

title: City Rejects Pension Plan for Uniformed Workers
description: The city said yesterday that it was unwilling to go along with an impasse panel's pension recommendation for the police, firemen and sanitationmen.

title: U. S. BOMBS KILL 18 IN SAIGON UNIT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Oct. 20 (AP)The United States command said yesterday that an American fighterbomber struck a South Vietnamese position near the Cambodian border and killed 18 Government soldiers in an error involving the designation of the target.

title: CENSUS ASSAYS PLAN OF MAIL VOTER ROLLS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The director of the Bureau of the Census told a Senate committee today that the bureau could administer a program of mail voter registration for Federal elections.

title: Memphis Store Is FireBombed During Negro Youth's Funeral
description: MEMPHIS, Oct. 19 (UPI) A food store was fire bombed tonight near funeral services that were being held for a Negro youth suspected of having been beaten to death following police chase.

title: JAPAN URGES U.N. SEAT TWO CHINAS AS INTERIM STEP Aichi Declares Peking and Taipei Should Then Solve Differences Peacefully
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 19Japan urged the General Assembly today to admit Communist China to the United Nations while keeping Nationalist China a member and said that doing so would be a transitional step for solving the Chinese representation issue.

title: Kahane Deported
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 19 (AP)Rabbi Meir Kahane, leader of the militant Jewish Defense League in the United States, was deported from Canada today. He and six other persons had come here to protest the treatment of Jews in the Soviet Union during the visit of Premier Kosygin.

title: Newton Trial Delayed
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 19 (UPI)Alameda County Superfor Judge postponed today the start of Huey P. Newton's third manslaughter trial for one week. He acted to allow time for decisions on motions filed by Charles Garry, attorney for the Black Panther leader.

title: BUCKS WIN, 11682, TO STAY UNBEATEN
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 19 (AP)The unbeaten Milwaukee Bucks rushed to leads of 183 and 3111, then coasted to a 11682 National Basketball Association victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers tonight.

title: Canadian Jews March to Press Kosygin on Emigration
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 19An estimated 7,500 Canadian Jews marched through downtown Ottawa today to demand that visiting Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin free Jews to emigrate from the Soviet Union. The Soviet leader did not see the demonstration, however.

title: SOUTHDOWN ACTION BY ZAPATA APPROVED
description: Shareholders of Zapata Norness, Inc., and Southdown, Inc., at separate meetings yesterday approved a previously announced exchange agreement between the two companies calling for an exchange of Zapata's 27 per cent interest in Southdown for certain Southdown properties.

title: Harrisburg Bishop Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP) Pope Paul VI has accepted the resignation of the Most Rev. George L. Leach, Bishop of Harrisburg, Pa. The Most Rev. Joseph T. Daley, Coadjutor Bishop, immediately becomes the new Bishop, the church announced today.

title: W. U. Seeks To Reduce Office Sites
description: An official of the Western Union Telegraph Company said yesterday that the company planned eventually to consolidate 101 small branch offices in Manhattan, the Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens into seven 'public message centers.

title: WALSH THREATENS TO PUNCH POSTEL
description: Housing and Development Administrator Albert A. Walsh threatened to punch Councilman Robert I. Postel yesterday during a City Council hearing into. Mr. Walsh's administration of the Municipal Loan Program.

title: Sounds of Spanish Vihuelas in Concert
description: Like the swoose, which is neither swan nor goose, the Spanish vihuela was neither lute nor guitar. Womanly in shape, the 16thcentury plucked instrument spoke as women in myth and legend speak, softly and modestly. It was doublestrung, like the European lute, and usually tuned, similarly. It died around 1600, possibly of acute confusion.

title: Excerpts From Debate on China's Seat in the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 19Following are excerpts from today's debate in the General Assembly on the, issue whether the expulsion of Nationalist China is an important question, requir ing a twothirds majority, a resolution urged by the United States in the hope of preventing Taipei's ouster.

title: By Lyndon B. Johnson: Bombing North After Tonkin Attack
description: IN August, 1964, an unexpected crisis developed, one that threatened for a time to change the nature of the war in Vietnam. During the early hours of Sunday morning, Aug. 2, a highpriority message came in reporting that North Vietnamese torpedo boats had attacked the destroyer U.S.S. Maddox in the Gulf of Tonkin. The duty officer in the White House situation room gathered all the available data, prepared a summary and sent it to my bedroom. The report began:

title: Film: A Liberal Samurai
description: Hideo Gosha's "Goyokin," an elaborate but undistinguished Japanese samurai movie with a bleeding, liberal heart, is about Mogobei (Tatsuya Nakadai), an enlightened Oriental equivalent to Sergio Leone's Man With No Name.Magobei becomes a renegade samurai when he refuses to put his clan's welfare above that of some common fisher folk, murdered so that the clan may obtain gold enough to pay its taxes to the corrupt shogun. "See how a bad government makes us dirty our hands," says one of Magobei's former clansmen, and it's apparent that a perfectly respectable 19th-century adventure genre has been updated, if not corrupted, by 20th-century liberalism of the sort that is so anachronistic in some of our own Westerns.The movie's real interest is not politics but the kind of swordplay and slaughter that anesthetizes without giving preliminary pleasure. The time is 1834, toward the end of the Tokugawa shogunate, whose collapse is as much a reference point for samurai films as the Civil War is for American frontier movies."Goyokin," currently at the Bijou, is the first attraction in the theater's fall festival of Japanese films.

title: Alberto Pirelli Is Dead at 89; Best Known for Racing Tires
description: ROME, Oct. 19  Alberto Pirelli, manufacturer of racing tires and other rubber products, died tonight at his home in Casciano, north, of Milan. He was 89 years old.

title: Lockhart, Webster Agree To Forget Blitz Disaster
description: Carl (Spider) Lockhart is not the kind of fellow to hold his tongue when he gets angry and he got angry Sunday when he was benched during the Giants 317 defeat by the Baltimore Colts.

title: Lindsay Says City Runs Very Nicely When He Is Away
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that his political campaign trips around the country were not hindering his effectiveness in running New York City.

title: STATE ASKS U.S. FOR A RENT RULING
description: The state's top housing official has asked the Nixon Administration to permit existing rentcontrol laws  with their scheduled rent increases  to operate in the city and state during Phase Two of President Nixon's wageprice controls.

title: HAWKS TO OPPOSE RANGERS TONIGHT
description: The Rangers sixgame, stretch against the National Hockey League's strongest squads ends tonight with a meeting against the undefeated Chicago Black Hawks, whose opposition has been less than frightening.

title: Moscow Says Kosygin Plans Cuban Visit Soon
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 19 (Reuters)  Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union is to visit Cuba at the end of this month, the Moscow radio announced tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It was your Robert Frost who wrote good fences make good neighbors.

title: Knapp Inquiry Agent Is a Master At Inconspicuous Eavesdropping
description: Teddy Ratnoff, who was identified yesterday as an agent for the Knapp Commission, is a shadowy figure who says he was active in headlinemaking investigitions of the past and who makes his living by developing eavesdropping equipment.

title: BRUSSELS PLANNING NO MASS EXPULSION
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 19Belgian Foreign Ministry officials made It clear today that they did not expect any mass expulsion of Soviet diplomats like the recent one in Britain. London banned 105 Soviet officials after they had been implicated as espionage agents by a defector.

title: Policeman Is Killed In Landfill Dispute; Owner Is Arrested
description: BELLEFONTE, Pa., Oct. 19 (UPI) The owner of a very unsanitary garbage landfill, who had been ordered by a magistrate to stop polluting, allegedly killed one policeman and wounded an auxilliary officer in a fit of anger today.

title: Busy Councilman Robert Ira Postel
description: Councilman Robert Ira Postel was recalling the events that had occupied his time of late. There was the municipal loan investigation, his inquiry into youth detention homes and the budget hearings.

title: CANUCKS 31 VICTORS ON CORRIGAN'S GOALS
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 19 (UPI)Mike Corrigan scored his first two goals of the season tonight to give the Vancouver Canucks a 31 victory over the St, Louis Blues in the National Hockey League.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: PEKING, Oct. 19 (Reuters)  Prince Norodom Sihanouk, exiled Cambodian head of state, said today he would like to meet President Nixon for a frank discussion of the war in Cambodia.

title: Boycott Closes College
description: WILBERFORCE, Ohio, Oct. 19 (AP) Wilberforce University suspended classes today after a student boycott yesterday that virtually brought the school to a halt. The students are protesting the suspension of 40 male students who participated in a sitin at a women's dormitory Thursday. The protest was an attempt to open the dormitories to coed visitation.

title: PHILIP L. HANDSMAN, LAWYER, 66, IS DEAD
description: GREAT NECK, L. L, Oct. 19 Philip L. Handsman, senior partner in the New York law firm of Kotzen, Mann & Handsman and vice chairman of the board of the Colonial Penn Group, Inc., a Philadelphia insurance concern, died today in the North Shore Hospital, Manhasset. He was 66 years old and lived at 31 Highland Avenue.

title: Free Tory Vote on Europe
description: Prime Minister Heath's surprise announcement that his Conservative party colleagues in Parliament will be free next week to vote their consciences, on British entry into the European Economic Community is the decision of man confident of the outcome. Previously, Mr. Heath had implied that he would invoke a threeline whipthe maximum disciplinary weapon  to keep Conservative ranks intact behind the Government's drive for Common Market membership.

title: Richard Alexander, 84, Dead; Professor at Teachers College
description: WAYNESVILLE, N. C., Oct. 19  Richard Thomas Alexander, former professor of education at Teachers College, Columbia University, and founder of its experimental New College in the nineteenthirties, died on Saturday in Memorial Hospital here. He was 84 years old and lived in Canton.

title: Amex Stocks Post 5th Straight Drop As Trading Rises
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange took another beating yesterday as the list declined for the fifth, consecutive session in steppedup trading.

title: Institute for Deaf Robbed
description: The Hebrew Institute for the Deaf at 2025 67th Street, Brooklyn, reported yesterday that it had been robbed Monday night of electronic equipment and other items, including hearing and visual aids, movie projectors, special typewriters for deaf palsied children and office supplies.

title: Fanny May Yields Fall On 4Month Obligations
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (UPI)The Federal National Mortgage Association today accepted $103.6million of the $219.8million in bids it received in an auction of fourmonth mortgage commitments.

title: MRS. ELMER L. CLINE
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y Oct. 19 Mrs. Caroline Frenzel Cline, the widow of Elmer L. Cline, president of the Scarsdale advertising agency of that name, died today in White Plains Hospital. She was 86 years old and lived at 67 Brewster Road.

title: Increase in Prices for. Fuel Oil In City Is Under Investigation
description: The Office of Emergency Preparedness, watchdog of the wageprice freeze, is investigating the legality of an increase in the price of heating oil that could cost the city $1million this winter, add millions of dollars to the maintenance costs of private landlords and lead to the abandonment of many residential buildings on the verge of bankruptcy.

title: MERGER PLANNED BY H. HENTZ &
description: Faulkner, Dawkins & Sullivan and H. Hentz & Co. announced plans yesterday to merge in what would be the largest Wall Street consolidation in nearly year.

title: A Onetime Model With Designs on San Francisco Mayoralty
description: SAN FRANCISCODianne Feinstein walked into the crowded health center in the black ghetto of Bayview.

title: Musica Sacra Series Begin a New Season
description: That less can be sometimes nore was proved on Monday night at the Central Presbyterian Church, when this season's series of Musica Sacra concerts was opened. With 21 singers, including the soloists, and 15 instrumentalists, including the organist, Haydn's Lord Nelson Mass was given a performance that rivaled in effectiveness any by massed choirs and orchestra in standard concert halls.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Since World War II the United States merchant marine has experienced a steady decline, interrupted but briefly by the Korean and Indochina wars. The reasons for this decline are manifoldforeign competition, poor management, unrealistic labor contracts, particularly those negotiated by the longshoremen now on strike against all East and West Coast steamship companies.

title: One Killed and 36 Hurt As Tank Car Explodes
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 19 (AP)A railroad tank car filled with chemicals derailed and exploded into flames today. Then, as firemen and newsmen swarmed around it, it exploded again.

title: ... The Cruelest Cut
description: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee today begins final action in its task of marking up the foreign aid authorization billa hatchet job that might more appropriately be described as cutting down foreign aid. The committee already has chopped 25 per cent from the Administration's $3.3billion military and economic assistance request.

title: William Rogers, ExHead Of Select Magazines, Dies
description: RIDGE,L. I., Oct. 19William A. Rogers, former president of Select Magazines, a distributing concern, died yesterday at his home. He was 76 years old.

title: Textile Quotas Held Inadequate
description: The new Far East textile quota agreements are a temporary stopgap that still permit foreign countries to flood the United States market with lowcost imports, T. Nash Broaddus, president of the Duplan Corporation, said yesterday.

title: Fairfield Beats West Hills In Sherman Polo Opener
description: DARIEN, Conn., Oct. 19George Haas scored eight goals to lead the Fairfield County Hunt Club of Westport, Conn., the defending champion, to 149 victory over West Hills, L. I., tonight in a firstround game of the George C. Sherman Memorial fivegoal indoor polo tournament at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club.

title: JailClothes Mat Barred
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (UPI) The Supreme Court refused today to disturb a lower court decision stating that an impression of guilt was created in the minds of a jury when a defendant was put on trial in jail clothes.

title: Harvard's Offensive Line Improves
description: In one of his preseason statements, Joe Restic, Harvard's new coach, said, It will take the players three or four games to absorb and execute the new system. Yesterday, in a fourgame evaluation, Restic said, Harvard is a vastly improved football team, especially the offensive line That group has pleased me more than any other group so far. If Restic's evalu ation is true, it means that Harvard's offense has lost its sputter, particularly noticeable in its first three games.

title: KISSINGER ARRIVES IN PEKING FOR TALKS
description: PEKING, Wednesday, Oct. 20 (Reuters)Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's special Assistant, arrived in Peking today aboard a Boeing Presidential jet to make arrangements for the President's historic visit to China.

title: Gain Seen for City Rule on Ad Quotes
description: The proposed city regulation barring the use of deceptive quotations in movie, theater and book advertisements moved closer to adoption yesterday as public support developed for its implementation.

title: Sites in North Attacked
description: SAIGON, Oct. 20 (Reuters)Two United States Thunderchief jets fired missiles at an antiaircraft missile site in North Vietnam yesterday, United States military spokesman said today. The jets were escorting bombers pounding the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos when electronic monitors showed the ground site had locked onto their positions in preparation for a launching.

title: SINGLE CANDIDATE BY BLACKS HINTED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 Georgia State Representative Julian Bond said today the group of black leaders who are preparing strategy for the 1972 elections appear to favor putting up a single candidate for President at the Democratic National Convention in order to strike a bargain to win more Government jobs for blacks.

title: CITY BUDGET PLEAS ORDERED CHECKED
description: The chairman of the City Council's Committee on Finance ordered city officials yesterday to check with the Federal Cost of Living Council before coming to the committee with any budgetmodification requests.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Secretary of Defense Laird, in his Oct. 13 news conference, raised the possibility of the Soviet Union's not only reaching parity with the United States by 1973 in the number of Polaristype submarines deployed, but also soon thereafter surpassing this country in this important strategic area. The Secretary's revelation comes at a time when it is known that the Russians have been less than, enthusiastic about disCussing limitations on submarine production at SALT.

title: 212,000 MEN NEEDED BY ARMY NEXT YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 The Army will need 212,000 new men, or about 18,000 month, during the fiscal year 1972, Lieut. Gen. Walter T. Kerwin Jr., deputy chief of staff for personnel in the Department of the Army, told a House subcommittee today.

title: Bridge: Handbook Gives Details Of '71 World Title Play
description: The book of the 1971 World Team Championship in Taipei last May is perhaps the best in the long series of excellent handbooks published by the American Contract Bridge League, 125 Greenwich Avenue, Greenwich, Conn. 06830.

title: Brinkley Asserts That TV Newsmen Are Unintimidated
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 David Brinkley, in sharp disagreement with Walter Cronkite, his rival in television's evening news, insisted today that criticism had not intimidatedthe electronic press.

title: MAJOR ART SHOW TO OPEN IN DUBLIN
description: DUBLIN, Oct. 19The most exciting and significant things in contemporary. art are hap., pening at the moment in the United States and Germany. This may be a superficial conclusion, but one must draw it from ROSC 71, the most important international art exhibition of the year, which will be opened here Sunday by Prime Minister Jack Lynch.

title: 1970 Census Finds Indian No Longer the Vanishing American
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The vanishing American is not vanishing. According to a 1970 census computation published today, the American Indian population is growing four times as fast as the population as a whole,

title: PRICE LIST RULING IS FOUND IGNORED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 President Nixon's order requiring merchants to provide ceiling price lists for their customers during the wage and price freeze still is apparently being largely ignored  even as the 90day freeze enters its final weeks.

title: Inflation and Joblessness Called Key Issues in Survey of Editors
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 19The battle against inflation and unemployment has attracted public attention more than any other issue, a geographical sampling of 365 newspaper editors meeting here indicated.

title: Neighborhoods: Safe, Proud Maspeth
description: The other day the chief assistant district attorney of Queens was asked why, when crime in Queens rose 12.5 per cent In the first six months of this year compared with the same period last year, the figures for the 112th Precinct declined more than 10 per cent.

title: KENNEDY CRITICAL OF NIXON POLICIES
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy charged the Nixon Administration last night with attempting to destroy the Constitution.

title: COTTON FUTURES POST INCREASES
description: Heavy unwanted rains in parts of Texas and some of the other Gulf Coast States prompted an advance in cotton futures contracts on the New York Cotton Exchange yesterday.

title: Lament by Griffith: Rich Teams to Rule if Flood's Suit Wins
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Oct. 19 (AP)Calvin Griffith shudders at the thought of a Harmon Killebrew or Tony Oliva leaving the Minnesota Twins for a better offer with another team.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: ATHENS, Oct. 19  The Government said today that it had been reassured by Vice President Agnew on the continuation of American military assistance.

title: Ethics Board Clears 3 Democrats in Huntington
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., Oct. 19The Board of Ethics of the Town of Huntington said today that every charge of corruption and misuse of public office leveled last month by the town Republican organization against two incumbent Democratic Councilmen and the Town Supervisor was without foundation.

title: Excerpts From Testimony by Patrolman Phillips on GraftTaking
description: Following are excerpts from testimony given yesterday before the Knapp Commission, during its second day of public hearings, by Patrolman William R. Phillips of the New York City Police Department.

title: Owner of Cafe Defends Police of 19th Precinct
description: Did I ever give a policeman anything? Gerard Zwirn, an East Side restaurant owner, asked rhetorically before plunging his fork into a chef's salad.

title: ARMY REJECTS TAPE AT HENDERSON TRIAL
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Oct. 19The military judge in the courtmartial of Col. Oran K. Henderson ruled today that the prosecution was entitled to examine a controversial tape recording before its use by the defense.

title: Season of Discontent
description: The dust has settled but the internal dissension over a deleted section on F.B.I. undercover agents in The Great American Dream Machine clearly shows that public television has administrative and programing problems. Public TVincluding New York's own station, Channel 13did recover to a degree by running the controversial section followed by a discussion. What emerged for the viewer was new awareness of the special difficulties of the public television network that and must be funded by the Federal Government.

title: Notes on People
description: Originally, President Nixon's posted schedule called for a meeting yesterday with His Excellency, Sirimavo Bandaranalke, Prime Minister of Ceylon. Fortunately, before the Prime Minister arrived, someone corrected the schedule to read Her Excellency, and Ceylon's head of state received a friendly reception in the President's office. Mr. Nixon, looking back on his visit to her capital 18 years ago, recalled, I remember a party; it rained. But he quickly added I enjoyed Colombo.

title: Knicks Turn Back Warriors, 93 to 84
description: The Knicks defeated the Golden State Warriors, 9384, last night at Madison Square Garden and Bill Bradley was a clear winner in his, first professional headtohead battle with Cazzie Russell.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In this great age of moonwalks and nonstick frying pans, I was astonished to discover that the sophisticated technology of the Postal Service has not produced an adhesive adequate for the sealing of airmail letters. I had to apply glue to seal four of five such sent last week. Is this a record?

title: White House Sees No Delay on Court
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The White House press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler, said today that President Nixon was still expected to name his two nominees for the Supreme Court before the end of the week.

title: Melchionni, Barry Help Nets Subdue Condors by 125120
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 19 (AP)Bill Melchionni scored 32 points and Rick Barry got 30 to pace the New York Nets to a 125120 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors tonight in an American Basketball Association game.

title: LABOR M.P.'S VOTE ANTIMARKET LINE
description: LONDON, Oct. 19The Labor party's fundamental split on the issue of Common Market entry was dramatically displayed today at a meeting of the party's Members of Parliament.

title: GAMBLING BRIBES TO POLICE ALLEGED IN EVERY DIVISION
description: A New York patrolman who for the last few months has served as an undercover Agent for the Knapp Commission testified yesterday that gamblers were paying bribes to the police in every division in the city.

title: Old Maryland Hotel Again Faces Razing
description: CUMBERLAND, Md., Oct. 19 (AP)The City Council, despite a strenuous plea by Mayor Thomas Conlon, voted 3 to 2 tonight against a motion to rescind its order to raze the centuryold Queen City statin hotel.

title: Explorer Optimistic on Digging Up Columbus's Flagship
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 19After four years of diving, digging, napping and electronic sounding, an American explorer believes he is getting, warm in his search for the wreckage of Christopher Columbus's flagship, the Santa Maria.

title: Guard at Hospital Indicted in Death of Prisoner
description: A correction officer was charged yesterday with stomping to death a 22yearold inmate in a shower room at Kings County Hospital in June.

title: Celibacy Seen Gaining Synod Support
description: ROME, Oct. 19Reports to the World Synod of Bishops indicated today that a mood of conservatism has set in on the question of whether to endorse the ordination of married men as Roman Catholic priests.

title: Indian and Pakistani Armies Confront Each Other Along Borders
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 19  The armies of India and Pakistan are now confronting each other, along their borders.

title: The Smell of War...
description: The reported buildup of Indian and Pakistani forces along the borders of both East and West Pakistan adds urgency to the warning of a New Delhi official that there is a smell of war in the air. Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, who has so far managed to restrain Indian hawks, indicated mounting frustration in an interview this week in which she termed the situation quite grave.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Oct. 19 Rhode Island's Attorney General, Richard Israel, ruled today that a student may register to vote at his college address only if he intends to live for an indefinite period in the town where his college is situated.

title: GOODRICH WILL DROP SYNTHETIC LEATHER
description: The B. F. Goodrich Company said yesterday it would stop making its Aztran poromeric material for shoe uppers on Dec. 1.

title: Pakistan Accuses India
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Oct. 19 Pakistan has warned India that she will take appropriate action if Indian aircraft continue what Pakistan charges are violations of her airspace.

title: Bluegrass Twangs Over Tokyo Mountains
description: TOKYO,Oct. 19It soundct like West Virginia on a Saturday night, but it was Tokyo's Hibiya Park on a Sunday afternoon.

title: A FEDERAL COURT STIFFENS TAX RULE
OrderWriting Picks Up in Men's Wear
description: More than 10,000 men's apparel retailers are visiting New York this week to purchase merchandise for holiday an'd springand their talk is more upbeat than it has been in some time.

title: Baseball's Next Inning
description: Now that the Supreme Court of the United States has agreed to hear Curt Flood's antitrust suit against baseball, several questions arise. What will he the effect on baseball and other sports if the Court rules in Flood's favor? Will there be sudden, dramatic changes whichever way the Court rules? What procedures lie ahead? How is this suit related to Congressional hearings on sports legislation?

title: Copper Strike Cited
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation suffered the severest decline in earnings in its history during the third quarter and first nine months this year, according to results reported yesterday by the nation's largest domestic copper producer.

title: LONE STAR GAS CO. EXPANDS EARNINGS
description: The Lone Star Gas Company yesterday reported gains in rev enues and net, income for this year's first nine months.. The report placed revenues at $201,545,000, up from $198,406,000 a year before. Net income in the nine months ended Sept. 30 rose to $25,424,000, or $1.73 a share, from the yearearlier $23,180,000, or $1.58 a share.

title: AMRAM CONDUCTS FOLKMUSIC TOUR
description: David Amram presented an unusually representative crosssection of American folk music on Monday evening in the first of three fortnightly lectureconcerts on various aspects of American music, held in the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Financial Follies
description: The New York Financial Writers Association will present its annual Financial Follies, a spoof of the year's activities in business, finance and Government, on Nov. 19. The show, which follows a formal dinner, will be held at the Americana Hotel, Seventh Avenue and 52d Street.

title: Peking Says U.S. Inspires Taiwan Independence Drive
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 19Communist China today denounced a recent upsurge in agitation by Taiwanese nationalists and charged Japanese and American reactionaries with responsibility for the increased activities.

title: PHILIP R. GREER
description: Philip R. Greer, a former assistant supervisor in the composing room of The New York Times, died Sunday at his home in Metuchen, N. J. He was 58 years old.

title: Denis Crimmins, Official Of Electrical Board, 80
description: Denis Crimmins, former secretarytreasurer of the Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry, died last Saturday at Staten Island Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 533 Beach 136th Street, Belle Harbor, Queens.

title: NET CASHINS SET WORD FOR FUNDS
description: The mutual fund industry reported record net redemptions of $166.42million during September as investors cut back purchases of new shares by 29.6 per cent. At the seine time, investors stepped up redemptions of old shares by 19.5 per cent.

title: Senate Panel Sets A 14Year Deadline On Water Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP)  Legislation changing the course of the Federal effort against water pollution by setting a 14year deadline for industrial polluters was approved today by the Senate Public Works Committee.

title: U.S. AIDE IS OUSTED BY PRAGUE AS A SPY
description: VIENNA, Oct. 19  Samuel G. Wise, first secretary of the United States Embassy in Prague, was asked today to leave Czechoslovakia within 48 hours, the official Czechoslovak press agency reported.

title: Quarter Profit a High
description: The Xerox Corporation earned record profits in the quarter and nine months ended Sept. 30, the company reported yesterday from its Stamford, Conn., headquarters.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Evidently, Jimmy Breslin didn't do his homework when he attended the St. Benedict Joseph Labre School in Queens. In 'The Greatest Article Read in My Whole Life [OpEd Oct. 91, he wrote that Jesus last words on earth were, This day you will be with Me in Paradise.

title: 2 Centuries of Fashion as an Art Form
description: The doors of the Costume Institute of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, closed for the last four years, will reopen Friday with a tastefully in stalled exhibit of fashions of the last 200 years. That's the time period covered by the 30 costumes mounted with elegant simplicity in the institute's 10 exhibition rooms, but it's not the point of the show at all.

title: See Here, Mr. Drury
description: Not long ago Allen Drury was given space in these columns to comment, from a conservative or at any rate moderate standpoint, on the statement of twelve conservatives who in July announced their suspension of further support for President Nixon. As one of the twelve, I welcome this opportunity to reply.

title: Agnew Arrives In Crete
description: HERAKLEION, Crete, Oct. 19 (UPI)  Vice President Agnew was welcomed to Crete tonight by Governor General George Georgalas.

title: He Hopes to Win Illinois Race in a Walk
description: ROCKFORD, III., Oct. 19The tall, lean man striding along Route 51 between South Beloit and Rockford yesterday looked like a farmer, with his weathered face, khaki trousers, denim workshirt and red bandana around his neck.

title: Mayor Urges a Higher Borrowing Limit
description: Fifty schools, six police precinct stations, 16 libraries and a variety of other projects that the city plans to build this year are in danger of being hatted, Mayor Lindsay said yesterday.

title: Lakers Trounce Braves
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 19 (AP)Gail Goodrich poured in 24 points, leading a balanced Los Angeles attack, as the Lakers beat the Buffalo Braves, 123106, tonight.

title: LESLIE ERNEST LATHAM
description: MADISON, Conn., Oct. 19Leslie Ernest Latham, retired president of the E. B. Latham Company, New York City, wholesale electrical distributors, died yesterday at Clinton Convalescent Center after a long illness. His age was 77.

title: CLAUSEN FAVORS FLOATING PRIME
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 19The chief executive of the nation's largest bank said here today that this is the best economic time for the banking industry to break with past practices and adopt a floating prime rate that would move automatically with interest rates in the open market.

title: BIG BOARD STOCKS BATTERED AGAIN
description: The stock market was battered again yesterday, but technical rally and short covering in the final half hour reduced losses.

title: 453d Cosmos in Orbit
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 19 (UPI)The Soviet Union put the 453d satellite in its Cosmos series into earth orbit today, the news agency Tass said. Tass said the satellite was orbiting the earth once every 92 minutes at a maximum distance of 313 miles and a minimum distance of 158 miles.

title: NADER, IN SUIT, ASKS WHITE HOUSE DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 Ralph Nader and the Center for Auto Safety are seeking court order requiring the Department of Transportation to disclose the substance of communications with the White House on a pending automobile safety standard.

title: PHILBIN'S RETURN TO BE A SLOW ONE
description: The injured Gerry Philbin was stretched out on his back on a training table yesterday at Shea Stadium. His hands were tucked under his head. His ankles rested on a couple of leather pillows and his left knee was wrapped in hot towels.

title: Advertising:
description: Take a package goods man, give him a stint at an ad agency,; return him to package goods, then move him over to an airline in sales and finally plop him into a leaderphip role in a steamship company and what have you got? Why you've got a fellow who's going to come up with.,a net., idea or two about marketing a cruise.

title: Health Aide Takes Oath
description: Mayor Lindsay swore in Jose A. Cabranes yesterday as a director of the Health and Hospital Corporation in a City Hall ceremony. Mr. Cabranes, a 30yearold lawyer, becomes the youngest person on the 16member board, which sets policy for the corporation, the publicbenefit agency that manages the city's 18 hospitals. Mr. Cabranes, a native of Puerto Rico, fills the vacancy created by the resignation of Representative Herman Badillo .

title: Nursing Home Blaze Kills All 15 Patients
description: HONESDALE, Pa., Oct. 19All of the 15 elderly residents of a nursing home here perished tonight in a flash fire that the police attributed to a gas explosion.

title: Census Table of Racial Trends
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The following table shows the number of persons who stated their race for the United States census as white, Negro, American Indian, Japanese, Chinese, Filipino or a category grouped as other in 1960 and 1970; the percentage growth for each group and the percentage of each group that lived in the West in 1970.

title: Speedy Court Ruling Asked On Party Cost Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19, (AP) Common Cause asked the Federal District Court here today for a speedy ruling against what it said were admitted campaign contributions and spending violations by the major political parties.

title: Splitting of Blocs
description: The drive of the Nixon Administration to swing the United States balance of payments from deficit to surplus is running into a serious obstaclerising unemployment in Europe and Japan. Although the slump abroad had begun before President Nixon's Aug. 15 actions in floating the dollar and imposing the 10 per cent import tax, the American trade and monetary moves are comMg under heavy fire for aggravating what many businessmen and Government officials abroad now fear may become a major recession.

title: DR. FREDERICK BROPHY
description: PELHAM, N. Y., Oct. 19 Dr. Frederick Harold Brophy, dentist, died today at New Rochelle Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at 258 Corona Avenue. Dr. Brophy had maintained active practice until recently at 580 Fifth Avenue in New York.

title: SOVIET PROTESTS ON PRESS REPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Soviet Union has protested vigorously to the United States over recent reports in the American press of espionage activities by Soviet citizens attached to the United Nations.

title: Chrysler Increases Prices Of Its ForeignBuilt Cars
description: DETROIT, Oct. 19 (AP)The Chrysler Corporation announced today that it had increased the price of its foreignbuilt Dodge Colt and Plymouth Cricket to reflect the new import surcharge.

title: Compliance Is Spotty Here
description: Compliance with the ceiling price regulation is spotty among merchants in the metropolitan area, a survey by The New York Times indicates.

title: Manufacturing Use Of Capacity Drops
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (Reuters) Capacity utilization in the manufacturing industries dropped to 73.2 per cent of its potential in the third quarter from 75.1 per cent in the second quarter, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Puzzling Diplomacy
description: The Nixon Administration's diplomacy on the China question at the United Nations is a puzzle. At the very moment when Henry Kissinger is arriving in Peking to help normalize Washington's relations with the People's Republic of China, U.S. Ambassador Bush is lobbying and arguing for votes to keep Nationalist China in the U.N. as if he were the Texas state chairman at the Republican National Convention,

title: C.A,B, PLEA TO SET FARES IS OPPOSED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 The Nixon Administration today strongly opposed a Civil Aeronautics Board request for Congressional authority to permit the agency to prescribe air fares on international routes.

title: Brooklyn Judge Accused Of Beame Campaign Fraud
description: A Federal indictment yesterday charged Civil Court Judge Bernard Klieger of Brooklyn with a fraudulent scheme to pay for political expenses of the 1965 mayoral campaign of Controller Abraham D. Beame.

title: LUTZ, RIESSEN WIN IN SPANISH TENNIS
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Oct. 19 (AP)Sob Lutz of Los Angeles defeated Tom Leonard of Arcadia, Calif., 64, 62, in the second round of the Spanish open tennis tournament today.

title: ARGENTINE PESO DIPS TO ITS RECORD LOW
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 19The peso fell to its record loW of 8.25 to the dollar on the official exchange market today, reflecting widespread concern about Argentina's economy.

title: BAIL IS CUT FOR 3 HELD WITH BROWN
description: A Criminal Court judge yesterday reduced bail from $150,000 to $100,000 for three men allegedly involved in a holdup at a West Side bar with H. Rap Brown, the black militant.

title: Screen Actors Guild in Bitter Election
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 19 Hollywood,. stirred by bitter public squabbling among some of its better known actors, is awaiting the, outcome of the first contested election in the 38year history of the Screen Actors Guild.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The idea is so intriguing that theorists can't resist toying with it and even the realists have stopped giving it summary brushoff. They give cautious examination instead and virtually all are guided by that slightly less than noble principle: How does it affect me? But this is something that has been motivating mankind from the beginning and most folks assume baseball people are part of mankind.

title: MRS. JOE M'CARTHY
description: NORTH TONAWANDA, N.Y., Oct. 19  Mrs. Elizabeth McCarthy, the wife of Joe McCarthy, who managed the New York Yankees to seven World Series victories, died last evening at the McCarthy home in the town of Amherst. She was 84 years old.

title: Case in Harrisburg, Pa.
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 19 (AP) In a similar case, :a threejudge Federal panel ruled last November that a Moose lodge in Harrisburg, Pa., was not entitled to a state liquor license as a result of its racially restrictive membership rules.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Top spokesmen of the Nixon Administration have emphasized recently an allegedly low rate of corporate profits and the need for greater profits if we are to have a prosperous economy.

title: Nondesigner Given Design Award
description: A sixpound cube of solid sterling silver representing Tiffany & Co.'s Design Award was presented yesterday to a nondesigning industrialist whose company makes diesel engines.

title: Rodney's Prize Favored at 31 In Sire Stake Trot at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, Oct. 19Most of the evidence points against Rodney's Prize winning the $46,678.35 New York Sire Stake for 2yearold trotting fillies tomorrow night at Yonkers Raceway even though the Speedy RodneyVictory prize juvenile has captured more races (10 of 13) and earned more money ($49,641) than any of the other 12 starters who will be going one mile.

title: Black Leader Elected By Disciples of Christ
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Oct. 19 (AP)The Christian Church (Disciples of Christ), founded in Kentucky 170 years ago in slavery times, elected a black minister today as Moderator.

title: CHAPOT CAPTURES PUISSANCE EVENT
description: HARRISBURG, Fa. Oct. 19Frank Chapot of Walfpack, N. J., aboard his seasoned campaigner, San Lucas, enabled the United States to jump back into the blue ribbons tonight by winning the international puissance at the Pennsylvania National horse show tonight.

title: JUDGE SAYS INDIANS LOST FISHING RIGHTS
description: SAULT STE. MARIE, Mich., Oct. 19A. B. LeBlanc, a Chippewa Indian who is a commercial fisherman, lost the first round today in an effort by Michigan Indians to test what they contend are commercial fishing rights given them by treaty.

title: FRAUD CASE OPENS IN U.S. COURT HERE
description: Ten men charged with conspiring in an overthecounter stock fraud scheme that, according to Government lawers, resulted in the swindling of more than $1million from banks and brokerage houses went on trial here yesterday in the Federal courtroom of Judge Morris E. Lasker.

title: The Black Flag Incident Stirs Trackside Debate
description: MONTEREY, Calif., Oct. 19A black flag and a checkered flag caused some redfaced embarrasment Sunday in the Sports Car Club of America. The finish of Sunday's CanAm race on the Laguna Seca road course raised an interesting question about who can safely ignore the black flag, the signal that orders a driver into the pit for inspection of a dangerous condi tion. Then there was the flag marshal at the startfinish line who gave the checkered victory flag to the runnerup. And as if all this was not awkward enough, the race ran 91 laps instead of, the scheduled 90and no one could explain why.

title: List of Grievances Planned
description: LUXEMBOURG, Oct. 19The Common Market closed ranks today against reported American moves during the weekend to split West Germany from its partners by offering a bilateral arrangement under which German goods would be exempted from the 10 per cent surcharge.

title: FISCHER IS VICTOR 2D STRAIGHT TINE
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 19Bobby Fischer of the United States scored his second victory in succession today when he outplayed. Tigran Petrosian ofthe Soviet Union in the seventh game of their match in the San Martin Theater.

title: Jury Rules Watson Sane
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 19 (UPI)  The jury that convicted Charles D. Watson of the seven Sharon Tate murders decided today that he was legally sane at the time of the killings. The verdict in the sanity phase of the trial cleared the way for he final stage of the casea penalty trial to determine whether Watson will be sentenced to death in the gas chamber or life in prison.

title: Denmark Moved Quickly on Surtax
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Oct. 19  Denmark's Social Democratic Government, on its first day in office, moved today to impose a 10 per cent import surcharge on twothirds of this country's imports.

title: Senate Democrats Delay Welfare Reform Till 1972
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 19 The Senate Democratic. Policy Committee agreed today to postpone action this year on welfare reform and women's rights but said they would be acted upon early next. year.

title: Discovered Raphael: Some Here Sold It
description: A newly authenticated portrait by Raphael passed through the hands of six owners in the nine years it has been in this country before being recognized as a Renaissance treasure worth millions of dollars.

title: Two Koreas Moving Haltingly to End Long Impasse
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 15 Reluctantly, constantly cautioning their people against bad faith on the other side and voicing pessimism about the outcome, South Korea and North Korea have taken the first halting steps toward recognizing each. other as neighbors, even if not as governments with a right to exist.

title: Gen. Knowlton Nominated
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP) Maj. Gen. William A. Knowlton, Superintendent of the United States Military Academy at West Point, N. Y., has been nominated for promotion to lieutenant general, the Pentagon announced today.

title: Theater: A Celebration of Beerbohm
description: No one with the name Max has ever. actually been unpopularit is one of those, namesbut everyone agrees that the late Victorian Max Beerbohm was incomparable. As a critic, to be fair, he was inferior to his predecessor on The Saturday Review, G. B. Shaw, yet he was an essayist and short story writer of urbane felicity. And even as a critic he wore his rue with a difference and he mixed acid so sweetly with compassion that his gentle ironies still read very well.

title: Soviet Seeks to Buy Estate in Virginia Next to Mt. Vernon
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Soviet Embassy here has applied to the State Department for permission to purchase 28 acres of land adjoining Mount Vernon in Virginia.

title: Greek Town Welcomes Agnew
description: GARGALIANOL Greece, Oct. 19Spiro T. Agnew returned to the home of his forefathers today. With flags flying, school bands and dancing in the streets, the villagers came from miles around to greet their kinsman who has made good in the United States.

title: Orioles Rehire Weaver As Manager for 1972
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 19 (AP) Earl Weaver, the Baltimore Oriole manager who was bypassed this week for American League manageroftheyear honors, signed his 1972 contract today.

title: Attack Termed Holliganism
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 19The Soviet press, in a delayed and brief report on the attack yesterday on Premier Kosygin in Canada, called it a provocation and an act of hooligansim.

title: VALDES STOPS FOE IN OPENING ROUND,
description: In a startling reversal of what began as a yawning evening of fights last night at the Felt Forum, Rodrigo Valdes of Colombia stopped Perry (L'il) Abner of Philadelphia in the first round of a scheduled 10rounder.

title: S.E.C. Is Urged to Block Proposals of Big Board
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19  The heads of the nation's largest mutual fund complex and of one of the largest third market brokerage firms asked the Securities and Exchange Commission today to block what they charged were the attempts by the New York Stock Exchange to become a nationwide monopoly.

title: MAYOR ASKS RUE ON FREE LUNCHES
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that he had asked the city's Boar of Ethics for a ruling on whether free lunches or other favors involving city officials might violate the city's Code of Ethics.

title: Martket Place :can't S.E.C. Ask? Real Warnings?
description: EVANSTON, III., Oct. 19You're an investor and you're reading the red herring filed by a company that makes, say, snowmobiles. It's ready to offer shares to the public for the first time after five years in business, during which it has been going like, well, like a snowmobile in high gear.

title: Philadelphia Dockers Go Back, Then Start Leaving
description: Philadelphia longshoremen returned to work yesterday under a court order, but began leaving the docks after an hour or so with the complaint that gangs were shorthanded and that there were no checkers to tally cargo.

title: 3 Choreographers Offer Varied Fare On Cubiculo Stage
description: Human entanglements and workaday tasks were the subjects of the concert given Monday evening at the Cubiculo by Jan Van Dyke, Mel Wong and Kenneth Rinker, choreographers.

title: Executive Changes
description: Vornado, Inc., announced yesterday that Solomon Rogoff had been elected president and a director of the discount stores and supermarket chain, Frederick Zissu, Chairman and chief executive officer, has been the interim president following the death of Mrray J. Siegel. Mr. Rogoff, 50 years old, was previ ??usly administrative vice president. The company with stores coast to coast had sales of neatly $800million last year. In other changes, Horace R. Zimmerman, 50, was ad vanced to senior vice president and general manager Alvin C. Martin, 38, Vornado's secretary,. and tax counsel, was elevated to senior, vice president and assistant to the chairman. Donald B. Gomes, was advanced to the position of president of the company's Western division. Mr. Gomes, 49, is an executive vice president.

title: Two Nixon Aides Promoted
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP) Two members of the White House Domestic Council staff, Lewis A. Engman and John F. Evans Jr., were promoted to assistant directors of the council today by President Nixon.

title: Advertising:
description: Reynolds Metals will move its Reyn, olds Wrap, which it promoted with some $6.5million in advertising last year, from Lennen & Newell to J. Walter Thompson on Dec. 31.

title: Film Fete Reports Its Greatest Success And Reduced Deficit
description: The New York Film Festival, which ended a 16day run at the Vivian Beaninont Theater in Lincoln center on Saturday, was the most, successful since its inception 1963, according to Officials Of the Film Society of Lincoln Center.

title: Blacks Give Funds to White Strikers in Mississippi
description: LAUREL, Miss., Oct. 19Striking white pulpwood cutters from what was once regarded as Klan country queued up today to receive emergency relief funds from the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.

title: Books of The Times
description: SomebodyI forgot who said that James Thurber's drawings captured the improbability of animals. It seems to me that Gilbert Rogin does as much for people in What Happens Next? He is always catching them in moments of ambiguous epiphany. Watching his wife try on, one after another, her extensIve collection of sunglasses, Julian Singer wonders: Is she saying recognize me, save me, catch me? Is this the high point of their marriage? Holding his stepdaughter's bite plate in his hand  she has run away from home without it  he muses that it looks like those landscapes in the background of Renaissance paintings, where, being released from the ventions governing the treatment of the figures in the foreground, (the Old Masters) gave full rein to their imagination or their despair or their yearning. Happening to catch his stepson's eye, Singer finds him steadfastly returning his gaze. He is acknowledging our secret, Singer thinks. He knows that we will never get together, that as we grow older we will grow farther apart.

title: Sclerosis Group Cites Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP) The National Multiple Sclerosis Society honored President Nixon today for his concern and commitment to voluntaryism.

title: Mills and Richardson Disagree As Medical Care Hearings Open
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 The House Ways and Means Committee opened today its longawaited hearings into national health insurance with its chairman, Representative Wilbur D. Mills, criticizing the Nixon Administration's proposals for coverage.

title: RALLIES ON VIETNAM PLANNED IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 Details of prowar and antiwar demonstrations next week in Washington were announced by two groups here today.

title: MIDEAST ACTIONS URGED BY JACKSON
description: Senator Henry M. Jackson urged President Nixon last night to call on the Soviet Union to withdraw its military forces from Egypt and other Arab countries.

title: Police Corruption
description: The Knapp Commission investigating police corruption in New York City has added a new phrase to the public lexicon: On the pad. It refers to lists of policemen paid to Ignore illegal activities. As the Commission begins two weeks of public hearings, it has also underscored an old truth: The public plays a role in setting public policies, even those unofficial policies follOwed by policemen on the pad.

title: A.T.&T. IS PLANNING RISE IN JOBS HERE
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company announced plans yesterday for moving as many as 3,000 employes from the city to New Jersey over the next 10 years. But, at the same time, total employment here would rise from 75,000 to 100,000.

title: Mrs. Bower's 76 for 154 Wins Wheeler Cup 3d Time
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Oct, 19Mrs. Albert B. BGwer Pelham Country Club won the women's open golf championship of Fairfield and Westchester Counties for the third time today.

title: Earnings Are Reported By Braniff and National
description: Two of the nation's smaller trunk airlines reported yesterday profits for the September quarter in contrast to deficit operations in the comparable period last year.

title: Jersey Dedicating 2 Colleges in 2 Days
description: POMONA, N. J., Oct. 19As welders and carpenters worked in the background, one of New Jersey's two new fouryear colleges was dedicated here today by Gov. William T. Cahill.

title: White House Submits Plan For Controls After Freeze
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19  The Nixon Administration delivered to Congress today proposed legislation that would provide it with the power and machinery to continue economic controls during Phase Two of its antiinflation program.

title: AQUEDUCT EXACTA PAYS ONLY $7.80
description: Those horseplayers who went out to Aqueduct to see the beautiful fall colors yesterday may have observed a notable lack of greenas in moneyin the sixthrace exacta.

title: Paris Fights Pollution With Vacuum Cleaner Spires
description: PARIS, Oct. 19  Two towers were set up today in a grimy Gare de Lyons area of eastern Paris and one schoolboy was overheard asking: Are they for launching rockets to the moon?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Recent remarks attributed to Human Resources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman create the impression he doesn't consider the attempt by the 1971 Legislature to tighten New York State's welfare system worth the effort. In fact, he appears to relish the possibilityremote as it now isthat the program will fail.

title: Text of Murphy Statement on Seedman
description: Following is the text of a statement by Police Commissioner Poatrick V. Murphy in which he announced the reinstatement of Albert. A. Seedman as chief of detectives and the establishment of an ethics board.

title: C. Joseph Delaney, Surgeon, Professor at N.Y. Medical
description: Dr. C. Joseph Delaney, clinical professor of surgery at New York Medical College, died yesterday at Doctors Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street. His office was at 119 East 60th Street.

title: SCOTT'S 47 SAVES SQUIRES VICTORY
description: MIAMI, Oct. 20 (AP)Charlie Scott's 47 points enabled the Virginia Squires to hold off repeated, late rallies for a 111108 victory over the Floridians tonight in an American Basketball Association game.

title: FOREMAN TO BOX PIRES AT GARDEN
description: George Foreman, unbeaten in 31 bouts, will meet Luis Fires of Brazil in a 10round heavyweight match at Madison Square Garden a week from tomorrow.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Suit Charges California Discriminates
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Oct. 20 (UPI)The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People accused California in a suit today of widespread racial discrimination, from Gov. Ronald Reagan down.

title: OBSERVER; Soft? Warm? Shame!
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20Every now and then you catch yourself thinking it might not be so bad being President of the United States, and then you pick up a paper and read about the cold, hard logic.

title: Angels Dismiss Walsh As General Manager
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Oct. 20 (AP)The California Angels dismissed their general manager, Dick Walsh, tonight.

title: Penguins Rout Kings, 81
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 20 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Penguins scored three goals within sevenminute stretch of the first period and got four more in the final period tonight to crush the Los Angeles Kings, 81. The victory extended the Penguins National Hockey League winning streak to four games.

title: Rangers Triumph, 31, To End Hawk Streak
description: With the buzzer sounding and the fans cheering a 31 Ranger victory last night, Bobby Hull stood with the puck, vainly attempting. to get off one last blast.

title: GOLDWATER CALLS U.S. AUTOS SHODDY
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 20 (UPI)Senator Barry Goldwater said today that foreign cars were selling well in the United States because they were far superior to Americanmade cars.

title: FuelOil Prices Cut a Fraction for Apartments and Homes in City
description: The price of lowsulphur No. 6 oil, used to heat most of the city's apartments and homes, dropped in the New York market yesterday.

title: O'BRIEN SAYS F.C.C. IS FAVORING NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20The Democratic party accused the Federal Communications Commission today of delay, obstruction and political partisanship that protects President Nixon against legitimate response to his controversial statements on television.

title: Shaking Up Wall Street
description: It has taken years of strain, culminating in the almost complete breakdown two years ago, to stimulate interest in reform of Wall Street. Now the movement appears in full swing. Congress and the Securities and Exchange Commission, both currently holding separate and frequently simultaneous hearings, are on the bandwagon of reform. So is the New York Stock Exchange. Its notions  and those of William McChesney Martin, at whose behest the Exchange's report on restructuring of the market place was preparedhave a hoary, air about them.

title: Vatican Unit Indicts Monetary System
description: ROME, Oct. 20A Vatican commission asserted today that the international monetary system was fundamentally unjust because it permitted a few rich nations to make decisions affecting the welfare of the entire world.

title: Builder of Bridges for Peace Willy Brandt
description: BONN, Oct. 20We have a special responsibility, Willy Brandt said a few weeks ago in explaining his peace policy.

title: State Panel Asks Curb on Up and Down Pills
description: Proposals for a crackdown on the distribution, use and sale of ups and down's amphetamines and barbiturateswere disclosed yesterdayat a hearing held here by the Temporary State Coinmission to Evaluate Drugs.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 20 (UPI)Wilt Chamberlain scored 13 of the Los Angeles Lakers last 15 points tonight to lead the Lakers to a 126104 victory over the Atlanta Hawks in National Basketball Association game.

title: 750 See Rockets Bow
description: WACO, Tex., Oct. 20 (AP)The Chicago Bulls defeated the Houston Rockets 125110, before 750 tonight in the first professional basketball game ever played here. It was the Rockets' fourth loss in a row.

title: Open Tax Hearings Barred In Copper Company Cases
description: WASHINGTON, Oot. 20 (UPI)  The Treasury. Department said today that it would not order public hearings on a request by two United States copper companies for advice on the tax treatment of assets expropriated by the. Government of Chile.

title: Sabres Down Leafs, 72
description: TORONTO, Oct. 20 (UPI)Eddie Shack, a wing, scored two goals and the Sabres newly appointed captain, Gerry Meehan, got a goal and two assists tonight to lead Buffalo to a 72 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: Chess: In 5th Game at Buenos Aires Ancient Strategies Employed
description: Bobby Fischer is off on another streak. The American star, who posted his 20th straight victory in the opener of his present 12 game series against Tigran Petrosian of the Soviet Union has gone unbeaten after dropping the second contest. Fischer played three straight draws with the Soviet ace, then defeated Petrosian, a former world champion, in the last two games at Buenos Aires.

title: Estimate for Sewage Plant Doublesto $752Million
description: The vast sewagereatment plant that the city wants to build on Hariees Hudson River shore will cost $751.9million  twice as much as last year's estimated cost  the City Planning Commission was told yesterday.

title: Mitchell Tells of Action Against 170 Officeholders in Crime Drive
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 20 Attorney General John N. Mitchell disclosed today that more than 170 state and local public officeholders or former officials had been indicted or convicted in the last 32 months in the Department of Justice's efforts against organized crime and its handmaiden, official corruption.

title: Moral Victory for Mansfield
description: The White House succeeded in scoring a technical victory but suffered a moral defeat in the House this week by blocking a direct vote on the Mansfield amendment to the military procurement bill, which calls for withdrawal of American forces from Indochina within six months if the Communists free American prisoners of war.

title: TV News: Backstage at C. B. S.
description: On one level, it is a dazzling manipulation of electronic gadgetry. On another, it's all done with mirrors. That's the way it is, in part, behind the scenes of the Columbia Broadcasting System's Evening News With Walter Cronkite. Neither the defenders nor the cittractors of broadcast jounalism would be disappointed.

title: ROLLBACK ASKED IN RENT SECURITY
description: The Internal Revenue Service has ordered a midManhattan apartment house complex to rescind increases in the security on new leases after receiving some 40 complaints from tenants, an I.R.S. spokesman disclosed yesterday.

title: Doubts Voiced in Britain As Nader Airs His Views
description: OXFORD, England, Oct. 20 Ralph Nader has been spreading his consumer gospel around France and Britain this week. But in this country, at least, there are doubts whether he will be as successful as in the United States.

title: Jersey Clam House To Fight Opening Of Bar to Women
description: NEWARK, Oct. 20  We're not going down the drain like McSorley's.

title: MOBIL EARNINGS RISE IN QUARTER
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation, the first of the major international oil concerns to announce figures for the third quarter and first nine months of 1971, reported yesterday higher sales and earnings for both periods.

title: U.S. Will Study Charges of Mistreatment at Attica
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today that the Justice Department's Civil Rights Division would make an appropriate investigation of alleged mistreatment of prisoners at the Attica Correctional Facility in New York State last month.

title: 5 Hurl Gasoline Bombs Into Japan's Parliament
description: TOKYO, Thursday, Oct. 21 ReutersFive men tossed gasoline bombs into the Japanese Diet (parliament) building today but first reports said no one was injured. injured.

title: Barney Won't Play Sunday
description: DETROIT, Oct. 20 (AP) The Detroit Lions said today that Lem Barney, cornerback, would miss Sunday'S game with the Chicago Bears because of a severe muscle pull in the groin.

title: Monetary Order Asked
description: LONDON, Oct. 20Mr. Sarnoff urged the European Economic Community today to initiate a round of talks to liberalize world trade.

title: GOVERNOR, MAYOR AT SMITH DINNER
description: Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay, who nave often been at odds in recent months, shared the dais last night at the annual Alfred E. Smith dinner.

title: NORTHEAST ASSURED ON FUEL OIL SUPPLY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20The Federal Government today assured householders and other users of fuel oil in Northeastern states that supplies would be adequate during the coming heating season.

title: Allen Rites on Saturday
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Oct. 20 (UPI)A memorial service for Dr. and Mrs. James E. Allen Jr. will be held at the First Presbyterian Church in Albany at noon on Saturday. Dr. Allen, a former United States Education Commissioner, New York State Education Commission and a professor at Princeton University, and his wife died in an Arizona plane crash Saturday night.

title: Giants Get Brewers MorriS
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 20 (AP)The Milwaukee Brewers traded today a lefthanded pitcher, John Morris, to the San Francisco Giants for two young minor league hurlers.

title: Iraq Said to Sentence Officer To Death in Espionage Case
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 20 An Iraqi Air Force officer has been reported sentenced to death by a court in Baghdad that found him guilty of spying for the British.

title: New Sales to Soviet For Truck Factory Licensed by the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20The Department of, Commerce has approved export licenses authorizing American companies to sell more than $280million worth of foundry equipment to the Soviet Union for a truck plant.

title: RON TAYLOR SOLD BY METS TO EXPOS
description: The Mets didn't have two relief pitchers named Taylor for long.

title: Notes on People
description: Having been refused admission to, the White. House after he had been invited there, Representative Wayne L. Hays of Ohio now says he will not attend a dinner there late this month that President Nixon is giving for President Tito of Yugoslavia.

title: Ban on Cigarette Ads Upheld by U.S. Court
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (AP) A threejudge Federal panel has upheld the constitutionality of the Congressional ban on cigarette advertising on television and radio.

title: U.S. BILL ON ULSTER ASKS TROOP PULLOUT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (UPI)  Senators Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, and Abraham A. Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, introduced a resolution today urging President Nixon to seek an end to violence in Northern Ireland and withdrawal of all British troops there. The resolution was disavowed by the State Department.

title: General's Wife Awaits War's End, Too
description: BANGKOK, Thailand (UPI) Mrs. Creighton W. Abrams, wife of the United States commander in Vietnam, lives like thousands of other wives whose husbands are serving in Indochina. She remains quietly in Thailand, engages in voluntary work and waits for the war to end.

title: Mrs. Abzug Forces RollCall
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (AP) Representative Bella S. Abzug forced a rollcall vote on a routine military construction bill today and said she would make the same demand on every military measure until House leaders permit a vote on the Indochina war. The bill today, a compromise $2billion authorization for this year's military construction projects around the world, would norally have been passed routinely by voice vote.

title: RUSSIAN DERIDES U.S PLAN ON CHINA
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 20The Soviet Union charged today that the American proposal to admit Communist China to the United Nations and to prevent the expulsion of Nationalist China was an unsavory policy intended to Sever Taiwan from the People's Republic of China.

title: F.T.C. HEARS PLEA ON AD REGULATION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 The Federal Trade Commission, opened a omprehensive exploration of modern advertising practices today, with industry witnesses advocating a proper melding of selfregulation and Government regulation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Army's double standards flew in full color once more in The Times news story of waiting wives, Oct. 4, when Ralph Blumenthal wrote that wives and children of West Point men in Vietnam get family housing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I certainly respect Mary L. Manning's right to have her religion with her at all times, rather than just filing it away for use on Sundays [letter Oct. 1]. Presumably this means that she wants to be free to say a prayer whenever and wherever the spirit moves her. Prescribing a fiveminute interval for prayer at 9 A.M. would not seem to satisfy this urge. Surely she doesn't file her religion away some place and only take it out at 9 A.M. and dust off, to paraphrase her? Suppose she felt the urge to pray at 11:37 A.M.?

title: STRATEGY MAPPED BY BIG SIX MAYORS
description: The state's Big Six Mayors outlined a 1972 lobbying strategy yesterday that stresses is sues on which they hope both cities and suburbs can find common ground.

title: Dr. Leonard M. Monheim Dead; Author, Lecturer and Educator
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 20Dr. Leonard M. Monheim, president of the medical staff of PresbyterianUniversity Hospital for the last two years, died at the hospital on Monday. He was 60 years old.

title: Offtrack Unit to Take Bets On Monday's International
description: Over the objections of track officials, the Washington D.C. International at Laurel racecourse was added to the specialevent calendar of the Offtrack Betting Corporation yesterday.

title: Police Official Accused Of Misconduct in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Oct. 20 (AP)Mortimer Nappen, chief of Atlantic County detectives, was indicted by a state grand jury today on charges of threatening a jockey with false arrest to get him to repay a loan.

title: Two OutofState Residents Win $100,000 Lottery Here
description: Residents of Indiana and Pennsylvania were winners yesterday in the state's $100,000 lottery drawing, held at the Port Authority Bus Terminal in midtown.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The following are some helpful suggestions for sportsmen from one who has been labeled a middleaged Huckleberry Finn by his wife.

title: Houpt's Secpnd Hat Is in a Show Ring
description: As a teacher, one has to organize and to exercise patience, said Dr. William S. Houpt, vice president of Allan Hancock College in Santa Maria, Calif. They are both good qualities for a dogshow judge and certainly have helped me when I'm working in the ring. Houpt has judged from coast to coast and is in great demand. At Westchester, he drew 104 Af ghans, which oldtimers said was the largest nonspecialty entry for the breed in the East. At Beverly Hills, Calif., he ruled on 99 Afghans.

title: By Lyndon Johnson: Intensifying Campaign for Equal Rights
description: WHEN I was in the Senate, we had an extra car to take back to Texas at the close of each Congressional session. Usually my Negro employesZephyr Wright, our cook, Helen Williams, out maid, and Helen's husband, Gene  drove the car to the ranch for us. At that time, nearly 20 years ago, it was an ordeal to get an automobile from Washington to Texasthree full days of hard driving.

title: Lone Policeman Pickets Joe McCarthy Inquiry
description: A lone picket outside the Headquarters of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York protested the Knapp Commission hearings yesterday with a sign readIng: Knapp Commission is a Witch Hunt, Joe McCarthy is Alive and Well, Now They Call Him Knapp.

title: Polo Twin Bill Set Tonight
description: DARIEN, Conn., Oct. 20The Fairfield County Hunt Club of Westport, Conn., the defending champion, will meet Huntington (L.I.) and Monroe (Conn.) will face the Ox Ridge Hunt Club in the semifinal round of the George C. Sherman Memorial fivegoal indoor polo tournament tomorrow night. The doubleheader will be played at Ox Ridge.

title: Tropical Storm Develops
description: MIAMI, Oct. 20 (UPI)Tropical storm Kristy was horn in the central Atlantic today, but forecasters said the disturbance, with 55mileanhour winds, would hit a cold front and probably die sometime tomorrow.

title: KNAPP UNIT HEARS OF POLICE BRIBES OF UP TO $1,500
description: The Knapp Commission heard testimony yesterday that as recently as two weeks ago plainclothes policemen in various parts of the city were receiving bribes ranging from $400 to $1,500 a month.

title: World Broadcast Group Installs Pearson as Head
description: Lester B. Pearson, former Prime Minister of Canada, has been installed as chairman of the International Broadcast Institute, the private group committed to improvement in global communications. He formally assumed the post on Tuesday night at a meeting at the Century Club, 7 West 43d Street.

title: A Look at Fabrics in Mrs. Onassis's Penthouse
description: Exotic African fabricsprimitive prints of feathers and fishhave found a home in the New York apartment of Mrs. Aristotle S. Onassis among the fine French 18th century furniture, the choice Sevres porcelains, the rare needlepoint rugs and a foldup, leathercovered elephant's ladder.

title: U.S. Angels Fly to Opening of New Musical in London
description: LONDON, Oct. 20Shortly before 7 last night, Sidney Goldberg stepped toward Row D, Seat 11 at Her Majesty's Theater in downtown London. It's a long way to come for an opening night, said Mr. Goldberg, a businessman from Fresh Meadows, Queens.

title: Mississippi Is Enjoined On Jackson School Plan
