title: Task of the Controllers
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22The players are now in place and the machinery is set to function, but some tense and tough bargaining with big labor must occur before the second phase of. President Nixon's antiinflation drive can really begin. Only three weeks remain before the 90day freeze on wages and prices expires, to be replaced by a more flexible and therefore much more complicated pro gram of restraints. The President had hoped to appoint the regulators two weeks ago, but they were not easily recruited and now face a rush to get organized.

title: CASPER, WITH 132 LEADS BY 3 SHOTS IN GOLF ON COAST
description: NAPA, Calif., Oct. 22 (AP)Billy Casper, gunning for his first tournament victory of the season, carded a sevenunderpar 65 today and look a threeshot lead in the second round of the $150,000 Kaiser International Open golf tournament.

title: Rauschenberg Turning to Cardboards
description: Those who like to think of Robert Rauschenberg as the enfant terrible of art may have to think of him as the enfant docile after seeing his current twopart exhibition at the Castelli Galleries, 420 West Broadway and 4 East 77th Strret. The exhibition represents one of the tamest, most sedate efforts that Mr. Rauschenburg has produced since he acquired his reputation as neoDadaist and protoPopist, the artist, who, along with Jasper Johns, offered American art a way out of abstract expression

title: BARRINGER HIGH RESUMES CLASSES
description: NEWARK, Oct. 22  Barringer High School reopened today under increased security as the Essex County Prosecutor, Joseph P. Lord, began investigating reports that white adults were responsible for the persistent racial tension in the school.

title: Inner Circle Elects Head
description: Joseph Famiglietti, the City Hall bureau chief for WABC radio Who broadcasts under the name Joe Vamm, was elected last night as president of the Inner Circle, the organization of present and past political reporters. The Inner Circle, which will stage the golden anniversary edition of its annual lampoon show next April 15 at the New York Hilton Hotel, chose its new officer slate at its annual meeting, held at the Columbus Club, 8 East 69th Street.

title: That Elusive Peking Duck
description: TORONTOGeorge Bush and William Rogers are lobbying for a twoChina policy in the United, Nations while Henry Kissinger meets in Peking to firm up plans for President Nixon's forthcoming visit. The juxtaposition of these events can hardly be lost on Peking, Taipei or the diplomats at the United Nations.

title: Nets Rally to Top Stars., 111100
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Oct. 22It took the New York Nets three quarters to adjust to life without Rick Barry tonight. But when they did, they poured it on and rallied strongly for a 111.100 victory over the Utah Stars, the defending champions of the American Basketball Association.

title: Carbide's Quarter Net Off;
description: The Union Carbide Corporation, the nation's largest chemical producer after E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., reported yesterday lower earnings for the third quarter and nine months of 1971.

title: CHAIRMEN NAMED FOR TASK FORCES
description: The fivemember state commission assigned to investigate and analyze the city government yesterday named the chairmen of three of the 14 task forces it will set up to determine how well the city provides vital services to its residents.

title: Dreyfus Leverage Seeking Gibraltar Growth Assets
description: The $223million Dreyfus Leverage Fund would acquire the assets of the Gibraltar Growth Fund, a $30million entity, under a merger plan announced late yesterday. Gibraltar, based in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., has suspended selling new shares and an exchange of its shares for those of Dreyfus Leverage will be conducted at the relative net asset values of the two funds on the closing date.

title: $150MILLION ISSUE PLANNED BY ALCOA
description: The Aluminum Company of America filed yesterday with the Securities and Exchange Commission a registration statement covering the proposed sale of $150million of sinking fund debentures. The First Boston Corporation will head an underwriting group that sell the debentures which are due 1996. Annual sinking fund payments will begin in 1982. These are calculated to retire 93 per cent of the issue prior to maturity.

title: LingTemco Reduces Loss
description: LingTemcoVought, Inc., the Dallasbased conglomerate, reduced its operating loss in the third quarter and first nine months this year, but the net loss after extraordinary charges, continued at substantial amounts, according to yester4ay's report.

title: Frank E. Fitzsimmons Labor
description: President of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters Elected in 1967 when James R. Hoffa, the former president, was sent to jail... 63 years old... Colorless but articulate... Has brought an air of respectability back to his union...Kept menbership growing until it is above two million, the nation's largest union.. Prevented the teamster empire, a confederation of strong baronies, from breaking apart Contract negotiations sometimes confuse observers Born April 17, 1908, in Jeanette, Pa.

title: Army Sets Back Navy, 20,0, In Lightweight Football
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Oct. 22Army took a giant step toward capturing its second straight Eastern lightweight football championship today by defeating Navy, 200.

title: Caller Warns That Man Will Try to Kill Knapp
description: Whitman Knapp, chairman of the commission investigating alleged police corruption, was placed under police protection yesterday after a caller warned that a man with a highpowered rifle would try to kill him.

title: Experts Now Doubt Famine In East Pakistan
George Meany Labor
description: President of the 13million member A.F.L.C.I.O... 77yearold former plumber Considered the voice of the American labor movement... Blunt, truculent, powerful... Forced the Administration this month to give autonomy to the Pay Board... Doesn't duck fights Personally led campaign to drive teamsters union from the federation for corruption... Resists attempts to push labor toward coexistence with foreign Communists... Defeated the late Walter P. Reuther's challenge to push American labor further left in social issues.

title: HEARING ORDERED ON PANTHER CASE
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 22A Criminal Court judge ordered today a full and open hearing into allegations that five special prosecutors improperly influenced the Cook County grand jay that returned indictments against Edward V. Hanrahan, Cook County State's Attorney, and 13 others in the case that grew out of a raid, on the apartment of Black Panther leaders.

title: Sports of The Times
description: While the Pirates and the Orioles were engrossed the World Series last week, Ken Harrelson, the former Cleveland outfielder, was struggling to score pars and birdies.

title: TELEPROMPTER TOLD TO DELAY MEETING
description: The Teleprompter Corporation's annual stockholders' meeting, scheduled here yesterday for 2 P.M., was adjourned until Nov. 24, on order of Federal District Judge Murray Gurfein.

title: It's French Breadbut It Proudly Carries a MadeinNew York Label
description: Qu'estceque c'est que ca? French bread made in New York that feels, looks and tastes like French bread? Oui.

title: Arguing Costs Lucci $300
description: DETROIT, Oct. 22 (AP)Mike Lucci, Detroit Lion linebacker, was fined $300 by the National Football League today for having been thrown out of the Oct. 10 game against Green Bay for arguing vehemently after a disputed touchdown by Green Bay.

title: Leonard F. McCollum Business
description: Board chairman and former chief executive of the Continental Oil Company.. 69yearold native of Tennessee... Still active, with offices in New York and Houston... Grew up in South Texas... Graduated from University of Texas in 1925 with geology degree... Lives in Greenwich, Conn.. Began career in oil industry as geologist with the Humble Oil and Refining Company... Once wanted to be a journalist... Joined Continental as president in 1947... Chairman of the American Petroleum Institute in 1962 and 1963... Still chairman of Continental's executive committee... Director of Morgan Guaranty Trust Company.

title: John W. Queenan
description: Former managing partner of Haskins & Sells, large international accounting firm Still active in consulting capacity there... 65 years old... Past president of American Institute of Certified Public Accountants... Native of Aurora, Ill... Graduated from University of Illinois... Started with Haskins & Sells in 1927 for $35 a week... Became managing partner in 1946... An opera buff and golfer.. Lives in Greenwich, Conn.... Former member of Board of Estimate there... Scored highest mark in Illinois on 1931 C.P.A. exam.... C.P.A. Gold Medal Award winner for distinguished service in 1968 Scottish ancestry... Stern

title: Young Voters to Have Convention Role
description: The Queens Democratic organization plans to include in its delegation to the Presidential convention of 1972 several new voters from the 18to20yearold group.

title: Bishops Uphold Objectors
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 22 (UPI)America's Roman Catholic bishops declared today that conscientious objection to war, even to a particular conflict, is a valid moral position for Catholics.

title: Executive Changes
description: The North American Rockwell Corporation announced yesterday that Frank Gard Jameson, formerly president of TeledyneRyan Aeronautical, has been named senior vice president and assistant to Robert Anderson, president and chief operating officer of the aerospace and manufacturing company. In a separate announcement, TeledyneRyan Aeronautical said that Laurence M. Limbach will become president and chief operating officer. Mr. Limbach has been executive vice president of the San Diego aerospace company.

title: WORRIED MARKET DECLINES AGAIN
description: The stock market's bulging bag of worries proved too much again yesterday for prices, halting a technical rally that got under way at the opening bell.

title: Anniversaries
description: ALLENWinlo A. Happy second anniversary. Your smile Is my light. You're always In my heart & thoughts. I love you. Your husband Jeff.

title: Excerpts From Exchange by Boldt With Newsmen at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Following are excerpts from the White House transcript of the exchange between newsmen and Judge George H. Boldt upon his introduction at the White House today as chairman of the Pay Board:

title: Track Mark Not Ratified
description: PARIS, Oct. 22 (Reuters)The world record for the 800 meter relay, set by British women at Colombes Stadium on Oct. 2, will not be presented to the International Amateur Athletics Federation for ratification, the French Athletics Federation said today. The federation said that after studying a film of the race they had noticed that the third British girl, Sharon Colyear, had cut in shortly after taking over the baton Instead of waiting until after the bend to do so.

title: Help Us Return to Our Homeland
description: Open Letter to the Writers of the World, Who Write in Yiddish

title: Nations of Mediterranean Seeking to Clean Their Sea
description: ROME, Oct. 22The Mediterranean has been widely diagnosed as a dangerously sick sea: now the experts are seeking the therapy.

title: Knicks Beat Weakened Bullets;
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 22  The New York Knicks, with backcourt problems of their own, took advantage of Baltimore's contractual difficulties with Earl Monroe and Archie Clark to post a 11087 victory over a patchwork Bullet team tonight before 7,700 fans at the Civic Center.

title: Stage: Barroom Scene
description: By the opening of the third act, it was clear that only an irredeemably broken electric fuse could, if not save the evening, at least shorten it. The play, called A Song for the First of May, which for reasons best known to the hithertounknown producers, opened at Actors Playhouse last night, almost glittered with boredom.

title: VISIT TO VANCOUVER IS BEGUN BY KOSYGIN
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Oct. 22Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union inspected the St. Lawrence Seaway from the air today while flying westward to VanOouver.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Regarding your Oct. 10 editorial on Rhodesian chrome, I can't help feeling your opinion was prompted more by, emotion than a wellreasoned understanding of the facts.

title: Insults Traded at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 22Soviet, Arab and Israeli Ambassadors traded personal and national insults today as the United Nations General Assembly bogged down for the second successive day in a battle over Jews, Zionism and antiSemitism.

title: OMEGAALPHA SET FOR A TAKEOVER
description: OmegaAlpha, Inc., announced yesterday it has agreed to acquire the Transcontinental Investing Corporation in a transaction involving about $55million in Omega's common stock. OmegaAlpha was formed in 1970 by James J. Ling, the former chairman of LingTemcoVought, Inc. Transcontinen t a 1 Investing in September reported a net loss of $5,598.000 for 1970. Transcontinen t a 1 at that time said the deficits were primarily because of losses, reserve's and nonrecurring expenses in the company's Transcontinental Music Corporation subsidiary. It said its finance and realestate operations were profitable.

title: Guatemalan Army Moderates Seek End to Violence
Sitin at Temple U.
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 22 (UPI)  Striking maintenance employes at Temple University staged a sitin at the office of the president, Paul R. Anderson, today to demand resumption of contract bargaining. The strike began Monday to demand a 38cent hourly raise in a oneyear contract and paid pension plan. Temple's last offer was 20 cents immediately and 15 cents in the second year of a twoyear contract.

title: Julie Heldman Victor Over Miss Goolagong
description: BILLINGHAM, England; Oct. 22 (UPI)Julie Heldman of New York upset the Wimbledon champion, Evonne Goolagong of Australia, 60, 75, today to gain the final of the Dewar Cup indoor tennis tournament.

title: Getting Down to Serious Drinking
description: Some 75 wine lovers, mostly professionals or advanced amatours, gathered at Automation House, 49 East 68th Street, Thursday night to sample a dozen Bordeaux of the 1967 vintage.

title: Regional Director of H.U.D. Disputes Charge of Walsh
description: S. William Green, regional administrator of the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development, denied yesterday that his department had told city officials you're, just building too much housing in New York City.

title: Virgil B. Day Business
description: Top labor negotiator for the General Electric Company... Has held G.E. executive positions since 1947 Now company's vice president for business environment... Deals with legislative and social issues Republican... 55yearold lawyer... Urges business to combat inflation by taking tough stance in labor negotiations... Native of Montgomery, Ala.... Grew up in Midwest... Graduate of Northwestern University and its law school... Member of National Labor Management Panel and Council for New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations On board of directors of

title: White House Appoints 22 To Pay and Price Boards
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22President Nixon appointed today 22 members of the Pay Board and the Price Commission, the agencies that will create and administer economic controls in Phase Two of the Administration's program to stabilize the economy.

title: MOSCOW PROTESTS TO U.S. ON SHOOTING
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 22The Soviet Union I made a resolute protest to the United States today over the incident in which shots were fired at the building of the Soviet MiSkton to the United Nations in New York two days ago.

title: New Fund Drive for Beaumont Seeking to Enlist 500 Patrons
description: The Repertory Theater of Lincoln Center announced yesterday a new fundraising program called Repertory 500 to serve as a base of financial support for the Vivian Beaumont Theater.

title: Herbert Weinstock, Biographer Of Many Composers, Is Dead
description: Herbert Weinstock, author of biographies of composers, critic, translator and for, many years an editor for the Alfred A., Knopf publishing firm, died Thursday in Beth Israel: Hospital, after an operation. He was 65 years old, and lived at 60 Last Eighth Street,

title: Rogers Threatens Chilean Aid Cutoff In Expropriations
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Secretary of State William P. Rogers yesterday told representatives of six major United States corporations affected by recent expropriations in Chile that Washington would take steps to cut off aid to Chile unless she provided prompt, fair compensation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Oct. 4 editorial criticizing the Administration's apparent lack of either sense of urgency or direction in edUcation fails to recognize a series of Major initiatives in this field. Since I become Commissioner of EduCation laSt December, much of my time has been devoted to urging Congressional action on these initiatives, which have enormous implications for the future, of American education.

title: Civil Liberties Unit Sees Knapp Inquiry As Violating Rights
description: The New York Civil Liberties Union yesterday assailed the Knapp Commission's hearings on alleged police corruption as a civilliberties disaster.

title: WILLARD G. ROUSE
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 22 (AP)Willard G. Rouse; vice chairman of the board of the Rouse Company, a real estate development and mortgage banking concern, died. Wednesday of a heart attack while on a business trip in Toledo, Ohio. He was 61 years old.

title: Antiques
description: Art Nouveau porcelain is attracting the attention of collectors who like the style but find prices for the more familiar fine glass and furniture too steep.

title: WORK IS DELAYED ON TOCKS I. DAM
description: SHAWNEE ON DELAWARE, Pa., Oct. 22The Army Corps of Engineers has agreed to a request from the President's Council on Environmental Quality to curtail the beginning of construction of the Tocks Island dam across the Delaware River between New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

title: Arnold R. Weber Public
description: Executive director of the Cost of Living Council until today... Formerly deputy director of the Office of Management and Budget and Assistant Secretary of Labor for Manpower in the Nixon Administration... Friend, associate and coauthor with George P. Schultz, head of O.M.B., of the book Strategies for the Displaced Worker... Born In Chicago 42 years ago Earned degrees at the University of Illinois and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology... Former faculty member at the University of Chicago Worked as a teacher and researcher then for a decade until he went to Washington.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I would like to offer a more reasonable rebuttal to the Oct. 2 and 4 columns by Anthony Lewis than that usually provided by the American Medical Association.

title: W. S. Cluett Marries Miss Philippi
description: LITTLE COMPTON, R.I., Oct. 22Miss Sandra Dickinson Philippi was married here today to Walter Stetson Cluett on the bridegroom's 32d birthday. The Rev. Robert R. Hansell performed the afternoon ceremony in the Episcopal Chapel of St. Andrew'sbytheSea.

title: Wesleyan to Use Stock in Backing Public Interests
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Oct. 22  Wesleyan University announced a policy today under which it will support what deems the public interest when it holds shares in corporations whose policies appear to conflict with that interest, It believed to be the first major university to adopt such policy,

title: Rangers Go to St. Louis With Their Stock Rising
description: A year ago the New York Rangers opened their National Hockey League season in St. Louis and lost to the Blues, 3.1, Despite that negative beginning, the Rangers went on tol one of the Most productive and financially successful campaigns in the club's 46year, old history.

title: GEORGE WARREN JR. OF STOCK EXCHANGE
description: NEWPORT; R. I., Oct 22George. Henry Warren Jr., a retired member of the New York Stock Exchange and a former director of the Metropolitan Opera, died at his home here today after a long illness. He was 82 years old.

title: Art: The Old French Garde Is Revised
description: It has been at least 15 years since we first began to hear that the masters of 19thcentury French painting Who were discarded in the historical postmortem farming the impressionist victory were in for a revival. But there are still very few people outside the top rank of museum curators who would not prefer a bad Monet to a firstrate, sparkling Barbizon impressionist landscape by the forgotten Salon gold medal winner Pierre Emmanuel Damoye unless the signatures were coveredeven if they could tell a good Monet from bad

title: Peace Among the Ruins
description: The magnificent ruins of the ancient city of Angkor in northwestern Cambodia are among the wonders. the world, an Eastern counterpart of Rome, Athens and Luxor. They are also a coveted prize in the Cambodian war, symbolizing the lost grandeur of a Khmer kingdom that once held sway over much of Southeast Asia, from the China Sea to the Indian Ocean.

title: COST STUDY ASKED BY SCHOOL BOARD
description: The Board of Education is Urging the city's 31 community school boards and its high school division to reexamine their construction programs and to recommend only those Projects that are immediately necessary while bearing in mind what the city can afford to pay.

title: NewIssue Prices End Week Lower; Trading Moderate
description: Prices of new issues slumped In moderate trading this week, but not as sharply as those of listed stocks, specialists reported yesterday.

title: CONSERVATIVES WIN, KEEP ONTARIO RULE
description: TORONTO, Oct. 22Decisively renewing the mandate of the Progressive Conservative party to govern Ontario, the voters of Canada's industrial heartland yesterday rejected two opposition parties that threatened to get tough with Americanowned corporations.

title: GRAIN PRICES UP; SOYBEANS IN RISE
description: All prices of grain as well as soybean futures rode yesterday after a day of ups and downs on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Greek Opposition Leader Scoffs at Agnew Claim
description: ATHENS, Oct, 22  A Greek opposition leader Who headed the country's, last Parliament before the military takeover scoffed today at Vice President Agnew's contention that the Government was restoring democracy.

title: The City Hall Papers
description: The following correspondence has come into my possession:

title: Both Sides in U.N. See Victory on China
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 22Both sides in the United Nations debate on China predicted victory today by slim margins in the test vote due early next week.

title: Another Bomb Explodes
description: BELFAST, Oct. 22 (UPI)A bomb containing about 20 pounds of explosives went off near a poultrypacking shop in Belfast today, slightly injurying a woman.

title: U.S.Chinese Thaw Is Troubling Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 15South Korea, situated at the focus of Chinese, Soviet and Japanese power, watches uneasily as relations between those countries and the United States, enter a period of flux.

title: 2 Memphis Boys Hopeful on Inquiry
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Oct. 22After giving testimony to the District Attorney this week, two black youths who survived a fatal highspeed police chase last week, which brought racial tension and violence here, said in interviews last night that they had faith that any guilty racial tension and violence to Menphis.

title: U.S. RIDERS GAIN PENN SHOW LEAD
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 22 The United States Equestrian Team pulled into the lead for the international jumping championship tonight by winning the Nations Cup at the Pennsylvania National Horse Show.

title: U.S. Encouraged by Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22The State Department said, today that it was encouraged by the businesslike and serious atmosphere of the talks in Moscow designed to prevent collisions and other incidents at sea.

title: Nixon Plans Radio Speech
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (UPI) President Nixon will address the nation by radio at 7:30 P.M. Sunday in honor of Veterans Day, the White House announced today.

title: Music: Two Strangers
description: Two works, both strangers. Michael Gielen, who has come to the New York Philharmonic with little advance notice or word of mouth, and who has made his presence strongly felt, conducted Liszt's Dante Symphony and Mozart's cantata Davidde Penitente at Philharmonic Hall on Thursday night.

title: Almost Every Place but Picasso's Town Noting His 90th Birthday
description: MOLJGINS, France  The most illustrious resident of this township will be 90 years old on Monday, and the occasion is being celebrated in Paris, Barcelona, Vallaurisbut not in Mougins.

title: Ancient Spanish Music Comes to Life in a Patio
description: As the detergent backlash shows, the conveniences of modern living can end by tyrannizing those they were created to serve. We put up uncomplainingly with comfort, even when it is uncomfortable.

title: 5 HELD IN BROOKLYN IN NARCOTICS RAID
description: A Brooklyn man accused by the police of being a major narcotics distributor was arrested in an East Flatbush apartment yesterday with four other persons alleged to be his confederates.

title: Germans Hold Berlin Talks.
description: BONN, Oct. 22Egon Bahr, a West German State Secretary, and Michael Kohl, his East German counterpart, today ended another round of talks aimed at implementing the Allied fourpower agreement on divided Berlin. Both sides described the twoday conference as useful.

title: Coal Output Declines
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (UPI)The National Coal Association today estimated bituminous coal production in the United States for the week ending Oct. 16 was 3,000,000 tons.

title: Robert F. Lanzillotti
description: Professor of economics and dean of the college of business at the University of Florida, Gainesville... Also a consultant to the Department of Justice's antitrust division... Has been a teaching fellow at the University of California, Berkeley, a research associate at the Brookings Institution... Has been a professor of economics at Washington State University and at Michigan State University... was economics department chairman at Michigan State... Born in Washington, D. C., 50 years ago... Attended American University, receiving bachelor's and master's degrees... Received his doctorate at Berkeley.

title: Pacers Top Colonels, 105102
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Oct 22 (AP) The Indiana Pacers pulled away from the Kentucky Colonels in the second half tonight for a 105102 victory. The Pacers lead the West Division with a 50 wonlost record.

title: MRS, CROSS TAKES GOLF IN JERSEY
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J Oct, 22Mrs. Henry Cross Jr. of Essex County won the second annual women's senior state golf championship of New Jert sey today.

title: U.S. AND RUSSIANS IN UNDERSTANDING ON SEA INCIDENTS
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 22 United Slates Navy negotiators announced here today that they had reached an understanding with a Soviet delegation on measures to prevent collisions and other, incidents at sea.

description: President and chief executive of the Southern Pacific Company... Started there in 1936... Name pronounced beAHJinee... Native of New Orleans... Big Republican campaign contributor.. Graduate of St. Mary's University of Texas... Known as a harddriving, tightfisted executive... Member of Business Council.. Trustee of the Conference Board in New York... Director of Association of American Railroads... Held various positions in Southern's engineering departments in Texas... 55 years old... Trustee of California Institute of Technology... Member of advisory council of Stanford University Graduate School of

title: MEMBER OF J.D.L. IS FREED IN BAIL
description: An 18yearold Jewish Defense League activist was released on $25,000 bail yesterday on charges that he lied about his identity to buy a rifle that allegedly was, used on Wednesday night to fire into the headquarters of the Soviet Mission to the United Nations.

title: No Consent on Advice
description: The abrupt termination by the Nixon Administration of the American Bar Association's role in screening potential candidates for the Supreme Court will deprive the White House of a valuable source of advice. The decision has all the earmarks of an act of pique over the negative evaluation given by the association to two candidates the President had seemed intent on nominating until his surprise designation via television of Lewis F. Powell Jr. and William H. Rehnquist.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In recent years there has been much comment about the problem of child abuse. A month ago Assembly Speaker Perry Duryea called for legislative remedies to meet the problem. But there are many forms of child abuse, and not all of them are caused by individual parents.

title: Uniform Regulation Is Urged by Haack at S.E.C. Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 The New York Stock Exchange, in something of a surprise, en dorsed the idea today that competing marketmakers should be allowed to trade in stocks listed on the exchange.

title: Rogers Voices Confidence
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (UPI) Secretary of State William P. Rogers told. President Nixon today he was confident that Nationalist China would keep its seat in the United Nations, according to the White House press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler.

title: SYLVANIA STUDIES TV PLANT CLOSING
description: GTE Sylvania, Inc., has notified 1,367 employes that it might have to close its Batavia, N. Y., television assembly plant because of unusually high hourly wage scales.

title: Head of Price Panel Charles Jackson Grayson Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Charles Jackson Grayson Jr. sent word to some friends in Dallas yesterday that his job as chairman of the Nixon Administration's Price Commission looked, on closer inspection, even bigger than he had expected. For one thing, he would be introduced to reporters at a White House news conference this morning. The 48yearold official, on leave as dean of the Business School at Southern Methodist University, did seem a trifle nervous.

title: U.S. Court Lets Stand 25 Kent State Indictments
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 22, (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for, the Sixth Circuit let stand teday, indictments of 25, persons in last year'S.;Kent Sting University disorders. But it uphold a lower court order that a County grand Jury report critical of the universiadministration be be expunged. Attorneys for the 25 students and faculty members had segued that the grand jury report villified persons on the Campus and indicated they Were guilty, before they were

title: Canadian Bank Rate Pared % to 4 %
description: TORONTO, Oct. 22  After intervening in the foreign exchange market today to keep the Canadian dollar from exceeding parity with the United States dollar, the Bank of Canada took a further defensive action tonight by announcing a halfpoint reduction in its lending rate.

title: Science and Government Are Inseparable
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass.The crisis of Science (funding, directing and using it for destroying life instead of elevating and protecting it) is part of a wider crisis and can be understood only within its wider context. The history of man consists of two periods: the prescientific and scientific. What characterized the first was an autistic thinking, by which man made himself the center of the universe, created for his pleasure and temptation. The mysteries of nature he explained by the whim of gods, shaped to his own image. What gave birth to science was a new way of thinking, discovered in the Renaissance, the essence of which was the search of truth for truth's sake. This enable'd man to look into nature, and made him the master of natural forces which were out of proportion to his own. These forces enabled him to interfere with nature's ways, overcrowd and his little globe, transform it into a dump or cesspOol or wipe himself off its surface.

title: GARLAND W. REESE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Oct. 22Garland Whistler Reese, who retired as vice president in charge of manufacturing of the American Can. Company in 1958, died, yesterday at his home in Tryon, N. C. He was 76 years old and formerly had lived in Chappaqua, N. Y.

title: William W. Scranton
description: Former Republican Governor of Pennsylvania.. Has served on many panels for President Nixon... Always his own man... Described as punctual, patrician, private and perplexing An aristocrat in a plebeian's game... Major criticism in recent years that he was indecisive in unsuccessful attempt to gain Republican Presidential nomination in 1964... Roots go back to Mayflower colonists Yale graduate... Elected to House of Representatives in 1960... Chairman of President's Commission on Campus Unrest... 54 years old... Selfdepreciating of humor.

title: Dudley J. LeBlanc, Gained a Fortune With Hadacol Tonic
description: ABBEVILLE, La., Oct. 22 (AP)State Senator Dudley J. LeBlanc Of Louisiana, a flamboyant entrepreneur who Made a fortune by concocting a tonic called Hadacol, died today after suffering a stroke. He was 77 years old.

title: AMEX PRICES SIT ON AN EVEN KEEL
description: The American Stock Exchange finished on the fence yesterday as prices ended practicaly unchanged in slow trading.

title: Hearings a Touchy Topic At Conference on Crime
description: I've been mugged. My apartment has been robbed. Everyone I know has, been robbed. I just can't live here anymore.

title: Raymond Hatton, Actor, Dead; In First Hollywood Feature Film
description: PALMDALE, Calif., Oct. 22 Raymond Hatton, a vaudeville performer and silent screen actor who appeared in The Squaw Man, the first feature made in Hollywood,. was found dead last evening, apparently of a heart attack. He was 84 years old.

title: Screen: Beguiling Erotica
description: The label Erotic Film Program, as a boxoffice hookbaiter, might suggest something dirty or dull or both. Wrong. The uptown Film Forum has packaged a quintet of shorts, ranging from 5 to 30 minutes, that add up to a generally beguiling, often amusing eyeful for adults. And a nice show it is.

title: JABBAR SCORES 38 AS BUCKS WIN 5TH
description: MILWAUKEE, Oct. 22 (AP)Kareem Abdul Jabbar, outplaying 7foot1inch Elmore Smith, scored 38 points and grabbed 10 rebounds tonight to lead the Milwaukee Bucks to a 124.105 National Basketball Association victory over the Buffalo Braves.

title: Dilemma Over Red Tape
description: The municipal loan scandal has, dramatized a critical dilemma of city government: the choice between operating public programs with the checks and balances that may keep them honest but also make them slow, and freeing the programs from red tape, which speeds them along but invites corruption. City government is now a patchwork quilt of variations on those two basic themes. The ina bility of the Model Cities program to spend millions of dollars in Federal funds, for ex ample, has been attributed largely to the elaborate bureaucracy that has grown up over the years to guard against graft.

title: Texans Speculate on Connally for 1972
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Oct. 21This is the state where they know John B. Connally best, where they remember him as a threeterm Governor, study hint as he wheels and deals, as a Democratic Secratary or the Treasury in a Republican Administration, and fear him as a VicePresidential running mate for President Nixon.

title: I. W. Abel Labor
description: President of the United Steelworkers of America since he defeated David J. McDonald in 1965... Born to a working class family 63 years ago in Magnolia, Ohio Attended business college Went to work for a subsidiary of the United States Steel Corporation as a laborer at 16 cents an hour working 84 hours a week... Became an organizer for the steelworkers in 1936... Involved in many Depression era battles with management Regarded as tough and tenacious in managing the union and negotiating labor contracts,

title: PRICES HERE RISE IN FACE OF FREEZE
description: Consumer prices in the metropolitan area rose substantially last month despite the wageprice freeze, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday. But officials cautioned against interpreting the increase as a sign that the freeze was ineffective.

title: Agreement on 90% of Contract For Striking Miners Is Reported
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Oct. 22Gov. Arch A. Moore Jr. said tonight that a brief conference in his office here this afternoon had resulted in agreement on 90 per cent of contract that could end the impasse in negotiations in the 22dayold softcoal strike, perhaps by the end of next week.

title: BengalsRaiders Game Listed for TV Here
description: Two National Football League games will be seen on local television tomorrow.

title: Community Plan Sacked
description: ALBANY, Oct. 22 (AP)New York State's Roman Catholic Bishops called today for voter approval of the socalled community development proposal that will appear on the Nov. 2 election ballot.

title: Betty Friedan Interrupts Muskie Talk in Florida
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Oct. 22 (UPI)Betty Friedan, the women's liberation leader, interrupted a speech by Senator Edmund S. Muskie tonight to say that women were disgusted with the establishment.

title: Columbia Dedicates School of International Affairs
description: Columbia University's International Affairs Building, a $21million, 15story building of limestone and poured concrete with a huge brick terrace and a sunken courtyard, was dedicated yesterday to the cause of world peace by Dr. William J. McGlll, president of Columbia.

title: 2 Gunmen Plant 30Pound Bomb in Belfast Hotell
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 22  Two armed men walked into the lobby of Belfast's newest and largest hotel this afternoon and planted package containing a 30pound bomb.

title: By Lyndon B. Johnson: Crisis and War in the Mideast in 1967
description: JUST before 8 o'clock on the morning of June 5, 1967, the telephone rang in my bedroom at the White House. Bob McNamara was calling with a message never heard before by an American President. Mr. President, he said, the hot line is up.

title: Notes on People
description: Former President Lyndon B. Johnson is again getting his political feet wet in Texas. He made a surprise appearance at a reception to encourage Mrs. Barbara Jordan, a state senator, to run for Congress. She proved that black is beautiful before we knew what it meant, said Mr, Johnson. Mrs. Jordan, he added, is the epitome of the new politics in Texas, not the politics that seek to destroy and divide and mess up everything in the way. She is involved in a governmental system of all the people, all the races, all economic groups. Mrs. Jordan gave him a big hug.

title: Cowles Strickland, Authority On the Theater, Is Dead at 68
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (AP) F. Cowles Strickland, a theater professor and director whose students included Katharine Hepburn, James Cagney and Montgomery Clift, died of cancer Wednesday. He was 68 years old.

title: MYSTERIOUS BOOMS WAGE COAST AREA
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 22, (UPI)Two mysterious booms, like giant thunderclaps, shook the San Francisco Bay area for 50 miles early today, awakening thousands of restdents and causing extensive damage to windows and homes in suburban Daly City.

title: 2 UTILITIES ON COAST POST REVENUE GAINS
description: California's two major energy utilities reported yesterday gains in operating revenues for the September quarter.

title: Models Try Business World On for Size
description: My husband has learned to cook very fast, said Judy.

title: Kissinger on Excursion, Perhaps to Great Wall
description: PEKING, Oct. 22 (Reuters) Henry A. Kissinger, here to prepare for President Nixon's visit, sped out of Peking today, apparently to look at the Great Wall of China.

title: Snug Harbor for Protectionists
description: An almost limitless new area of protectionism would be created by trade exclusions that the House Education and Labor Committee proposes to write into the minimum wage law.

title: PATROLMAN TELLS OF GRAFT LESSONS
description: For Patrolman Edward F. Droge Jr., a witness yesterday before the Knapp Commission, the real, education of a rookie policeman came not at the Police Academy, he said, but rather on the streets of Williamsburg in Brooklyn only a feW weeks after he actually became a Patrolman.

title: 9 Black Militants Indicted In Fatal Shooting in Jackson
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (UPI) Nine members of the black militant Republic of New Africa were indicted today on charges stemming from a fatal shooting at the group's Jackson, Miss., headquarters last summer.

title: Art of HeadFake Gains An Illegal First Down
description: In tomorrow's game at Shea Stadium, the quarterbacks of the Jets and the Miami Dolphins presumably will continue to use a deceptive headfake, designed, to draw the other team's defensive players off: side, with the approval of the National Football League office.

title: ALLEN H. TURNAGE, A MARINE GENERAL
description: BETHESDA, Md., Oct. 22Lieut. Gen. Allen H. Turnage, who was commanding general of the Third Marine Division in World War II, died today in Bethesda Naval Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived in Alexandria, Va.

title: Merged Financial Reports Set for Stock Exchange
description: Richard B. Howland, executive vice president of the New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that the financial reports required by the exchange, the National Association of Securities Dealers and the American Stock Exchange would be made uniform.

title: Dynamite Found in Locker
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 22 (AP)  Sixteen sticks of dynamite were found in a coinoperated storage locker at the downtown Greyhound bus depot, the police said today. A Greyhound employe found the unfused explosives yesterday during a routine check of expired rental lockers.

title: BAKERY IS SEEKING REORGANIZATION
description: The 83yearold Horn & Hardart Baking Company of Philadelphia, which originated the coinoperated restaurants known as Automats, filed a petition in the United States District Court in that city, yesterday for reorganization unChapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Law.

title: Mrs. O'Leary's Cow, Phase Two
description: Chicago has been indulging in a curiously sentimental celebration of the centenary of its great fire while another, less dramatic natural disaster is devastating the city. Mrs. O'Leary's cow has been replaced by the speculator.

title: LATINAMERICANS SUE U.S. ON RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 HispanicAmericans, in the first move of. ,a national campaign against inequality, filed a sweeping suit today charging four Federal agencies with systematic discrimination against persons of Spanishspeaking background.

title: Ecological Science Suing Haskins &
description: The Ecological Science Corporation of Miami announced yesterday it had filed a suit in Dade County Circuit Court against its auditor Haskins & Sells asking $73million in damages. The suit alleged, among other things, that the accounting firm misled the company and caused it to be late in filing certain reports with regulatory agencies, thereby damaging the company's relationships with the American Stock Exchange and the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Spanish Bank Rate Is Cut
description: MADRID, Oct. 22 (Reuters) The Spanish bank rate was cut to 5 per cent from 6 per sent. The rate was last reduced on April 5, when it dropped from six and a quarter to 6 per cent. No reason was given for the reduction. All other Bank of Spain rates will remain the same.

title: Sonics Sink Rockets
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 22 (AP)The Seattle SuperSonics held Elvin Hayes to 9 points tonight as they bounced the Houston Rockets, 11091.

title: Bloomingdale's Picketed
description: A group of security employes, five men and five, women wearing paper bags over their heads, picketed Bloomingdale's department store at Lexington land 59th Street yesterday. They wore the bags, they explained, because they work within the store In undercover roles, and did not ,want to be recognized by store patrons. The picketing was reported to be an effort to gain recognition by the store of Local 803 of the Teamsters Union as bargaining agent for Bloomingdale's security personnel.

title: A General Telephone Unit Plans Computer Venture
description: GTE Information Systems, Inc., announced yesterday it would enter the thirdparty computer equipment maintenance field. Leonard A. Muller, president of the subsidiary of the General Telephone and Electronics Corporation, will have a 550man staff to maintain other manufacturers equipment from 90 key locations next year.

title: Israel Says 6 Palestinians Were Killed in Gaza Battle
description: TEL AVIV Oct. 22An Israeli military spokesman said that six Palestinians including two young girls were killed today in a battle between Israeli soldiers and Arab guerrillas in Gaza.

title: MRS. ROSE H. MORTON
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Oct. 22Mrs. Rose H. Morton, the mother of Page Morton, the singer and wife of William Black, chairman and president of the Chock Full O'Nuts Corporation, died today at the Blacks residence, Premium Point, apparently of a heart attack.

title: CHAPARRALS BEAT SQUIRES, 123108
description: HAMPTON, Va., Oct. 22 (AP) A balanced Dallas attack overcame a twoman scoring show by Charlie Scott and Julius Erving tonight as the Dallas Chaparrals downed the Virginia Squires, 123108, in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Neal Ashby Weds Babette Brimberg
description: MINEOLA, L. I, Oct. 22Miss Babette Brimberg, articles editor of Family Circle magazine, was married here today to Neal Ashby, a writer. State Supreme Court Justice Steven B. Derounian performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: American Standard Stock Slumps After Profit Drop
description: Prices of the common and preferred stocks of American Standard, Inc., fell sharply yesterday in reaction to the company's announcement Thursday night of a sharp drop in thirdquarter profit, prospects of a substantial loss for 1971 and plans to dispose of $250million of assets. American Standard's common stock was the second most active on the New York Stock Exchange with volume of 135,300 shares. It fell 5 to 15, a decline of 25.1 per cent from Thursday's close of 20.

title: 2d Atomic Blast in 2 Days In Soviet Union Indicated
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 (AP)For the second day in a row, the United States today reported seismic signals presumed to be from a Soviet underground nuclear explosion.

title: A Couture House Pulls Back
description: PARIS, Oct. 22Nina Ricci, following in the footsteps of Yves Saint Laurent and Pierre Cardin, will not show an haute couture collection to the press in January, but it doesn't mean there won't be any haute couture show next year. It will take place at the same time as the readytowear collection in April and October. The fashion house made the announcement at its showing this week of the spring readytowear collection in the haute couture salon.

title: KNICKS GET MILES AS BACKUP GUARD
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 22With Mike Riordan sidelined by a broken wrist and Walt Frazier hospitalized earlier in the day, the Knicks strengthened their backcourt by acquiring Eddie Miles before tonight's game with the Baltimore Bullets at the Civic Center.

title: Punjabi Militia Mobilized
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 22 (AP)The Indian Government today mobilized the militia in the northwestern border state of Punjab. A spokesman said that the action was intended to prepare the state for any developments arising from reports that Pakistan had moved large contingents of troops into the area.

title: Rocco C. Siciliano Business
description: President of The TI Corporation, Los Angeles holding company for title insurance operations.... Until six months ago served as Under Secretary of Commerce... Assistant Secretary of Labor from 1953 to 1957. Then special assistant to President Eisenhower in charge of personnel from 1957 to 1959.... 49yearold lawyer... Registered Republican.... Formerly president of Pacific Maritime Association in San Francisco.... Strong background in labor negotiations... Before joining Government was secretarytreasurer of Procon Inc. of Des Plaines, Ill., construction concern.... Native of Salt Lake City.

title: A STRAUSS SCORE IN ARPINO BALLET
description: The City Center Joffrey Ballet is raffling off two plane tickets to Vienna at intermissions, and the fellow who distributed bouquets to the dancers Wednesday night after the premiere of Gerald Arpino's ballet Kettentanz was wearing lederhosen.

title: Noland Paintings Begin a New Series
description: Among the artists who have established themselves as the principal innovators of American colorfield painting over the last decade, Kenneth Noland has consistently been one of the most accomplished. Like other abstractionists of this persuasion, he has tended to work in series of paintings, submitting each new formal idea to elaborate and sometimes exhaustive variations. As a result, our visual memory of his work tends to consist of memories of each seriesand of the idea that animates it rather than of the individual paintings of which the series is composed.

title: Robert C. Bassett Business
description: President of Vertical Marketing, Inc., magazine pub. lishing company in Chicago 60yearold registered Republican... served as Republican national committeeman from Wisconsin before World War II... Runs both Vertical Marketing and Bassett Publishing Co...Combined sales of under $6million a year... Trustee of National Small Business Association... has served, as representative of small business in Administration councils and made many trips to Washington to argue its cause... Believes new Nixon economic program is last bastion against spiraling inflation.. : If this doesn't work, the whole town's under

title: Books of The Times
description: THE APPALACHIAN PHOTOGRAPHS OP DORIS ULMANN. Introduction by John Jacob Niles. Unpaged. Pentland, N. C.: The Jargon Society. $10.

title: Egyptians deny Accepting Sisco as Suez Mediator
description: CAIRO, Oct. 22An Egyptian Government official denied today as unfounded specula. tion a United Press Internantional report from Cairo yesterday that Egypt had agreed to the designation of Joseph J. Sisco, United States. Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and South Asian Affairs, to meditate between,

title: Housing for the Deaf And Elderly Is Started
description: Standing tall amid the distinguished guests, reverend clergy, ladies and gentlemen at a Lower East Side apartment house groundbreaking yesterday was Robert Battersby.

title: Dismissed Patrolman Files A Suit for Reinstatement
description: Waverly Logan, a 30yearold former city policeman, filed suit in State Supreme Court !yesterday for reinstatement with full back pay to his post as patrolman.

title: CANADA SETS QUOTA ON SHIRT IMPORTS
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 22 (Canadian Press)The Government announced today a quota on imports of shirts for men and boys to protect Canadian manufacturers.

title: William G. Caples Public
description: President of Kenyon College, small liberal arts school in Gambier, Ohio, since May, 1968... 62yearold lawyer. Spent much of career sparring with United Steelworkers of America as labor negotiator for the Inland Steel Company.... Became vice president of industrial and public relations.... Considered strong bargainer by labor.... Suffered stroke a year ago but says he is fully recovered.... Registered Democrat.... Served on National Advisory Committee on Manpower and Training. Nixon Administration let that appointment lapse last June.... Practiced law in Chicago before World War II.

title: Bruins Rout Seals, 51
description: OAKLAND, Oct. 22 (UPI)Scoring in every period, the Boston Bruins routed the California Seals, 51, tonight before 10,348, the largest home crowd of the season.

title: Stackhouse Stars As Red Wings Win From Leafs by 52
description: DETROIT, Oct. 22 (UPI) Ron Stackhouse, who was acquired by the Red Wings last night, scored one goal and assisted on two others tonight as Detroit overcame poor visibility and the Toronto Maple Leafs, 52.

title: TRADE TALKS FAIL TO REACH ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 United States and European common Market officials emerged from two days of discussions today with two different notions of the conditions under which the United States would be willing to lift its 10 per cent surtax on imports.

title: Patrolman Says All But 2 Of Colleagues Got Bribes
description: A New York City patrolman told the Knapp Commission yesterday that all but two of the 70 to 75 policemen he worked with in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn regularly took small bribes froM gamblers, towtruck operators, check cashers and supermatket operators.

title: Women's ORT Elects Jerseyan As President
description: MIAMI BEACH, Oct. 22Mrs. David M. Goldring of Maplewood, N. J., was elected president of Women's American ORT (Organization for Rehabilitation through Training) yesterday at the final session of the organization's biennial convention at the Diplomat Hotel.

title: Market Place: How Best to ray Broker's Salary
description: Should you reward Your broker when he makes a mistake in your behalf by letting him sell the losing shares, and buy you a new stock?

title: Leaders of Police Groups at Meeting Here Are Critical of the Corruption Panel
description: The Knapp Commission was criticized yesterday by heads of police forces and police associations who met with spokesmen for minority groups at a symposium that reflected the anxiety shared by conservatives and liberals about rising crime rates.

title: FREEZE LEGALITY UPHELD BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22A United States District Court upheld today the constitionality of the law on which the Phase Two controls program is based.

title: CHOMPION TO RUN IN INTERNATIONAL
description: LAUREL, Md., Oct. 22, Colonial Farm's Champion, a fourtime stakes winner this year, will represent the United States in. the $150,000 Washington D.C. International, on Monday at Laurel Race Course.

title: MASS OF STILL AIR OPPRESSES CITY
description: A great pall of stagnant air getting dirtier by the minute gave the city and a vast area of the Northeast a smothering embrace yesterday, lowering visibility and spirits.

title: LANSKY INDICTED BY LAS VEGAS JURY
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Oct. 22 (AP) Meyer Lansky, reputed financial expert of organized crime, was indicted with three other men by a Federal grand jury today and charged with conspiring to conceal and distribute about, S36million in unreported income from a hotel casino on the Las Vegas Strip.

title: Dr. Marina von Neumann Whitman
description: Professor of economics at the University of Pittsburgh. Regarded as an expert in the field of foreign investments.... Author of four books and numerous articles on economics, particularly Federal participation in economic affairs.... Former senior staff economist on the President's Council of Economic Advisers during 197071.... Economist for the Pittsburgh Regional Planning Association in 1962.... 36 years old.... Received a bachelor's degree from Radcliffe in 1956.... Master's and doctorate from Columbia.... Married to Dr. Robert F. Whitman, chairman of the English Department at the University of Pittsburgh.

title: Toll Collectors'
description: A union that represents Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority toll collectors said yesterday that its members had authorized a strike because of alleged inaction by the authority in controlling automobileexhaust pollution at its seven bridges and two tunnels.

title: U.S.Cardinal Deplores Arms Stockpiling
description: ROME, Oct. 22  Speaking in the name of the American bishops of the Roman Catholic Church, John Cardinal Krol of Philadelphia charged today that the accumulation of weapons by the United States and other countries is a violation of fundamental principles of justice.

title: Day on the Town Designed to Draw Tourists to the City
description: A new promotional program designed to attract tourists to New York City was announced yesterday by Mayor Lindsay and eight business and cultural leaders in the fogshrouded observation tower of the Empire State Building.

title: Court Order Halts Medicaid Cuts Here
description: A Federal judge here yesterday temporarily barred the state from reducing Medicaid care for hundreds of thousands of poor people in need of health services.

title: It's Breather Day for Big Five
description: No one expected anything different and no one took them seriously as the coaches of the top five college teams in the nation proved true to their profession by expressing deep concern over their games today. There hasn't been such an easylooking day for the leading powers within memory.

title: Kermit Gordon Public
description: President of the Brookings Institution since 1967 ... was a member of the President's Council of Economic Advisers in 196162, then until 1965 was director of the Bureau of the Budget.... Born in Philadelphia 55 years ago. Attended Swarthmore College and was a Rhodes scholar.... Was an economist and a consultant with the Office of Price Administration during World War II and the Office of Price Stabilization during the Korean war.... Was a professor of political economy at Williams College.... Has been a special assistant in the State Department's Office of Economic Affairs.

title: RUSKIN PRESENTS LOANFRAUD DATA
description: The possibility that more than $1.5million in mortgage money paid to borrowers from the Municipal Loan Program was obtained fraudulently is indicated by evidence presented to a City Council committee.

title: Celtics Win, 115108
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 22 (UP1)The Boston Celtics, playing for the final 161 minutes without Join Havlicek, erased a 12point thirdquarter deficit tonight and handed the Atlanta Ilawks their fourth straight boas, 115108.

title: William T. Coleman Jr.
description: Negro lawyer... born in the Germantown section of Philadelphia 50 years ago... Graduated summa cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania in 1941 and magna cum laude from Harvard University Law School in 1946 Law secretary to Supreme Court Justice Felix Frankfurter 19481949... His legal work led to the desegregation of Girard College in Philadelphia...Helped draft the brief that led to 1954 Supreme Court decision outlawing school segregation... Chairman of the White House Conference on Civil Rights in 1965... Served as consultant to Arms Control and Disarmament Agency.

title: Pistons Top Sums, 116109
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Oct. 22 (AP) The Detroit Pistons outscored the Phoenix Suns, 3718, in the third period, then held on for 116109 victory tonight.

title: New Fabric Cuts Garment Cost
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22A New York company says it has found a way to reduce by half or twothirds the labor cost of making panties, pantygirdles, bikinis and

title: Blackout on Poverty Job Facts
description: The politicizing of the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics seems to be gaining headway, despite fervent White House denials that anyone topside wants to tamper with the bureau's reputation for scholarly detachment.

title: Wonder Bread Denies False Advertising Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22 The maker of Wonder Bread, while conceding that the prod is not distinctively more nutritious than competing brands, has filed a denial of false advertising charges. with Federal Trade Commission.

title: Court Nominees Termed Nixon's Standby Choices
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 22Informed sources said today that President Nixon and Attorney General John N. Mitchell had intended to name Herschel H. Friday and Mildred L. Lillie to the Supreme Court. The sources said that the two men nominated last night, while highly regarded, were essentially fallback, or standby, candidates.

title: Maynard C. Nicholl Jr. Marries Helen Dale Kulik
description: Miss Helen Dale Kulik, a marketing representative for the Data Processing Division of International Business Machines Corporation, was married here yesterday after noon to Maynard Charring ton Nichol Jr., director of the Computer Services Divi sion of Werner Management Consultants, in New York.

title: Washington State Upsets Stanford, 2423 on Field Goal as Time Runs Out
Taub Gets Manpower Post
description: Elwood Taub a labor econ omist has been appointed ex ecutive director of the New York City Manpower Area Planning Council Jule M,. Sug arman City Human Resources Administrator and council chairman, announced yesterday. The new council is to prepare an annual plan for city, state and Federal authorities and to coordinate manpower programs of public and private groups.

title: Two Appointed at Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 23 (AP)Dr. Warren E. C. Wacker, director of University Health Services at Harvard, has an nounced the appointments of Dr. Paul A. Walters as assistant director and chief of training and Dr. Preston K. Munter as chief of psychiatry is the health services.

title: Steinkraus, as Usual, WillHead U.S. Riders at Garden's Show
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 23The United States Eques trian Team, winner of the important Nations Cup com petition at the Pennsylvania National Horse Show here, will send six riders into ac tion at the National Horse Show in New York. Thet earn will be headed, just as it has been for almost two decades, by Bill Steinkraus of Noroton, Conn., a fivetime mem ber of the Olym pic squad. In addition to Steinkraus, the N.S.E.T. rid ers announced today by Coach Bert Chapot of Neshanic Sta tion, N. J.; Carol Hofmann of Elmont, L. I., Neal Shapiro of Glen Cove, L. I., Joe Far gis of Vienna, Va., and Bob Ridland of Ranch Santa Fe, Calif.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: Business has long been ac customed to love and mar riage when they came in the form of clerical romance around the water cooler or the secretary who went to the altar with her boss.

title: Auburn Conquers Clemson, 35 to 13; Flynn Outstanding
Unbeaten Geneva Wins No. 6
description: Beaver Falls, Pa., Oct. 23 (UPI)A sophomore quarter back, Jack Duggan, passed for three touchdowns and ran 13 yards for another as undefeated Geneva trounced Grove City, 427. Duggan threw touchdown passes of 34, 37 and 51 yards to lead Geneva to its sixth straight victory. The last time Geneva did that was 1930.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Miss Michaud's Troth
description: WEST WARWICK, R. I.. Oct. 23The engagement of Miss Anne Marguerite Mi chaud, who is a harpist, to Gerard Gastonguay, a student at the Massachusetts College of Pharmacy in Boston, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. A. Sylvio Michaud, par ents of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Roland Gastonguay of Lewiston, Me.

title: For Young Readers; Bear Circus By William Pne du Bois. Illustrated by the author. 48 pp. New York: The Viking Press. $4.95. (Ages 5 to 8)
description: Hurrah! A children's book without social significance. That's a rare thing to find today, But then William Pane du Bois is a rare artistauthor, one of the most talented and stylish creators of children's books.

title: William P. Neacy, 73, Dies; Active in U.S. Bond Market
description: ROCICVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Oct. 23William P. Neacy, for many years active in the Unit ed States Bond market in New York City until his retirement in 1943, died yesterday in Nas sau Medical Center, East Meadow. His age was 73.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: ECONOMIC PROTECTIONISM began to develop Europe as Denmark announced a 10 per cent import sur charge and France asked the Common Market to agree on a bloc barrier to U.S. imports.... Hong Kong denied would impose reprisals to the U.S. textile quotas.... The Group of 10 ended meetings on the world monetary crisis in Paris with no solution in sight and scheduled further meetings in November.

title: REAGAN IS SEEKING STUDENT RAPPORT
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Oct. 23  Gov. Ronald Reagan has set out to try to establish more rapport with youth, specifically the new voters from 18 to 21 years old on the campus.

title: Editor Faces Trial
description: ATHENS, Oct. 23  Yannis Horn, publisher and editor of a Englishlanguage daily news paper, The Athens News, facest up to fiVe years in jail and a heavy fine for printing a front page headline the day after Vice President Agnew's arrival in Athens, proclaiming: Bombs, Recruited School Children Greet Agnew.

title: Penn State Routs T.C.U. By 6614, Sets Records
Attack on King Leaves Moroccan Jews Fearful
description: TANGIER, Morocco, Oct. 17 Places called Jews Beach and Jews River here attest a long history of Jews in Morocco that may be approaching an end.

title: The Nation
description: Until two years ago, the rep utation of Curtis Charles Flood rested on these facts: He was a slightly built, strikingly hand some,.300hitting outfielder who had won stardom and a $90,000 salary working for the St. Louis Cardinals. Then, in the fall of 1969, he decided to take on all of Organized Baseball in a court suit. By next summer, Mr. Flood may be known as the man who finally cracked the most restric tive agreement covering the rights of employes still in effect in the United Statesthe re serve clause.

title: A New Radar Aid Helps Ships Avoid Collisions
description: The radar was not prop erly used.

title: Verlon Walker Center Opens
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 23 (AP)The Verlon (Rube) Walker Leukemia Center, honoring the late coach of the Chicago Cubs, has been opened at Chicago Wesley Memorial Hospital. The 42yearold Walker, a Cub coach for 11 seasons, died of the blood cancer disease March 24.

title: In Bahia, it's living theater
description: So much of the color and life of the Brazilian city of Bahia has been harvested by Jorge Amado in his latest phase that one suspects he must be cutting the rowen in this, his latest tale. The wild, frolick ing pace we now expect from Amado is used here, however, to deflate one of Brazil's more vaunted myths, that of racial harmony. Even a casual look at some of the 19thcentury ideologies that have survived in Brazil will reveal the taint of Gobineau, and they often display an even fiercer viru lence.

title: The Nation
description: The scene recalled the days when Joseph Valachi took the McClellan Committee of the United States Senate on guided television tour through the labryinth of the Mafia... but this time the witness was a New York City patrolman tak ing the members of the Knapp Commissionand the publicon an extended cruise through the murky depths of police corruption.

title: More Than a Glance
description: IF the 9th New York Film Festival had shown noth ing else of value during its recent run at the Viv ian Beaumont Theater, it still would have justified itself by its presentation of Abel Gance's 4 hour Bonaparte and The Revolution, a mov ie that makes me more than a little penitent for all of the times I've called some thing an epic  most re cently Pier Paolo Pasolini's adaptation of The Decam eron.

title: Et A1.
description: Since 1951, some 20 biog raphies, critical studies, pamph lets and collections have ap peared that are totally con cerned with Fitzgerald and his work. What the editors have here gathered are the early poems, undergraduate humor (material from the Princeton Triangle shows), newspaper pieces, reviews of novels and various sketches; also reviews of his books by such contempo rary critics as Malcolm Cowley, John Peale Bishop, Mencken, John Chamberlain, William Troy, A feast for fans.

title: Letter to the Editor 6  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR: Anyone with a modicum of common sense knows that communal living is not going suddenly to transform peo ple's habits and values which have been ingrained for 20 or 30 years. I have talked with many people in communes Who recognize this fact, and who hope their children, or their children's children, will learn the human decency, love, understanding and sharing necessary for the survival of this world. David and Elena seem to have popped into The Community expecting Utopia and, finding less than their dreams, assumed the effort worthless.

title: Picasso After His Prime
description: NOWADAYS, texts about Picasso read like the Lives of the Saints which in spired earlier generations. The latest example of this devotional literature, John Richardson's introductory re marks for the catalogue of the Homage to Picasso ex hibitions now on view at the Saidenberg Gallery, 1035 Madison Avenue, and at Marlborough, 41 East 57th Street, is no better and no worse than the usual floods of praise that greet the ar tist at every new decade of his life. (Picasso will be 90 tomorrow; the New York birthday exhibitions are be ing held for the benefit of the American Cancer Soci ety.) Mr. Richardson sets forth the brief for canoniza tionPicasso's commanding role In the development of Cubism, his phenomenal pub lic success, his personal mag netism, even his longevitywith charm and some wit. And, in cataloguing the list of miracles Picasso is said to have performed, he does at least stop short of claim ing that the artist has ever changed water into wine.But, like all Picasso litera ture which is intended to keep the faith and curry fa vor with the aged master, it consists of tactful omissions and equally tactful failures in observation. In the roster of past woes and mistresses who have inspired Picasso's art, fr instance, Mr. Rich ardson pointedly ignores Francoise Gilot, whose re vealing memoir, Life with Picasso, greatly displeased the master. That episode in Picasso's life, concluded by his romance with Jacqueline Roque, his present wife, is passed over glumly as the previous grim regime.

title: Gierek's Reforms Facing Some Challenges
description: WARSAW, Oct. 23  With the approach of the Communist party's Sixth Congress in Poland a struggle is emerging between those pressing for a wide range of reforms and those un happy or fearful about the pace of the intended changes.

title: For Young Readers; Planet Of Junior Brown By Virginia Hamilton. 210 pp. New York: The Macmillan Company. $4.95. (Ages 11 to 15)
description: Junior Brown is a fat, black, hope less boy, a 300pound musical pro digy whose mother has untied the wires of the family piano. He sweats profusely, talks to himself, reaches out on the street to touch the faces of passing strangers and beats out his music lesson on the back of chair. He looks like Buddha and eats like Paul Bunyan.

title: Miss Downes To Be a Bride
description: NORWICH. Conn. Oct. 13  Miss Rae Downes and Charles S. Koshetz, reporters for The Jersey Journal in Jer sey City, plan to, he married in January in New York.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Helen Maclnnes's last book, The Salzburg Connection, hit the bestseller lists promptly. So has her current entry, MES SAGE FROM MALAGA (Har court Brace Jovanovich, $6.95). These, of course, are elementary facts. Most Machines books fol low the same surefire format. A handsome, intelligent, athlet ic, patriotic Americanin Eu rope gets involved in es pionage. Romance accompanies the action. The American, though an amateur, acquits himself very well indeed. He represents the force of good against the evils of Commu nism.

title: Home Improvement
description: ALTHOUGH the thousands of items on display at this year's. National Hardware Show  it closed on Oct. 14 after a fourday run at the Coliseum here  included compara tively few products that were really new or radically improved, there were some interesting newmodel tools exhibited, and some notice able trends that should prove of interest to improvement minded homeowners and apartment dwellers.

title: Muddled Train Fare System, A Leftover, Plaguing Amtrak
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23Passenger train fares around the country are the same curious and inconsistent jum ble under Amtrak as they were under the private rail roads six months ago.

title: Crash Kills Football Player
description: SUMMERVILLE, S. C., Oct. 23 (AP)Harold William Sedivy Jr. of Summerville, a member of the University of South Caro lina football team, was killed today when his car crashed near here. The police said the 21yearold athlete was travel ing home for the weekend from Columbia when he apparently went to sleep. The car hit a tree.

title: Movies
description: CALL the cops and Philip D'Antoni may come running. The adventure loving producer who has given us such thrillers as Bullitt and the cur rent The French Connec tion  both dealing with lawmen out to corner crooks  is going to play cops and robbers again. This time, he will direct as well as pro duce. The movie, The Sev en Ups, will be based on his own screen story detail ing the reallife exploits of New York detectives Eddie Egan and Sonny Grossothe men whose efforts to crack a narcotics ring in spired The French Connec tion. The final script is now being written by Phillip Hirsch.

title: The Nation
description: At the United Nations, the issue was supposed to be China. But the debate was interrupted for four hours while delegates shouted bitter charges. In Wash ington, officials expressed con cern that the cordial atmosphere that has developed between Rus sia and the United States might be harmed.

title: Arabian Horse Prize In National's Contest
description: A purebred Arabian horse will be given away at the National Horse Show to com memorate Napoleon's 202d birthday, Officials announced yesterday. Napoleon always rodea chunky, magnificent Arabian horse into battle.

title: Minibus Debut Hailed in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 23 A fleet of orangeandwhite minibuses powered by natu ral gas made their debut here this week.

title: The Extravagant Gowns Made to Dazzle at Night
description: The Shah of Iran has to plan another party. Or the hostesses of America have to knuckle down with their guest lists and menus. Otherwise, those ruffled, rustling, extravagant evening dresses that have dominated the second week of spring fashion showings on Seventh Avenue will never get out of the closet.

title: 3,000 Fans, at Dulles, Wish the Redskins Lack
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23 (UPI)More than 3,000 exu berant Washington Redskins fans turned out at Dulles In ternational Airport to wish their undefeated team good luck against the Kansas City, Chiefs. The Redskins are seeking their sixth straight victory.

title: U.S. AIDES EASING DETERGENT STAND
description: Two Federal officials testify ing at separate Congressional hearings have indicated a soft ening of the Administration's month7old stand against the use of nonphosphate deter gents.

title: China's Neighbors Reassess Attitudes In Wake of Thaw
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23The Nixon AdminiStration's over tures toward Peking and the prospect of a Presidential visit there have set off a series of political shifts and realign ments in countries all around China, from North. Korea to Burma.

title: Trees That Have Helped To Make History
Bears Activate Lee
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 23 (AP)The Chicago Bears activated Buddy Lee from their taxi squad today as their only spare quarterback for tomorrow's game with the Lions at Detroit.

title: Nixon's Choices:
description: WASHINGTON  The Amer ican public was given a rare, fascinating and somewhat dis quieting glimpse into Presiden tial decisionmaking last week as Richard Nixon, swept up in another judicial selection crisis, finally settled upon Lewis F. Powell and William H. Rehn quist as his nominees for the Supreme Court.

title: Et A1.
description: Woody Allen could work up contemporary history into a sandwich order for the local deli (hold the Mao!). Most of the pieces here originally ap peared in The New Yorker. There's a parody of Albert Speer's memoirs, a funny ex amination of the Mafia, assort ed jibes at psychiatrists, guer rillas, Gertrude Stein's circle, rabbis, private eyes and much, more more. Mad magazine ma terial at its best.

title: When Fantasy Goes Too Far
description: PARISAll troubled eras have had their share of fanciful individuals. One finds numerous examples in a recent study by Pierre and Renee Gosset en titled: Explosive Epoques in History. However, originality in behavior or clothing must not necessarily be at tributed to a fertile imagination at all times. There is even a certain antinomy between outwardly expressed fantasy, often useless and of a rather shabby nature, and the opulence of the imagi narysource of all creation and life.

title: Race for Westchester District Attorney's Post Is a Bitter One
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 23The election of a district at torney in heavily Republican Westchester County is usually a rather routine affair, as is the campaign that precedes it. it.

title: Reader's Report
description: Seymour Epstein is the rare novelist who knows how to create action out of what people are, as well as what they do. The external, activity in his lat est book  the rupture of a marriageis only a prelude to an interior adventure, a quest that the author conducts with wit and discerning intelligence.

title: Tennessee Harrier Scores
description: PINE MOUNTAIN, Ga., Oct. 23 (AP)Neil Cusack of East Tennessee State University was the top winner today in the ninth annual Callaway Gardens crosscountry meet at Pine Mountain. Cusack ran the col lege division's sixmile course in 27 minutes 8 seconds.

title: ORIOLES SCORE, 84, OVER YOMIURI GIANTS
description: TOKYO, Oct. 23 (AP)  The Baltimore Orioles, opening an 18game tour in the Far East, whipped the Japanese cham pion Tokyo Yomiuri Giants, 8 4, today.

title: Photography
description: ONE of the very few positive effects of the Metropolitan Museum of Art's generally dis astrous Harlem On My Mind exhibit a few seasons ago was its rediscovery of the work of black photog rapher James Van DerZee. His exposure in that show led to overnight acclaim, for Van DerZee, who began his photographic career in 1900 at the age of 14, had created in the subsequent 68 years a major archive documenting black life in New York City during this century.

title: 54% Back Nixon in Gallup Poll; Rating Is Highest Since January
A classic fish dish
description: Red wine with fish? At the Dinner of the Century Biarritz, a recent joint effort of some of France's best chefs, that's exactly how the outstanding dish was pre pared. Actually, braising fish in red wine is a classic approach. So down with taboos.

title: CRASH AND CROWD INJURE 6 FIREMEN
description: Six firemen received minor injuries last night in the quiet South Ozone Park section of Queens when their fire engine collided with a car and an angry crowd pelted them with rocks and bottles.

title: Usefulness of Laws Questioned at Drug Parley
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 23Dur ing an international symposium on drug dependence in Hong Kong this week the Thai dele gation displayed photographs showing the execution of a heroin producer. After the man was tied to a post, a police offi cer shot him through the back with a submachine gun.

title: MINDSZENTY GOES TO VIENNA TO LIVE
