title: WheelingPittsburgh
description: The Wheeling  Pittsburgh Steel Corporation had a third quarter loss of $3.8million, compared with a profit of $487,000, or 8 cents a share, in the 1970 period.

title: SOCAL PROFITS UP 15% IN QUARTER
description: Mostly good earnings news, mixed with a little bad, con tinued to flow from the oil in dustry yesterday.

title: Orioles Beat Yomiuri Giants
description: SENDAI, Japan, Oct. 27 (UPI) Mark Belanger drove in four runs with a pair of triples and Pat Dobson pitched a three hitter today as the Baltimore Orioles scored their third con secutive victory in Japan with a 101 rout of the Yomiuri Giants.

title: Bridge Over L.I. Sound Backed by Court
description: The Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority won the consent of the State Supreme Court yes terday to proceed with its plans for a bridge over Long Island Sound between Rye, in Westchester County, and Oy ster Bay, L. I.

title: KNICKS DROP 2D TO HAWKS, 11096, ON COLD SHOOTING ExNew Yorkers, Bellamy and Williams, Make Key Victory Contributions
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 27  The Knicks put themselves into deep hole with three quarters worth of atrocious floor shoot ing tonight and then, when they found the range in the fourth, could not overcome their selfimposed handicap as they lost to the Hawks at Alex ander Memorial Coliseum, 11096.

title: Tito to Visit Nixon in Capital Today
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27  President Tito of Yugoslavia arrived today for the start of a weeklong visit to the United States.

title: DOW OFF 11TH DAY WITH LOSS OF 8.98
description: The stock market continued in a fullscale retreat yesterday as uncertainty about the eco nomic outlook was compound ed by news that a majority of leading economic indicators de clined in September.

title: MORE CANADA BANKS JOIN PRIMERATE CUT
description: TORONTO, Oct. 27 (Canadi an Press)Four more banks in cluding the Royal Bank of Canada, the nation's largest joined others today in reducing, their prime lending rate to 6 per cent from 6 per cent starting next Monday.

title: Murphy's Deputy Says Rotten Apple Concept Cuts Public Confidence in Police
description: The Police Department's sec ondhighest official assailed the rotten apple concept of po lice corruption yesterday and declared that such a view had led to a breakdown in public confidence in the ability of the police to control corruption in the department.

title: Standard Oil and Subsidiary Indicted for Coast Oil Spill
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 27 (AP)A Federal grand jury in dicted today the Standard Oil Company (California) and a sub sidiary, the Chevron Shipping Company, on charges of pollut ing San Francisco Bay in an oil spill last January. United States Attorney James L. Browning Jr. said the indictment had been brought under the Refuse Act of 1899, which carries a fine for corporate defendants of not more than $2,500 nor less than $500.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: VETERANS ISSUE TROUBLING HANOI
description: SAICON, South Vietnam, Oct. 27Previously my wife and I were in love. But be cause of the antiU.S. task I had to go far away. Recently I was able to return home and found that my wife had had a child by another man and that the child was four years old. I was very hurt. I hope you can give me some ad vice.

title: JOHN MANUEL CUETO
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27  John Manuel Cueto, an execu tive of Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, Inc., the advertising agency, died apparently of a heart attack here yesterday. He was 30 years old and until recently had lived in Manhas set, L. I.

title: News of Dogs
description: Two Gilbert and Sullivan fans, Ann Seranne and Bar bara Wolferman, have the very model of a modern canine kennel in their May fair Yorkie House at Newton, N. J.

title: MRS. FRANK SADLIER
description: Mrs. Neva Hecker Sadlier, the widow of Frank X. Sadlier, a textbook publisher, died in Presbyterian Hospital on Tues day after a long illness. She was 89 years old and lived at 825 Fifth Avenue.

title: Thant Names Unit To Visit Jerusalem; Israel Is Opposed
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 27Secretary General Thant has chosen the United NationS delegates of Ar gentina, Italy and Sierra Leone for a commission to check into the Israeli Government's hous ing and population policies in the former Jordan area of Jer usalem, authoritative sources disclosed today.

title: Julius Moskowitz Is Dead at 66; ExCouncilman From Brooklyn
description: Former Councilman Julius S. Moskowitz of Brooklyn died of a heart attack in Jerusalem on Oct. 10. He was 66 years old and lived at 1773 51st Street, Brooklyn.

title: The New York Times Co.
description: The New York Times Com pany reported thirdquarter consolidated net income of $1,808,000, or 16 cents a share, down from the yearearlier $2,547,000, or 23 cents a share. Revenues rose to a record of $67,262,000 from $64,903,000 in the 1970 third quarter.

title: Soviet Official Leaves; India Hints New Arms Aid
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 27Ni kolai P. Firyubin, a Soviet Deputy Foreign Minister, left New Delhi today after a series of talks that apparently included discussions of Soviet military commitments to India in the event of an IndiaPakistan war.

title: GAINS REGISTERED IN WHEAT FUTURES
description: Profit taking in the last hour trimmed early gains of nearly 4 cents a bushel in wheat fu tures and of 2 cents a bushel in soybeans on the Chicago Board of Trade. Corn futures, down nearly 1 cent at one time, improved late in the session and closed on a mixed tone. Oats futures rose.

title: Clark Aids Bullets
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 27 (AP) Archie Clark scored 18 points in his Baltimore home debut and teamed with Jack Marin, who scored 26, to lead the Bullets to a 12898 victory over the Detroit Pistons tonight.

title: White Side, Black Side, All Around the Town
description: They swooped down on us suddenly, five or six boys about 12 or 13 years old, and I hardly felt the blow to my face as I held on to my pocketbook. Wait, you can have my money. Let me have my papers, I cried and that brought the blow. They ran into the night, a flash of white sneakers and blue jeans, as I picked up the notebook they'd dropped, and my friend stood, shaken and whitefaced. She lost $75; I had only a dollar in my purse.

title: Japanese Offer Curbs
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 2  Top Japanese business leaders yes terday declared their willing ness to limit the growth of Japanese exports to Europe.

title: Nathaniel Bogdanove, 43, Dies; Was a Vice President at Chase
description: Nathaniel Bogdanove, a sec ond vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank, died appar ently of a heart attack on Tuesday evening at Beekman Downtown Hospital. He had been stricken at the Port Au thority TransHudson station.

title: Condors Down Cougars
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Oct. 27 (AP)A thirdquarter surge led by George Thompson gave the Pittsburgh Condors a 131121 victory over the Carolina Cou. gars tonight. Thompson scored a total of 31 points.

title: Indian Bureau Aide Resigns in Dispute On Resources' Use
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Leon F. Cook a Bureau of Indian Affairs official, has submitted a letter of resigna tion accusing Commissioner Louis R. Bruce of condoning the continued loss of Indian land, water, and natural re sources.

title: Vote Yes in New York
description: The temptation in this offyear election in New York State, with no major Federal or statewide contests and only a few local ones, is for voters to stay home. There are, however, three important questions on the ballot, each of which should receive an affirmative answer.

title: British Tour by Oistrakh Is Canceled by Moscow
description: LONDON, Oct. 27Three London concerts by the Soviet violinist David Oistrakh, sched uled for next month, have been canceled in retaliation for Brit ain's expulsion of Soviet of ficials.

title: Intervention in Currencies Is Seen Hurting Business
description: A disruption of trading on foreignexchange markets around the world is putting a damper on international busi ness activity, a leading United States banker warned yes terday. In a talk to a group of Italian businessmen in Milan, Walter H. Page, president of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York, as serted that uncertainty and rampant official intervention have seriously impaired the ability of the markets to per form their economic function efficiently.

title: A CAMBODIA CHIEF SEES VOTING SOON
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Oct. 27Acting Premier Sisowath Sirik Matak affirmed today that the Government considered its suspension of Parliament as very temporary and pledged that it would act very speed ily to restore democratic rule.

title: Senegalese Offer Exciting Dance Card
description: A superb African dance ensemble with an exciting program  the Senegalese National Dance Company from Dakaropened the sec ond week of the Brooklyn Academy of Music's Afro Asian Festival on Tuesday night.

title: Big Board Says Expenses Topped 9Month Revenues
description: The New York Stock Ex change disclosed yesterday that its expenses exceeded it reve nues by $17,720,800 after taxes in the first nine months of 1971. In a management report to the membership, the exchange indi dicated that special items the costs of liquidating some member firms that failed totaling more than $32million had been responsible for the imbalance.

title: Stars Win 5th in Row
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 27 (UPI) JeanPaul Parise and Dean Prentice scored Minnesota goals tonight to give the North Stars their fifth straight victory, a 21 trimuph over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Ray May, a 26yearold bachelor, has three teenage sons, each a recent problem child. He also visits a grade school in a Baltimore ghetto three days a week to serve a father figure for the young boys. In Washington Ray Schoenke is developing, and trying to raise funds for, a com prehensive program for innercity youth, primarily children from the poverty areas. In between persuading businessmen and government officials to work with him, Schoenke buys tickets for Redskin football games and gives them to the kids he's trying to help.

title: TV: Informal Chancellor Keynotes N.B.C. News
description: If Walter Cronkite is ev erybody's father, what does that make John Chancellor?

title: St. Regis Paper
description: Thirdquarter earnings of the St. Regis Paper Company fell 44 per cent to $3.9million, or 28 cents a share, from $7mil lion, or 50 cents a share, in the 1970 quarter. Revenues rose to $223.6million, from $214.8 million.

title: Shift Weighed in Relief Incentive Plan
description: The State Department of So cial Services said yesterday that in view of objections to a proposed welfare experiment Mayor Lindsay and others have attacked as a browniepoint scheme some alternatives have been considered.

title: ROGERS BIDS SENATE VOTE OKINAWA PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 Secretary of State William P. Rogers urged the Senate today to approve a treaty relinquish ing American control over Okinawa as a necessary step toward maintaining a viable and harmonious relationship with Japan.

title: Gannett Adds 2 Papers
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Oct. 27 (UPI)Gannett Company, Inc., announced today that it had agreed to purchase the News Press Publishing Company of Fort Myers, Fla., for $14.6 million in cash and notes.

title: LEON B. ALLEN
description: RAMSEY, N. J., Oct. 27 Leon B. Allen, senior partner of Gillen & CO., 120 Broadway, New York, member of the New York Stock Exchange and in vestment banking concern, died yesterday in Valley Hospital, Ridgewood. He was 80 years old and lived at 428 Darlington Avenue.

title: Mexican Bus Plunge Kills 8
description: PALMAR CHICO, Mexico, Oct. 27 (UPI)Eight persons died of injuries suffered when a bus plunged off a wet road into a 400footdeep gully, the police reported. The police said the bus had been overloaded, carrying more than 50 passen gers.

title: ForemostMcKesson
description: ForemostMcKesson, Inc., the nation's largest wholesale distributor of pharmaceuticals, had sales of $470,191,000 for its second fiscal quarter ended Sept. 30, with net income at $7,835,000, or 52 cents a share.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Fischer Victory Dazzles Fans of Chess in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27The at mosphere in Moscow's Central Chess Club was subdued to night as fans, hunched over boards, went over the moves in the game in Buenos Aires that gave Bobby Fischer of the United States the final victory over Tigran Petrosian and a chance to challenge Boris Spassky for the world title.

title: Donaldson Asserts That Negotiated Fees Have Been Detrimental
description: William H. Donaldson, chair man of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Inc., charged yester day that negotiated sales com missions had been detrimental to the stock market.

title: ALICE H. LEWIS, 76, FORMER MISSIONARY
description: Alice Hudson Lewis, a former missionary to China under the Presbyterian Board of Foreign Missions, died Sunday at her home in Philadelphia. She was 76 year old.

title: Radioactive Sands Linked to Higher Death Rates
description: DENVER, Oct. 27A study of birth and death records in the Grand Junction, Colo., area where radioactive sands from uranium processing mills were used in construction projects, shows increased genetic prob lems, higher cancer rates and lower birth rates than those of the rest of the state.

title: Sato Survives Two Tests in Parliament
description: TOKYO, Oct. 27Premier Eisaku Sato's Cabinet rebuffed its critics tonight by beating back two noconfidence mo tions in the lower house of Parliament.

title: Cars Bombed in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 27 (AP) Two more American cars were firebombed by anti Communist demonstrators to day, bringing to 38 the number that have been attacked since early this month. No injuries were reported.

title: U.S. GOLD STOCK OFF $2MILLION IN MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)Despite President Nix on's ban on gold payments, the United States gold stock de clined by $2million in Septem ber, the Treasury Department reported today.

title: Gains Forecast in Genetic Intelligence
description: ALBANY, Oct. 27A Mich igan biologist has advanced the thesis that, contrary to pre vailing opinion, current trends in reproduction indicate that more intelligent people will outbreed the less intelligent.

title: Italian Retains Ring Title
description: SAN REMO, Italy, Oct. 27 (AP)Antonio Puddu of Italy outpointed the French challen ger, Claude Thomias, and re tained his European lightweight boxing crown in a 15round bout tonight.

title: News Analysis
description: Evidence is mounting that a principal goal of President Nixon's economic program  breaking what Treasury Secre tary John B. Connally has called the inflationary psychology is not being achieved.

title: School Bus Crash Hurts 36
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 27 (UPI)Thirtysix persons were injured today when a school bus and an automobile collided on a recently constructed bridge carrying a rural road over Interstate 81 about 10 miles west of here.

title: MARIJUANA CALLED HARMLESS TO BODY
description: New York City's deputy chief medical examiner testified yes terday at a hearing on victim less crimes that extensive sci entific research had shown marijuana to be physically harmless.

title: Mrs. Noble, on 81, Takes Garden State Golf Event
description: ESSEX FELLS, N. J., Oct. 27 Mrs. James Noble of Morris County carded a 41, 4081 to day to win the final Garden State Women's Golf Associa tion tournament at the Essex Fells Country Club. Mrs. Noble paced a field of 41 over the 5,783yard, par37, 3875 course.

title: Survey Finds 50% Back Liberalization Of Abortion Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 General concern over popula tion growth has become so in tense, a new Federal study shows, that half the public now favors liberalization of restric tions on abortion.

title: Wage Board Reported to Favor 56% Level for Phase 2 Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27  The new Pay Board is likely to adopt a flexible guideline allowing wages to rise by an average of 5 to 6 per cent in Phase Two of President Nix on's economic stabilization program, several sources close to the board indicated today.

title: 230th Homicide in D.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 27 (UPI) An 82yearold woman, Miss Elta Miller, found murdered in her apartment here last night, raised the number of homicides in the District of Columbia to 230two more than were re corded in all of 1970.

title: Dalton Is Hired to Rebuild Angels
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Oct. 27 Harry Dalton, the man gen erally credited with building the Baltimore Orioles into a baseball power, became execu tive vice president and gen eral manager of the Califor nia Angels today.

title: Morality and Controls: I
description: ELY, Vt.Most discussion of the wageprice freeze and the coming Phase II controls has been strictly economic and operational: were they needed, will they work, how will they operate. I have recorded my own op position to them in three columns in Newsweek.

title: Story Theater to Switch To Saturdays on Nov. 13
description: Story Theater, the critically acclaimed syndicated series, is being moved from its regular 7:30 P.M. slot on Mondays on Channel 7 to Saturdays at 7 P.M., starting Nov. 13. Any thing You Can Do, a game show, will move from its Sat urday time slot at 7:30 P.M. to Mondays at 7:30 P.M.

title: Violence in Florida
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Oct. 27 (UPI)The police killed a black shoplifter today and chased one of his companions into a house, where a crowd gathered and began pelting officials with rocks and bottles.

title: Fought Good Fight, Nationalists Here Say
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 27  Yuchi Hsueh con templated with heavy heart today the imminent closing of the Chinese Nationalist Mission to the United Nations.

title: Nationalists Determined to Make Best of a Tough but Not Irreparable Situation
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Oct. 27  While conceding that the status of their Government has plum meted, Chinese Nationalist of ficials stressed their determina tion today to make the most of a new situation they called tough but not irreparable.

title: 44 Cars in Florida Crashes
description: PLANT CITY, Fla., Oct. 27 (UPI)At least one person was killed and 10 were injured today in two chainreaction accidents involving 44 vehicles in heavy fog on Interstate Route 4 west of here. The Highway Patrol closed off the highspeed, lim ited access highway, cluttered with debris for a mile and a half in the westbound lanes.

title: Jets Reach San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Oct. 27 (UPI)Two American Airlines jets arrived here tonight from Havana, carrying 221 passen gers who were hijacked to Cuba Monday aboard one of the carrier's Boeing 747 air craft.

title: Protest Vessel to Sail
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Oct. 27 (AP)A Canadian group opposing the nuclear test said today that a protest vessel would sail tomorrow for Am chitka and would anchor just outside the threemile limit in hopes of persuading Washing ton not to go through with the blast.

title: Learning the Law From Women's View
description: While some women have taken to the streets to cru sade for women's rights, a group of women law students at New York University has taken to the classroom to fur ther the cause.

title: A CATHOLIC JOINS ULSTER CABINET
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 27A Roman Catholic was unexpectedly appointed to day to the Cabinet for the first time in 50year history of Northern Ireland.

title: Firkusny Program: Pianist at His Top
description: Rudolf Firkusny comes with a guaranteedtoplease label, money back if not satisfied. This fine Czechoslo vak artist plays with exquisite refinement. He never has been one of the keyboard thumpers, anxious to knock an audience dead. Instead he tries, always, to bring out the poetry of the music in a kind of revealed wisdom passing from composer to the audience through the ideas of the performer.

title: I.M.F. Chief Critical
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 27 (Reuters)PierrePaul Schweitzer, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, said today the United States' efforts to correct its balance  of  payments deficit posed a threat of serious dis ruption of world trade and cur rency relations.

title: The Food Is Rich, Now That She Isn't Poor
description: People work hard at cooking for many reasons: to gain status, to enjoy them selves, to earn a living, to win a man, and, sometimes, to seduce a woman. But almost certainly the most respect able motive for a strong interest in the elaborate preparation of food is hunger. Mrs. L. McDonald Schetky, who is now the wife of a successful metal lurgist and demonstrates classic French cooking in America for the Cordon Bleu School of Paris, traces her first real passion for cooking to a prolonged peri od on a near starvation diet.

title: Merrill Lynch Chairman Backs a Broadening of StockQuote Program
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27  Donald T. Regan, chairman of the board of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., proposed today that the stock markets he made even more competitive than at present.

title: Inquiry May Start Flood of BurglarAlarm Refunds
description: In what some consumerlaw experts said was the first such ease they knew of, Judge Ed ward Thompson began a con sumerfraud hearing yesterday irr Civil Court that could ulti mately bring refunds to thou sands of New Yorkers who bought an allegedly shoddy burglar alarm in the last two years.

title: 3 Companies Are Planning A Comeback for Coal Gas
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 27 (UPI) Gas manufactured from coal, which was largely dispaced bye natural gas in the United States nearly half a century ago, may make a comeback.

title: Leonas Bistras, Premier Of Lithuania 192526, Dies
description: Leonas Bistras, Premier of Lithuania in 192526, died on Oct. 22, the Lithuanian Con sulate General reported yester day. He was 80 years old and lived in Kaunas.

title: Backed by Arizona Bar
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Oct 27 (AP) The State Bar of Arizona yes terday unanimously endorsed the nomination of Mr. Rehnquist and called for his confirmation by the Senate.

title: Celtics Trounce Rockets
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP) Sharpshooting Jo Jo White scored 31 points as the Boston Celtics trounced the Houston Rockets tonight, 10897. Elvin Hayes of Houston was held to three field goals.

title: Uncertainties Cited
description: Burlington Industries, Inc., the country's largest diversified textiles manufacturer, reported yesterday a substantial decline in net income in its fiscal year and final quarter ended Oct. 2.

title: Volkswagen, in Outlay Cut, Cancels Orders for Tools
description: WOLFSBURG, West Ger many, Oct. 27 (AP)Volkswa genwerk, A.G., has canceled large orders for machine tools in line with its new program of drastic reductions in capital spending, a company spokes man said today.

title: News Analysis
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 27By invit ing Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin to be the first Soviet head of government to visit Canada, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau opened the road to a polite if uneasy friendship. But the close relationship of which they spoke, based on solid trade and mutual trust, may be a long, arduous pursuit. The eight  day visit that ended in Toronto yester day pointed out some similarities between the two countries. It was, how ever, the points of strain that were highlighted. The most notable strain involved the strong antiSoviet feeling of Jewish and Eastern European migr groups whose protests made extreme protective mea sures by the Canadian police necessary.

title: FederalMogul Corp.
description: DETROIT, Oct. 27 (AP) The FederalMogul Corporation reported today earnings for the third quarter of $3.3million, or 57 cents a share, up from $2.7million, or 47 cents a share, in the 1970 period.

title: Suit by 7 Jail Inmates Here Charges Illegal Detention
description: Seven inmates of the Queens House of Detention for Men filed a suit in Federal Court yesterday, charging that the warden and Department of Correction officials were hold ing them illegally in adminis trative detention.

title: JEERS STILL RING IN CASTER'S EARS
description: Rich Caster is learning that boos are as difficult to handle as passes, and are much crueler.

title: Top Aides Called Incompetent
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 27 (AP) Alfred Perlman, former presi dent of the Penn Central, has asserted that he could not do his job effectively because several key executives at the financially troubled line were incompetent.

title: Planning Group Endorses Transportation Bond Issue
description: The Regional Plan Associa tion endorsed the $2.5billion state transportation bond issue yesterday, but only as a stop gap measure in any longrange plan to solve the state's trans portation problems.

title: SLIGHTLY OVER 6% SET FOR U.S. ISSUES
description: The Treasury Department, working in a credit market at mosphere this week that seemed to have lost much of its recent spark, announced plans yester day to offer sevenyear notes and 15year bonds yielding somewhat more than 6 per cent.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Canucks Deadlock Leafs
description: TORONTO, Oct. 27 (UPI) Dune Wilson scored Vancou ver's first shutout since it en tered the National Hockey League two years ago and Ber nie Parent registered his first whitewashing tonight as the Toronto Maple Leafs and the Canucks played a 0.0 tie.

title: Gunmen Kill Policeman
description: BELFAST, Oct. 27 (UPI) Gunmen killed a police sergeant and seriously wounded a police constable tonight.

title: Tuesday Night Fights
description: Miami Beach  Vicente Rondon, 175 pounds, Venezuela, knocked out Gomeo Brennan, 167, the Bahamas, 13 rounds; Rondon re tained World Boxing Association lightheavyweight championship.

title: Senator Gravel Seeks to Delay Jury Study on Pentagon Papers
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27Lawyers for Senator Mike Gravel, Demo crat of Alaska, sought today to halt a Federal grand jury in vestigating the release of the Pentagon Papers until it can be established that the Sena tor's constitutional privilege of free Congressional debate was not being violated.

title: Mary S. G. Hoffman Wed in Rome
description: Miss Mary Stacy Geoffroy Hoffman, daughter of Mrs. Peter Boric of New York, Stockbridge, Mass., and Quogue, L. I., and the late George Geoffroy Hoffman, was married In Rome yester day at noon to Luigi Filippo Mazzone, son of Mr. and Mrs. Luigi Mazzone of Rome. The civil ceremony at the Campidglio was performed by Cavaliere Fernando Gen tili.

title: TAPES AND FILMS ALLEGED TO LINK POLICE TO ADDICTS
description: The Knapp Commission pre sented tapes and a brief color film yesterday reportedly show ing eight New York policemen giving registered addict inform ers heroin and cocaine in re turn for liquor, cigarettes, a power saw, a minibike and other goods the policemen as sumed were stolen.

title: DRUG RAIDERS NET 192 IN 20 COUNTIES
description: Policemen and sheriffs' aides arrested 192 alleged drug of fenders, including a city patrol man and three upstate prison guards, and seized drugs val ued at $1.2milion in a drive yesterday in 20 metropolitan counties of New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: NIXON AND PEKING HOPING TO LIMIT SCOPE OF PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 Henry A. Kissinger, fresh from a second exploratory visit to Peking, said today that Presi dent Nixon and the Chinese leadership hoped to restrict their substantive talks during Mr. Nixon's forthcoming China visit to issues between the two countries and would refrain from discussing issues involv ing third partiesincluding the issues of SovietChinese rela tions and the war in Vietnam.

title: GUARD TO DOUBLE BLACK RECRUITING
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 The Pentagon announced today plans to double the number of blacks in the National Guard to 11,964 or 4.6 per cent.

title: Canada Voices Disquiet
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 27The Cana dian Government registered its deep sense of disquiet after being informed today of Wash ington's decision to go ahead with testing on Amchitka.

title: Stage: Musical Based on McCullers
description: For the first time in its 21 years of existence, the Circle in the Square has produced a musical. Called F. Jasmine Addams, it is based upon Carson McCullers's The Member of the Wedding, and it opened last night. Like Circle in the Square, The Member of the Wedding is also just 21. The theater has probably aged better.

title: Turkey's Premier Keeps Post After Resignation Is Refused
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct. 27 (Reuters)Premier Nihat Erim of Turkey today acquiesced to the refusal of President Cevdet Sunay to accept his resigna tion and that of his cabinet. He agreed to continue in office.

title: Notes on People
description: The Governor of Alabama, said the Governor of Ala bama, George C. Wallace, does not deal with under lings. It all started when Mr. Wallace requested a meeting with President Nixon to dis cuss busing to achieve deseg regation of the schools. Mr. Nixon replied that his com mitments did not permit such a long meeting in the near future, and offered to send Edward L. Morgan, White House deputy assistant for domestic affairs, to con fer with the Governor. Mr. Wallace wired back that he wanted a conference on a level where policy decisions could be made. If Mr. Mor gan shows up, Mr. Wallace said, he'll arrange with some of his own underlings to talk with him.

title: Knapp Says Any Person Named In Public Testimony May Testify
description: In a move that could sub stantially change the nature of the Knapp Commission hear ings on police corruption, Whit man Knapp said yesterday that any person who had been im plicated by name in public tes timony so far would be per mitted to appear and testify in his own behalf.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: A Pastoral Refuge Upstate
description: CLAYTON, N. Y.Although only six hours by automobile from New York City's mil lions, the ClaytonThousand Islands area retains a pas toral charm.

title: and in New Jersey as Well
description: Two immensely significant bond issues require voter approval in New Jersey: one for greenacres, which would preserve some of the Garden State's rapidly disappearing open space; the other for education, which would help meet New Jersey's scandalous deficiency in facilities for public higher education.

title: STANLEY BAYER
description: Stanley Bayer, librarian for the Blaine Thompson advertis ing agency since 1958, died Sunday in Roosevelt Hospital after a brief illness. He was 74 years old and lived at 250 West 77th Street.

title: OfficeSite Eviction Denied to Landlord
description: The city's Commissioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance set a new policy yesterday by turning down a landlord who had sought to evict residents of an apartment building but had offered no proof of a sub stantial number of tenants for the office building planned for the site.

title: Meat Inspectors Win Delay
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Five Federal meat inspectors were given 10 days yesterday to clear themselves of charges alleging payoffs involving Massachu setts meat processing firms.

title: Student Program Nov. 5
description: Four Fridays, the new se ries of special event programs for students, will have its next performance at the Museum of Modern Art on Friday, Nov. 5, from 7:30 P.M. to 11:30 P.M. The program will include pre mieres in drama and the dance and a revival of the 1930 film classic, The Unholy Three, with Lon Chaney, the actor's only sound production.

title: WILLIAM SELIGSON
description: William Seligson, a special ist in real estate law, died of a heart attack Tuesday. He was 72 years old and lived at 530 Park Avenue and on Darby Lane, East Hampton, L. I.

title: JERSEY STEPS UP CORRUPTION FIGHT
description: TRENTON, Oct. 28  The chairman of the New Jersey State Commission of Investiga tion today invited all develop ers and investors who have been victims of governmental corruption to come forward and report to county, state or Federal law enforcement offi cials.

title: Robert H. Porterfield, Founder Of Barter Theater, Dead at 66
description: ABINGDON, Va., Oct. 28 Robert H. Porterfield, founder and director of the Barter The ater, the state theater of Vir ginia, died today at Johnston Memorial Hospital. He had been admitted on Sunday, with pneumonia, and then had suf fered a heart attack. His age was 66.

title: Otvos, a Hungarian Conductor, Bows With Met's First Carmen
description: The Metropolitan Opera's ex pensively silly production of Carmen, with its Folies Ber gere chic and its antimusical point of view, is not an ideal work in which to make a con ducting debut. Gabor Otvs began Wednesday night's per formance, his first with the company, with a promising reading of the Prelude. The Hungarian conductor, who made his first appearances here with the New York City Opera three years ago, expert ly set up the necessary con trast between the bright and the brooding pages of the Prelude. All seemed in good hands.

title: Arthur D. Little Will Join New Distributing Venture
description: Arthur D. Little, Inc., a management and engineering consultant, is going into the warehousing and distribution fields with the D. H. Overmyer Company, one of the largest independent warehousing com panies in the country.

title: COMMONS VOTES, 356 TO 244, FOR BRITAIN'S MEMBERSHIP IN THE EUROPEAN MARKET
description: LONDON, Oct. 28By a vote of 356 to 244, the House of Commons approved British membership in the European Common Market tonight.

title: U.S. Doubts Foe Will Free Captives in Reciprocal Act
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 Administration officials said to day that they had no reason to expect the release of any Americans by the enemy in return for the freeing this Sun day of nearly 3,000 Vietcong prisoners in South Vietnam.

title: Russia's Air Chief Joins the Long List Of Visitors to India
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 28The Soviet air chief is to arrive in New Delhi on Saturday for a sixday visit that is expected to include talks on India's arms needs in the context of the present tense border confronta tion with Pakistani troops.

title: C.A.B. HEAD SEEKS FINANCING AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28  Secor D. Browne, chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, called today for a new Federal body to finance development of the next generation of air liners until they could go into profitable production.

title: 5 WON'T TESTIFY AT CRIME HEARING
description: Five alleged numbers racketeers operating in the BedfordStuyvesant area of Brooklyn appeared yesterday as witnesses at a state committee hearing on crime, but refused to testify, on grounds of pos sible selfincrimination.

title: COURT ASKED TO BAN DISPUTED HORMONE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI) Consumer groups asked a Federal court today to ban a controversial growth hormone fed to most cattle, because it has caused cancer in laboratory mice.

title: PRESIDENCY UNFILLED AT HORN & HARDART
description: The Horn & Hardart Com pany, operators of the Auto mats and other retail food es tablishments, will not get a new president as announced on Sept. 7.

title: Sunday Racing Approved
description: BOSTON, Oct. 28 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent signed into law yesterday a bill permitting horse racing and dog racing on Sundays.

title: Advertising:
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., Oct. 28The Association of Na tional Advertisers, meeting at the Homestead here, to day elected Marvin H. Kos low chairman and Earl A. Clasen vice chairman.

title: Opening of Police Files To Employers Is Urged
description: A Manhattan grand jury rec ommended yesterday that city and state legislative bodies con sider laws that would open con fidential police files here to permit employers to check the criminal background, if any, of prospective employes.

title: HOUSE DEFEATS NEW STUDENT AID
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28The House rejected today an Ad ministration plan to change the method of distributing Federal scholarships to college students and agreed to continue the present student aid programs, with only minor changes, for five more years.

title: South Vietnam Lets Reporters Visit P.O.W. Camp
description: CANTHO, South Vietnam, Oct, 28  As part of its steppedup efforts to demon strate what it terms a humani tarian policy on the prisoner ofwar issue, the South Viet namese Government allowed a group of newsmen today to tour its prisonerofwar camp here at Cantho in the Mekong Delta.

title: Faulkner Warns on Direct Rule
description: LONDON, Oct. 28Prime Minister Brian Faulkner of Northern Ireland warned today that a British takeover of the embattled province would lead to civil war.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: SOMERVILLE, N. J., Oct. 28 (UPI)The winning num ber in this week's New Jersey state lottery, selected here today, was 230806.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Judge Enjoins Connecticut From Reducing Welfare Payments
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 28  A Federal District Judge issued a temporary injunction this afternoon prohibiting the im plementation of a new state welfare program that would sharply reduce the financial aid to families with dependent children.

title: AN ITALYCHINA PACT ON TRADE DUE TODAY
description: ROME, Oct. 28  Italy plans to propose to China a program of technical and scientific co operation during toplevel trade talks opening here today, ac cording to her foreign trade minister.

title: Couple in Queens Win $25,000aYear Prize
description: A Queens couple won the grand prize of $25,000 a year for life in a special drawing of the New York State lottery yesterday.

title: Flyers Down Canucks, 32
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 28 (AP)Simon Nolet scored two goals tonight in leading the Philadelphia Flyers to a 32 vic tory over the Vancouver Canucks before 13,192 fans at the Spectrum.

title: Okinawa's Return Backed By Packard at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (Reu ters)David Packard, the Dep uty Secretary of Defense, said today that the Nixon Admin istration did not believe the return of Okinawa to Japan would impair the effectiveness of United States forces in Okinawa in the defense of western Pacific areas.

title: NIXON MAN SCORES U.S. VOTING BILLS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 The Justice Department, rep resenting the Nixon Adminis tration, came out strongly today against a series of Demo cratic bills to facilitate regis tration in 1972 for millions of eligible Americans.

title: Two Hotel Spokesmen Call Free Meals for Policemen a LongStanding Policy
description: Spokesmen for two of seven hotels singled out by the Knapp Commission asserted yesterday that they had simply been following a longstanding city wide tradition by providing free meals to New York police men.

title: PactWill Prohibit Piracy of Records
description: GENEVA, Oct. 28The pi rating of phonograph records and tape recordings, which is now costing the composers of the world $20million a year in royalties and is a much heavier drain on legiti mate record companies, will be forbidden under an inter national convention to be signed here tomorrow.

title: MARVIN R. SCOTT
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., Oct. 28 Marvin R. Scott, president of the Detroit Flame Hardening Company and of the Chicago Flame Hardening Company, died yesterday in Crittenton Hospital here. He was 61 years old and lived in Franklin, Mich.

title: Lima Beans and Pear Recipe
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an aster isk are followed by a recipe.

title: Australian: Leader Arrives In New York for 2Day Visit
description: Prime Minister William Mc Mahon of Australia said on his arrival here yesterday that trade relations and the rapid military and political changes in Asia would be the principal topic of his forthcoming dis cussions with President Nixon.

title: Radiation Danger in Debris Discounted
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 Three leading Federal officials told Congress today that the, 10,000 people living atop debris of uranium ore in Colorado were not being overexposed to radiation.

title: Peking Asks U.S. Pullout
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 28 Peking called today for the withdrawal of all American armed forces and military in stallations from Taiwan and the Taiwan Strait.

title: Moderate Approach Is Seen  The Globe and Mall, Toronto
description: PEKING, Oct. 28John Ste wart Service, a retired Ameri can diplomat who met Premier Chou Enlai yesterday, said he came away with the impres sion that Peking would play a moderate role when it as sumed its newly won seat at the United Nations.

title: Yankees Ask Speed on Stadium Plan
description: The New York Yankees de nied yesterday that they were issuing any ultimatum to City Hall, but they urged Mayor Lindsay in a letter to clarify his $24million plan to keep the baseball team in Yankee Stadium.

title: Idle Dice Scores by a Second In Open Jumper at Washington
City Democrats Start Rescue Operation for Transit Bond Issue
description: Amid widespread pessimism over prospects for the $2.5bil lion transportation bond issue, New York City Democrats pre pared a lastminute rescue operation for the bond issue yesterday.

title: PIER PANEL CHIEF REBUFFS CHARGES
description: The executive director of the Waterfront Commission yester day called recent charges against the commission by its former secretary reckless and false and said they were mo tivated by a desire for revenge.

title: 27th OTB Shop Opens Today in Wall St. Area
description: The horses will join the bulls and bears in the Wall Street district today when the Offtrack Betting Corpora tion opens a 15window shop at 62 William Street.

title: SENATORS AGREE ON WELFARE VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 Supporters and opponents of the Family Assistance Plan reached uneasy agreement today on a legislative timetable that should get welfare reform to the Senate floor next March but may not.

title: Whitney Screens Seven Strange Trips
description: The unfettered imagination as well as the sometimes fuzzy techniques of some of our largely unheralded ex perimental moviemakers are provocatively illustrated in Seven Strange Trips. This collection of short subjects opened yesterday at the Whitney Museum as the latest offering in its New American Filmmakers series and will continue through Wednesday.

title: POLICE SAID TO GET ROOMS AND MEALS FREE FROM HOTELS
description: Evidence that seven New York hotels gave policemen food and rooms worth $60,000 a year and that honest tow truck drivers are the targets of police shakedowns and har assment throughout the city was presented yesterday at a hearing of the Knapp Commis sion.

title: Music: Debut of a Trio
description: The Marlboro Music Festi val has spawned chamber music groups and a concent series in New York. Now comes the Newport Music Festival with its contribution.

title: 3 UPSTATE OFFICES FOR DRAFT RAIDED
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 28Intruders broke into Selective Service of fices in nearby Niagara Falls, Batavia and Geneseo last night, removing records from the files and tearing some of the records into shreds, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said here to day.

title: Executive Changes
description: Parke, Davis & Co., announced yesterday the election of Joseph D. Williams as executive vice president and chief operating officer of the inter national pharmaceutical firm. At the same time, Hazen L. Richardson Jr. was elected vice president of U. S. marketing, the position formerly held by Mr. Williams. Mr. Williams who is a director of Parke, Davis, is also a vice president of the parent organization, WarnerLambert Company, of which Parke, Davis is a subsidiary.

title: U.S. LISTS BRANDS OF ITEMS IT BUYS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 The General Services Admin istration disclosed today the brand names of 350 products, from air conditioners to whisk brooms, that are tested and purchased for Government use.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Julius KatzSuchy Is Dead at 59; Poles' Ousted ExU.N. Delegate
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Oct. 28Julius KatzSuchy, a former diplomat who left Po land early last year to find refuge in Denmark, was found dead today, apparently of nat ural causes, in his home at Aarhus, Jutland. His age was 59.

title: School Delays Registration
description: DETROIT, Oct. 28 (UPI)  Wayne State University has de layed the start of registration for its winter quarter by one week so it will know if it is possible to raise its tuition 20 per cent under Phase Two wageprice guidelines. Early registration was planned to be gin Nov. 8, but was delayed until Nov. 15two days after Phase Oneof President Nixon's economic plan ends.

title: French Academy Elects
description: PARIS, Oct. 28The French Academy elected Prof. Etienne Wolff, an internationally known zoologist, as a member today. He is taking the seat of the late Pasteur ValleryRadot, a physi cian who was the grandson of Louis Pasteur. The new mem ber, 67 years old, will be the Academy's fourth scientist.

title: Executives Get a Televised Preview of Phase Two but Find Little New
description: The National Association of Manufacturers came under criticism yesterday for as sembling businessmen for what they expected to be a preview of things to come under the Nixon Administra tion's Phase Two program to stabilize the economy.

title: Knicks Win, 11294; Reed Ailing
description: The Knicks finally found a patsy, the Houston Rockets, the team with the worst record in the National Basketball As sociation.

title: Combines Bid for Greek Air Contract
description: ATHENS, Oct. 28American and French militaryindustrial interests are competing over an ambitious Greek project for equipping, maintaining and re pairing commercial and mili tary aircraft and guided mis siles.

title: Knoedler Gallery Denies Reports It Will Be Sold
description: Amid widespread reports of a change in its ownership, Knoedler's, the oldest art gal lery in Manhattan and one of its most prestigious, has had its membership terminated in the Art Dealers Association of America, an organization of the country's leading deal ers.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: No team has been able to stop Ed Marinaro of Cornell when he was physically fit, and the report out of Ithaca, N. Y., yesterday was that No. 44 is in perfect shape for his recordbreaking effort against Columbia.

title: Underdog Cheered at Knapp Inquiry
description: George Burkert has been the only undercover witness to testify at the Knapp Com mission hearings with neither a suit jacket and tie, nor a wisp of guilt about his mo tives.

title: Cubans in New Orleans Shifted From Airport Inn to Navy Base
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 28 The Government shifted the happygolucky Cuban sugar delegates this evening from their motel to the bachelor of ficers' quarters at a naval air station at Belle Chasse, La.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28  With the open encouragement of President Nixon, Congress now seems determined to inflict some kind of financial retribu tion on the United Nations for the expulsion of Nationalist China.

title: Shell Oil's Profit Up 6%
description: The net income of the Shell Oil Company rose in the third quarter but declined for the first nine months of 1971.

title: Bank of America Trims Mortgage Rates to 7%
description: The Bank of America, the na tion's largest mortgage lender, announced yesterday a reduc tion in the minimum rate for financing singlefamily homes to 7 per cent from 8 per cent.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., Oct. 28 With hearings into adver tising now going on at the Federal Trade Commission in Washington, the major topic here today as the Association of National Advertisers began its annual meeting was the regulation of advertising. What might the Government do? What must the industry do?

title: JOSEPH W. MITTUCH
description: CARTERET, N. J., Oct. 28 Joseph W. Mittuch, a pharma cist here for 47 years and Mayor of the borough from 1934 to 1944, died yesterday in Perth Amboy General Hospital. His age was 76.

title: Economic Crisis in Chile Eroding Allende Support
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 28 An economic crisis with serious political implications is being grudgingly recognized as a reality by Chile's leftwing Government, as well as by Opposition parties and business sectors.
