description: LANCASTER, Pa., Oct. 30Lebanon Valley staged a secondhalf comeback to beat Franklin and Marshall, 2220, today and drop the Diplomats from first place in the Middle Atlantic Conference Southern Division.

title: G.O.P. HOUSE SEAT AT STAKE IN RACE
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 30In the only Congressional election in the nation on Tuesday, H. J. Heinz 3d, scion of the food family, will seek to keep the 18th Congressional District of Pennsylvania in the Republican fold.

title: Cougar II Captures Coast Grass Race; Five for Shoemaker
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Oct. 30 (AP)Chileanbred Cougar II captured the $100,000 Oak Tree Invitational on the grass at Santa Anita today as Bill Shoemaker rode his fifth winner of a sunny afternoon.

title: People's China at Turtle Bay
description: The United Nations is about to undergo perhaps the niost profound, transformation of its 26year history With the arrival of a delegation from the People's Republic of China. No matter how Peking's representatives conduct themselves, the glass house on the East River will never again be the same.

title: Pires Suffers Broken Elbow
description: Luis Pires, stopped by George Foreman at the end of four rounds Friday night, was in satisfactory condition yesterday in a New York hospital. Pires suffered a fractured left elbow in the bout and his arm was placed in a cast.

title: The Love Life Of a Cheltenham Lady By Dinah Brooke. 205 pp. New York: Coward, McCann & Geoghegan. $5.95.
description: This Cheltenham lady is into the Lady Chatterley syndrome: gentlewoman's sexuality awakened by uninhibited lover. Miranda moons around, Oxford after graduation, her libido so detached she feels remote even while being deflowered by an American studentActor, (I suppose I ought to stroke his hair.) Pregnant after this single encounter, she marries the actor, toward whom her disinterest verges on autism. Later, when she is temporarily left alone, she leaps into a bonejarring affair  this time, with an Italian actor that shakes loose her badly assembled psyche in a paroxism of guilt and fear.

title: Nastase Defeats Laver in 5Set Struggle to Capture $50,000 Embassy Tennis
description: WEMBLEY, England, Oct. 30 (Reuters)Ilie Nastase, the 25yearold Rumanian, pulled out an exciting victory over Rod Laver in the final of the $50,000 Embassy open tennis tournament tonight.

title: Proposals for Reform Likely to Gain
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30The Senate's unexpected rejection of the Nixon Administration's foreign aid authorization bill last night is likely to stimulate proposals for radically new approaches in United States assistance to other nations.

title: A tasty canard
description: The region of Nivernais abuts on Burgundy in central France. Its capital, Nevers, is perhaps best known to Americans as the site of the grim wartime flashbacks in Alain Resnais's film Hiroshima Mon Amour. But to a French cook, the term nivernais suggests vegetables, especially carrots, which grow in abundance in the area and have inspired a number of uncomplicated but spirited dishes, of which this duck recipe is a fine example. Purists should cut the carrot pieces to look like rather large olives.

title: Preps
description: EXETER,N. H., Oct. 30Oncebeaten Exeter won its fourth game by beating Worcester Academy, 2419 today. The passing combination of Jim Curry to Mike Lynch accounted for Exeter touchdowns of 67 and 5 yards.

title: Ideas Still Spark From Moses
description: OAK BEACH, L. I.Robert Moses sat on the porch of the little house he rents the other day, watching thousands of swallows cluster across the water over Robert Moses State Park on nearby Fire Island. This is the best part of the year on Long Island, he said, September and October. But nobody's here.

title: Moon Mist and Whippet Best Of 1,307 Dogs at Queens Show
description: There were two firsts at the New York State Armory in Jamaica, Queens, yesterday at the Queensboro Kennel Club's 43d fixture. A whippet, Ch. Stoney Meadows Moon Mist, was named best in show in field of 1,307 dogs for the first time and she was the first dog that Joy Brewster has ever handled to a top award.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: To the Editor:

title: GALBRAITH OFFERS PUN ON INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30Nationalization of the nation's largest defense contractors and Federal incorporation of big businesses now chartered by the states were proposed today at a conference on corporate accountability.

title: Job Done, Maccabees Of Brooklyn Break Up
description: Satisfied with police protection in their neighborhood and hopeful of presenting a less chaotic image of Crown Heights, the Maccabees, one of the best known of the city's civilian patrol forces, have disbanded.

title: STRIPMINING FOES ATTACK RADIO ADS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30An attack on the coal industry's institutional advertising has been filed with the Federal Communications Commission by critics of the spread of Appalachian strip mining and the rate of death and injury in the mines.

title: The Citadel Wins, 280
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Oct. 30 (AP)The Citadel scored three touchdowns in the first half today and routed Illinois State, 280, The Bulldogs piled up 523 yards in total offense.

title: L.I. Woman Killed by Rock Dropped Onto a Parkway
description: ROOSEVELT, L. I., Oct. 30A woman was killed on the Southern State Parkway last night when a 114pound slab of rock dropped from an overpass and crashed through the windshield of the car which she was riding.

title: Soviet Deputy Premier Gets East Berlin Post
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 30  The Soviet Union announced today that one of its Deputy Premiers, Mikhail T. Yefremay, had been appointed Ambassador to East Germany.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Fred A. Klingenstein's defense of the Martin Report (Oct. 17) concisely points out that report's fundamental weaknesses.

title: Aide Says Polaroid Move to Help South African Blacks Is Success
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Oct. 27  A project sponsored by Polaroid to counteract apartheid in South Africa from within the system is a success, according to a business executive who is in charge of it.

title: Rebuilding To Start at L.I.R. Area In Brooklyn
description: Long in the planning and demolition stage, the Atlantic Terminal urban renewal area around the Long Island Railroad station in Brooklyn is expected to sprout next spring with the start of construction of 800 housing units.

title: Stars, Leafs Tie, 11
description: TORONTO, Oct. 30 (UPI)Murray Oliver's goal at 3:29 of the third period enabled the Minnesota North Stars to tie the Toronto Maple Leafs, 11, tonight.

title: L.I. Republicans Are Turned On By Tuesday's OffYear Election
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Oct. 30Tuesday is an offyear election, but for the party machines, particularly in Suffolk County, it is as important an election day as Long Island has seen for many years.

title: MISSISSIPPI WINS FROM L.S.U., 2422
description: JACKSON, Miss., Oct. 30 (AP)Norris Weese, a sophomore quarterback, engineered Mississippi's ball control offense to perfection today as the Rebels beat heavilyfavored Louisiana State, 2422, in Southeastern Conference football game.

title: Canterbury Rally Gains Tie
description: NEW MILFORD, Coin., Oct. 30John McClure put Berkshire in front, 120, with touchdown rues of 94 and 7 yards in the first period today, but Canterbury rallied to score twice in the third quarter and earn a 1212 tie.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: To the Editor:

title: Texas Aggies Trim Arkansas, 17 to 9
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Oct. 30 Texas A. & M. turned three Arkansas errors into a 179 upset of the eighthranked Razorbacks tonight.

title: Stokes, Relinquishing Cleveland Mayoralty, Aspires to National Political Power
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 28Mayor Carl B. Stokes Is not on the ballot in the municipal election next Tuesday, but he is a candidatefor national political power.

title: BEAME DISPUTES JUSTICE COUNCIL
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame yesterday challenged a suggestion by Mayor Lindsay's Criminal Justice Coordinating Council that the only remedy for detention conditions is to take out of detention as many persons as possible.

title: Nation
description: WASHINGTON  In the current era of interestgroup politics, militant organizations have arisen to press a host of causes: black power or flower power; the liberation of women or homosexuals; opposition to foreign war or domestic pollution; equality for the man of red skin or blue collar.

title: Leonid I. Brezhnev signing communiqu in Paris.
description: PARIS, Oct. 30The Soviet Union and France called today for the convening of a European security conference next year, following, final arrangements on Berlin.

title: STANFORD VICTOR IN FINAL MINUTE
description: CORVALLIS, Ore., Oct. 30 (UPI)Don Bunce hurled two desperation passes for touchdowns today and helped Stanford move a step closer to the Rose Bowl with a lastminute, 3124 football victory over Oregon State.

title: The Nation
description: The lights burn until midnight, the blonde secretary desperately tries to keep up with the five lights winking almost simultaneously on the pushbutton telephone device on her desk. From an inside room, the voice of an investigator sounds abrupt and loud: I think you're being extorted. I think you ought to come down tomorrow and tell us all about it.

title: PassaicHudson
description: Powerful Lincoln, making a strong bid for Hudson County honors, rolled to 11 touchdowns yesterday in crushing Weehawken, 740, for the fifth victory in six games at Roosevelt Stadium Lincoln scored the first six times it had possesion and finished with a totals net yardage of 566.

title: Mary Adams, D. F. Eberhart To Wed Nov. 27
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 30Miss Mary Frances Adams, assistant director of the Martin Gordon Gallery in New York, will be married to David Fayssoux Eberhart on Nov. 27 in New York.

title: Reader's Report
description: Someone Great By Robert Grossbach. 205 pp. New York: Harper's Magazine Press. $6.

title: Mrs. Chisholm Sets Target For Presidential Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30 (UPI) Representative Shirley Chisholm said today that after testing the Presidential candidacy waters for five months, she has found the water is fine,

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Soviet Air Chief in India
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 30  The Soviet air chief, Air Marshal Pavel S. Kutakhov, arrived here today on a sixday visit to discuss defense requirements.

title: Letter to the Editor 7  No Title
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: OLD IRON CENTER BEING EXCAVATED
description: METSAMOR, U.S.S.R.From more than 4,000 years ago until about 780 B.C. a volcanic hill that rises here from a fertile valley skirting Mount Ararat was a Pittsburgh of the ancient world.

title: Photography
description: TO speed up and simplify making accurate exposures under the enlarger a new electronic computermeter has recently been introduced by Spiratone, Inc., 135.06 Northern Boulevard, Flushing, N. Y. 11354. It enables the user to get a correct exposure reading in seconds by averaging the printing density of the entire negative (the same way an exposure meter does for a camera), or it permits sophisticated sensitometric control by use of a spot reading technique. Called the Spiratone Enlarging Exposure MeterComputer, and priced at $19.95, the instrument has a sealed Cds cell and is not affected by line voltage variations. The manual supplied tells how to use it for also determining the proper contrast paper to use, or the variable contrast filter required, and it describes special techniques for dodging and burning in.

title: 51 Killed in Rumania As Mishap in Mine Sets Off Landslide
description: VIENNA, Oct. 30 (Reuters)Rumanian authorities tonight announced that 51 people were killed and 88 injured early today in a mining disaster at Hunedoara, about 150 miles northwest of Bucharest.

title: MARYLAND WINS FROM VIII 380
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Oct. 30 (AP)Al Neville threw two touchdown passes and Art Seymore ran for two others as Maryland trimmed Virginia Military Institute, 380, today.

title: Georgia U. Band Drops Dixie From Its Name
description: ATHENS, Ga., Oct. 30 (UPI)  The University of Georgia said this week that it was voluntarily dropping the word Dixie from the name of its marching band.

title: Wideopen spaces
description: In this sleek stucco and stone residence in New Jersey architect Donald Mallow designed a house so open that in many areas one seems to be more outdoors than in. Walls are largely nonexistent, mere screens of glass. And even the word room does not apply in the conventional sense. The owners, a family of five, asked for a large housewith a living roomentertaining complex, a kitchendiningandbreakkastroom section. a garage and service core, a chilldren's wing with playroom and a ??lster bedroom suite with study. Mallow saw the house as five ??terrelated buildings, nestled un??er the broad horizontal planes of he roof. Columns framed in glass and clerestory windows turn the ??ying and dining rooms into airy ??avilions while changing ceiling ??eights create cozy pockets here ??md there. The house wraps ??ound outdoor terraces that are ??et on several levels and studded with gardens, which could be con??dered a private park with swim??ning pool and barbecue area.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Although blacks are beginning to figure heavily in the contemporary mystery novel, very few are told from the black man's point of view. DEAD PIANO by Henry Van Dyke (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $5.95) is an exception, a novel about blacks written by a black. Van Dyke sets up a situation in which an upperclass Negro family in a wealthy suburb is invaded for ransom by three black militants.

title: Abel Goes Out With Tie
description: ST. LOUIS, Mo., Oct. 30 (UPI) Rick Foley, a rookie scored the first goal of his career in the National Hockey League to give the Philadelphia Flyers 44 tie tonight with the St. Louis Blues.

title: Armed Forces Urge Racer to Widen His Message
description: DETROIT, Oct. 30  The armed services have asked a drag strip champion who uses speed, performance and power to merchandise safe driving to G.I.'s overseas to expand his program to domestic bases.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: To the Editor:

title: THIEU TAKES OATH FOR 2D TIME, URGES SELFSUFFICIENCY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Oct. 31  Amid tight security, President Nauyen Van Thieu took the oath of office this morning for his second fouryear term and promptly sought to prepare the South Vietnamese for the departure of American combat troops.

title: Miss Laura Glekel Prospective Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Newton Glekel of New York and Palm Beach, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Laura Glekel, to Stuart R. Levine, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Levine of Bethpage, L. I.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Maybe Even a Third Act...
description: SOON now, I would like to see a play. I am thinking of something that isn't a memoir, isn't a few joined patches out of someone's autobiography, isn't a poetry reading, isn't a glancing reflection of an already glancing short story walked onto a stage and told to stand there quietly lest it unduly ruffle the customers. Something with a bit of body to it and maybe even a third act. You know?

title: Et Al.
description: Lewis Cotlow is an explorer and world traveler who has become interested in the fate of the last true primitive peoples. He has visited a number of themrevisited in several cases, for comparison's sake. His prognosis for their survival is poor. Those who have been integrated often lose all semblance of dignity and cultural support; those who are isolated on reservations are continually in jeopardy from the encroachments of civilization and decimated by civilization's diseases. Mr. Cotlow writes about these likable, hospitable, sad people with feeling; and one must agreeit's a damn shame.

title: W. and M. Bows, 3635
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Oct. 30 (AP)North Carolina's Tar Heels gambled on an extrapoint pass with two minutes left and made it to score a 3635 victory over William and Mary in a battle of offenses today.

title: Utah's Threatened Canyons: A Land That Once Was Sea
description: ONLY fourwheeldrive vehicles can master Elephant Hill. The milelong zigzag track has a 40 per cent grade and a Jeep is safe up to about 42 per cent. I looked down at the wheels from my front seat in the Jeep and saw that each was separately negotiating what seemed to be a ruined stone staircase. Unnerving.

title: AMHERST'S AERIALS TOPPLE TUFTS, 3514
description: MEDFORD, Mass., Oct. 30New England's leading smallcollege passer and a pair of speedy receivers spelled the difference as Amherst trounced Tufts, 3514, today.

title: Georgia Tech Wins, 210
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 30 (AP)Georgia Tech's vaunted defense stopped Duke cold today and used a blocked kick and a fumbled punt to help defeat the homecoming crowd of nearly 50,000.

title: Hartwick's Soccer Team Triumphs Over N.Y.U., 21
description: Hartwick College, the country's fourthranked soccer team, sent New York University to its first loss of the season, 21, yesterday at Ohio Field, in the Bronx. He was Hartwick's eighth victory against one defeat. N.Y.U. has a 711 wonlost tied mark.

title: Preps
description: SUFFIELD, Conn., Oct. 30Gil Timm and Scott Bevins starred today in Williston's 1356 rout of Suffield. Timm, the quarterback, ran for two scores and paged for two. Bevins caught one of the scor ing passes and kicked the conversion after all five Williston touchdowns. Williston is now 54.

title: GEORGIA WINS, 240, FROM SO. CAROLINA
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Oct. 30 (UPI)A reserve quarterback, James Ray, summoned into acRon when Andy Johnson was hurt, scored two touchdowns tonight as he led the Georgia Bulldogs to a 240 victory over South Carolina.

title: Tampa Tailors Airport as Much to People as to Planes
description: TAMPA, Fla., Oct. 30In this Florida citrus center there's a new airport that, travelers say, makes taking a plane trip pleasant again.

title: Fredericks Double Victor For Penn State Harriers
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Oct. 30 (AP)Penn State posted victories in two crosscountry meets here today, the United States Track and Field Federation Eastern Regional and the Pennsylvania Federation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: S. H. Hallowell Jr. Weds Elizabeth Stuart
description: BOSTON, Oct. 30  Miss Elizabeth Mabel Stuart, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harborne Wentworth Stuart of Boston and Essex, was married here this afternoon to Samuel Haydock Hallowell Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Hallowell of Beverly Farms. The Rev. Rollin J. Fairbanks and the Rev. Frederick Phinney performed the ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church.

title: Siani Catches 5 Scoring Passes
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 30 (AP) Mike Siani, a senior flanker, caught 12 passes for 288 yards and five touchdowns in a record performance for Villanova as the Wildcats defeated Xavier, 3327, tonight.

title: Maxwell Vols' Standout
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Oct. 30 (AP)Jim Maxwell, making his first start at quarterback for Tennessee, rallied a sputtering Vol offense today to a 383 victory over Tulsa in an intersectional football game.

title: Medicine
description: Last year, some 200,000 babies were born in the United States with genetic defects ranging from a cleft lip to mental retardation. Can such inherited disorders be cured by chemically altering the genes? Can we, for instance, replace a defective gene with a good one?

title: TEXAS AIR ATTACK TRIPS Sill., 2218
description: DALLAS, Oct. 30 (UPI)The Texas Longhorns, their ground game all but stymied by scrambling Southern Methodist defense, turned to the passing of Donnie Wigginton today to score a 2218 decision over the Mustangs.

title: Clocks Set Back To Standard Time
description: Daylight saving time ended at 2 A.M. today as most of the nation turned back clocks and watches to regain the hour lost when the system went into effect on April 25.

title: Post Puts Adelphi to 379 Rout As Carman Runs for 170 Yards
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Oct. 30 The strong running of Ron Carman and the steady quarterbacking of Gary Wichard wore down Adelphi's football team today as C.W. Post College scored a 379 triumph.

title: Canadiens BeatWings, 30, as Dryden Records 2d Shutout, Making 38 Saves
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 30 (UPI)The Montreal Canadiens scored three goals in less than four minutes in the second period tonight and went on to defeat the Detroit Red Wings, 3.0, as Ken Dryden recorded his second shutout of the season.

title: PRICE ENFORCERS EXPECT TOUGH JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 30 Officials of the Internal Revenue Service are saying privately that they are not, sure they can enforce price controls with the resources they are being given, although they are willing to try.

title: Royals Retain Farm Club
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 30 (AP) The Kansas City Royals said today they were renewing their working agreement with the San Jose farm club of the Class A California League.

title: Miss Shapse Fiancee Of Philip Fredericks
description: TENAFLY, N.J., Oct. 30Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Bernard Shapse have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Merrie Anne Shapse, to Philip Swart Fredericks, son of Mrs. Virginia Fredericks of Tenafly and Charles Fredericks Jr. of New York.

title: Uncertainty Dominates Market For Equity Securities
description: After a Jubilant summer celebration over Phase One of President Nixon's new economic program, the stock market has been sliding for most of the autumn in obvious disregard of popular forecasts of recovery for the national economy.

title: Bay State Democrats Elect
description: BOSTON, Oct. 30 (AP) The Massachusetts Democratic State Committee today elected State Representative Charles F. Flaherty of Cambridge as chairman.
